description:
Dive bar atmosphere and very insta picture friendly lol 

They have open patio seating and outdoor seating. 

The outdoor seating on weekends is hard to get because of the crowd. And at 10pm they have a dance floor. 

The place is kept very clean. 
Cigar selection is very nice!
author: Lupe H.

description:
First off I have to say I have never had a complaint about cigar bar. I love the atmosphere and and the crowd. But this past Saturday was a different story and I have only one person to blame. The incredibly rude and slowest bartender I have ever seen. He was wearing a brimmed hat and had tattoos on his hand and I think one of those douche I think I'm a cool guy moustaches.
Quick details- it was a busy night but we were helped to a cigar right away when we walked up, as for the bartender we honestly waited almost 20 minutes while he made 1 drink at a time and kept passing me and my group of about 3 guys and 2 girls. Even my gf tried reaching out to him and telling him we have been waiting but he completely ignored us. It was until the manager who looked like she was on top of everything came and saw that we were upset and waiting and spoke to my gf about our insanely long wait, that we got served.
She comped us some drinks for the wait and that's really the only reason I didnt leave 1 star ( I'm leaving 2 stars for now because I'm still pretty disgusted on how the bartender acted, I might change it to 3 stars later when I feel better about the situation)  and wanted to shout out to the manager in this post and say you rock, you were on top of things and handled the situation in a very professional manner and I applaud that. As for that bartender I dont know what stick he had up his behind or if he is normally just rude, slow and full of himself but he needs to recognize he is in customer service and works front of the house ! He didnt even say I'm sorry I am busy but I will be with you shortly. Just a big fat ignore ! 
Take your dumb hat off while your working and act professional if not dont be a bartender, and next time how about you dont make 1 drink at a time when someone orders 3 of the same drink!
author: Angelo G.

description:
Inaugural visit was on Saturday just as they opened. Big space basically a courtyard in the center where all the burning happens with more intimate areas and a long bar inside 
Drinks tapas and cigars... man all they need now is some jazz... oh they have that too, maybe some Latin... oh wait, they have that as well. 
We never got back their later for live salsa and dancing but it will be memorized for future reference. 
Server was attentive and drinks went down way too easy! Will be interesting to see the place when they are packed.
author: Craig G.

description:
Came for a friend's birthday last night and had a great time! The outdoor patio is beautiful and you can bring your own cigars from home (I brought some I got in Cuba). They have matches and a cutter but I would recommend a lighter especially if it's windy.

The food here is really great too! The sweet plantains are BOMB and the servers/bartenders are friendly. I didn't love either of the cocktails I got and they were pricey but overall everything was excellent. Come early to grab a table and stay late for the salsa.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
4 stars is for the bartender who was so friendly and helpful.  She recommended a mild cigar for me and my friend to try. 

I took my friend here after listening to live music at the Boom Boom Room.  She hasn't been here and she likes salsa music.  Plus, her dad used to smoke cigar and this place (the smell) reminded it of him.

The place is divided into 3:
The bar - Order your food and drinks. We were too late and the kitchen was already closed.  I have been here in the past and I know the food is pretty good.
The smoking section - OMG! I used to be a smoker and man, the smell of both cigar and cigarettes were just too much for me. However, for that one night, it was tolerable but we had to leave.  We ended up going to the dance floor.
The dance floor - LOVE, LOVE the music and the energy. The dance floor is a bit small.  Be flexible! I had a woman whipping her long hair left and right and hit me many times.. but it's all good... Toes may get stepped on but just be patient and enjoy yourself.  I will definitely have to go back and try their food again.  

2 stars for their ladies room:  I wanted to suggest to management to have someone check the ladies room often.  It needs to be cleaned and replenished w/ tissue paper.
author: Nerissa D.

description: Coming from my husband who knows his cigar choices, he found it mediocre. Small cigar selection.  But remember it is a bar.  Wonderful ambiance. Would appreciate some music on the Foyer. Im a non smoker so the outside area was grand. Not cold nor smelly. The bar is nice.  The ambiance and the spectacular service was great.  Enjoyed our visit here.
author: Amber M.

description: I found out about this place because of Salsa by the Bay. I've been itching to go dancing and my boyfriend showed this to me so we decided to give it a try. Let me tell you how happy my Cuban/Dominican self was! This place is cool. They have the main bar area, outside seating and then the dance floor area. The dance floor is kind of small which can make it difficult to dance (especially when people are trying to do all these damn fancy salsa spins) so you just have to be careful. It's amazing because it's a live band playing music which made me feel like I was a kid again growing up in Miami. All I could keep telling my boyfriend was how when my mom decides to visit me I'm bringing her tiny little Cuban self here to get her dance on. I also have a brother who is a HUGE cigar aficionado and I'm going to use Cigar Bar as another way to convince him and my sister-in-law to fly out to come visit me. The scene was very diverse from very beginners to intermediated dancers and even just plain ol people like me who grew up dancing it at home and not learned in classes. No one is shy to ask each other to dance and it was not 'stuffy' in there (meaning no one seemed to have a stick up their ass). I only am giving 4 stars for now because I didn't try any food or any of the cigars. Definitely going to come back on another Saturday for salsa but show up earlier to have dinner, drinks and a cigar before the dancing begins.
author: Yochabel U.

description:
Fun place for cigar and salsa! 

This place is pretty big with so many inside and outside seating. The smoking is only allowed outside however they have a few doors connecting you to the outside patio which causes a lot of smoke to come inside. 

It gets very busy on the weekends (closed on sundays) and they charge a cover of $10 after 10 pm. 

We didn't order any food but our bottles of wine were lost and so we had to wait quite a bit for them to bring us a bottle of wine. 

The service is really bad here. From taking your order to delivering your food/beverage, to delivering your check, is just bad across the board.
author: Ghazal P.

description: We went for a day party! Food was good and drinks were even better. The music was a nice mix of 90's music. It is located in the Financial District of SF on Montgomery St. it's a very spacious and nice place. It has two bars one on each side........ i had some chorizo empanadas and my hubby had the lamb & beef skewers both were very tasty.  The lemon drop was real good as well and very steo
author: Rebecca G.

description:
I really love going salsa dancing here on Saturday nights because they have a live salsa band!

I love taking my Dance students here for practice because it's a fun place with a lot of nice people and opportunities for them to practice their dancing in a exciting and upbeat setting.

The women's room is very small, only two stalls so there's always a line once it gets busy but that's very minor compared to the overall experience I have there which is usually very good.

They have a coat check for three dollars an item which is a very reasonable price so you can have your stuff tucked away because there's not really any place to put it in the dancing room.

When you come home you will end up smelling like a cigar including your clothes and hair so make sure you take a shower and wash whatever it is that you wore there but that's only because of the smoking area on the patio which is separate from the dancing so it doesn't affect you.

The bands are usually good and I always have a really great time. Occasionally, they will have a different band play which will be just so-so but that's very rare, nine times out of 10 I have an amazing time. I highly recommend this place for salsa dancing on Saturday nights.
author: Anya B.

description:
Fun place to hang out because there is a little bit of everything for everyone. Cigars, music (and dancing if the music is salsa), and a pool table. There was a live band when I went on a Friday night. If you do mind the smoke, don't sit near the roofless section. 

If this is your first time going, its a bit of a labyrinth. There are a lot of small rooms/sections, and thus hard to navigate if you are trying to find your group.

Have a large party? Order the quesadilla platter and chip platter. Big portions and everyone is happy.

I really enjoyed my pisco sour with an egg white. Delicious.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with some friends for a birthday celebration. This was my first time going to salsa dance, so I didn't really know what to expect. It is definitely a place that has something for everyone and is more of a mature crowd. 

The drinks here are reasonably priced, not sure how much cigars are. They even if have a pool table area if dancing is not your thing. There's a middle courtyard area where everyone smoking cigars sits and hangs out. If you're like me and do not like the smoke, I would avoid this area. The salsa area was my favorite spot, though I don't know how to salsa dance. It was fun to try and I heard they even do lessons here sometimes. Will definitely be looking into that for the future.
author: Lauren P.

description: Decided to explore the cigar world and what better way to do that then at the Cigar Bar. It was date night on a weekend during the day. I had previously brought a cigar because I wanted something light but my gf did purchase one there and they were very helpful. We ordered drinks and food while we smoked cigars on the outside patio area.
author: LasashaM L.

description:
Wow what a cool spot! You really feel transported to Latin America once inside. I'm so glad my friend chose this spot as part of a surprise bachelorette party for our 2 lady friends. She made a reservation for us ahead of time for the special occasion, which I highly recommend or else you have to pay cover in the evening (not sure if it's just Sunday for the salsa dancing). Our night at Cigar was filled with laughter, shots, delicious bites, and upbeat dancing. 

We got a range of things from their menu to share and it was all good. I think it was their plantains that were the highlight for me. 

The dance floor is a hoot whether you're with friends or want to find a stranger to dance with. Everyone is very social and it's awesome watching the "pros" do their thing. 

Highly recommend as a unique San Francisco experience.
author: Emma W.

description:
I am totally a fan of Cigar Bar & Grill. I have never eaten here but i have been few times after hours. I love the sound of Cuban music and people dancing, having such a blast. The drinks are reasonable and it can get super crowded. I was watching the bar area when people were trying to order and they were literally piling on top of each other to get bar tender's attention. 

I love the outside space, its a nice spot to spoke your cigar and hangout. It does tend to get tight there because its literally in between the dance floor and bar, so people come back and forth nonstop. 

What seems great about Cigar Bar, you can order food if you are hungry and yet book a table for a large gathering. I came here with a large group and it is hard to stand around all together because there is simply not enough space sometimes when its a rush hour. 

What i love about this bar is how chill it is. You don't need to jump around the dance floor at all times or around the bar. Here you can hangout, people smoke your cigars and have a conversation.
author: Galya T.

description: While we enjoyed the atmosphere on the patio that had heaters above everywhere, and the bartender was so amazing and cheerful, the cigar supply is comical for a place that cause itself a "cigar bar." My recommendation:. Bring your OWN cigars. The humidor is smaller than what you'll find at many liquor stores and generically stocked and with overpriced cigars. The food - GREAT. The staff - very helpful, upbeat and on top of their game. Just head to your own supplier before coming then enjoy the patio smoking like it's 1980. That's a blast.
author: Candice N.

description: We had an incredibly pleasant experience at Cigar Bar! We are from out of town and the very handsome bartender (Mike) was extremely attentive and made us a very delish dirty martini (extra dirty). 10/10 would recommend!!!
author: Stephanie G.

description: Went to blow off some smoke.....literally!!!!  Always good times at the Cigar Bar & Grill...
author: Stacie J.

description: Brought my wife and a few friends here on a Friday, and we had a blast. We arrived at 9ish, which was really calm and chill. Then, around 10 the live band starts playing. My wife and I danced for a long time and enjoyed the company around us. The crowd there is nice and everyone was having a great time. Can't wait to come back here, maybe even try to have an event at this location.
author: Sam R.

description: Having a great cigar and Manhattan- a great way to start the weekend downtown San Francisco. Later I will start some appetizers and more cocktails. A very comfortable outside patio.
author: Larry C.

description:
As a first timer here, this place really impressed me! This is great to grab a couple of drinks, smoke your cigars (what would it be called if you couldn't do that here?!), and swing yo' hips on the dance floor! They offer a variety of cigars here and cuts em' for ya. At the courtyards they also offer trays and matches too.

We went on salsa night for $10 after 9:30PM FYI. They have live bands playing (and not bad at all actually) in the next room, so smoooooth! Be prepared to get hit by other dancers/couples around you because the floor isn't that big at the volume of people that comes by! I would definitely say it's due to the low ceiling as well that makes it feel cramped. Nonetheless it's really fun here, no judgment!
author: Jia Qi F.

description: Cigar Bar is a local favorite! Not only are the drinks and cigars reasonable and come with amazing music & atmosphere...the food is surprisingly delicious!  This is a great spot for taking friends and family, as well as colleagues and can be rented out for Private Events! Great venue and central location...BEST SALSA DANCING!
author: Ellie J.

description:
I'm not a smoker, but I was meeting some friends here for happy hour. Had an okay drink. Didn't order anything else on the happy hour menu but my friends were having a good time. 

They have a cool little outdoor plaza. I think I also read they do salsa night. Maybe I'll be back for that?

This place isn't for me because I am not fond of the smell of it is a lovely place!
author: Lynn C.

description:
Basically, anywhere that lets me smoke and drink at the same time is a winner. I realise that's an undesirable preference, but I am nothing if not honest with myself about my vices. 

Love the courtyard, for above reasons, but most especially since they sometimes have live musicians. Last time we went there was a fab set of folks playing gypsy jazz and more. It's also really pleasantly laid out--I'm a fan of the fountain and the decor. Makes me feel like I'm on holiday.

I've only snacked there the one time, and mostly just drank the cheapest beer, but the prices are decent. I also recall that the burger and fries was p tasty! Always had nice interactions with the staff there too.
author: Rowena H.

description: A friend of mine highly recommended this Cigar Bar. I called to make reservations, once I had a time set, I was able to then call back an hour later and push the reservations back even later. There wasn't a table big enough for our party, so the waiter brought us a table from inside. Everyone there worked really hard to make our night enjoyable. They have live music, which isn't too loud. They have a small selection of cigars and they are overpriced.  But, you are able to bring your own cigars and they don't charge you, which I could appreciate. We will definitely be back! Great night!
author: Leesa A.

description:
Great atmosphere and friendly people. Good to find a place with lots of live music. 

I would give it 5 stars except the food and drinks, which were highly inconsistent and mediocre. There were lots of ingredients missing, and specific drink requests were quietly ignored.
author: Dan G.

description: What a surprise this place was.  Went in for a cigar and was blown away.  Had outdoor seating that was between several buildings. The tacos were mind-boggling.   At 10 pm Fri  a live legitimate Cuban band set up and salsa dancing began to rock this place.  I ended up staying all night.  5 Stars - Brady Bunte
author: Brady B.

description: Horrible food and service.  Everything is overpriced.  Queseda burned.  Ahi tuna is cooked not raw. Only place that charges for refill of soda, and soda was all ice.  Place smells horrible.  Save your money.  Staff are rude too!
author: Patricia D.

description: Great atmosphere, not a big selection of food on menu but plenty cigars & great bar!  I went during the day around opening time so it was kinda empty but i hear the live band music is great at night
author: Aaris S.

description:
Came here for a Domo / MichaelForce event after dreamforce and I had a lot of fun.    I had a cigar outside and had their Don Julio 1942 and Highland Park 18.   So the elite Scotch Whiskey and the elite Tequila.   

I love the ambiance was great with the outside seating and stools on the barrels and the wait staff was really nice and attentive.
author: Homer S.

description:
Came here for Paint Nite and I was really surprised how good the food was. I was skeptical in the beginning but I'm glad I was able to try it! If you're not a fan of Cigars, I wouldn't come here cause you can definitely smell the cigar smoke which I wasn't too crazy about. 

Although the service was great and I've only tried two dishes here which was really good. I recommend getting the ahi poke with plantain chips and the cheese/meat plate! Happy hour is from M-F between 4-7PM.
author: Jenn L.

description:
My girlfriends wanted to do something chill for St Patrick's Day. Not wanting to deal with the crowds, we decided on Cigar Bar as it has a nice roomy patio. We showed up on Thursday, March 17th around 6pm. All the tables were taken except a small two top. We started as a party of 6-7 and made it work until another table freed up.

Happy hour is Monday through Thursday, 4pm-7pm. They offer $2 off all draft beer, $5 glasses of sangria, $7 specialty cocktails, $2 off all small bites and 10% off all bottles of wine. We all decided to order a couple of small bites since it was HH.

Happy hour:
*Chicken "nuggets": chipotle barbeque sauce, cilantro ranch ($8) x2
*Deviled eggs: tomatillo, black bean, pickled jalapeno, chorizo ($8)
*Papas bravas: crispy kennebec potatoes, spicy tomato & garlic aioli ($6)

I loved the chicken nuggets. The weren't conventional nuggets. More like lightly battered chicken strips. The chicken was tender and the breading was crunchy. The papas bravas were okay. Kind of like giant steak fries, but crispy on the outside. I'm more of a fan of thinner fries. I didn't try the deviled eggs, but people seemed to enjoy them.

We ended up staying for quite a while, so we drank many, many glasses of the Non offensive white wine special ($7 glass). It was crisp and easy to drink. Later on, I let someone talk me into a shot of Jameson ($7) and a bottle of Ommegang ($7). How could I say no?! It was St Patrick's day!

Fun place to hang out on a nice day. I really liked the patio. If I was with friends that smoked cigars, I may have had one, but I had fun just drinking and hanging out. Great place to celebrate a day dedicated to drinking!
author: Elena N.

description:
Just a block up from Bocadillos, I love the area this place is located in. I came here for a Cal alumni happy hour event and enjoyed the vibe of the place. I didn't get to try the food/cigars here but the drinks are made well. It's nice since they can break up the place into 4 different areas (the bar, cigar/outdoor room, dining room, and small room by the bathroom). It's a nice place to hang out with people and by dividing the spaces like this you can easily find a place to get away from the noise or the smoke. 

I definitely have to come back to try the happy hour menu and the cigars.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
I had fun at Cigar Bar and was there for a good friend's bday celebrations. We went for the Friday night salsa which was poppin! It was so poppin that the salsa room was utterly hot and sweaty! I have never sweat so much in California! 

We didn't last longer than 45 minutes dancing salsa with all the heat.... and the smoke

Oh yea, that's right- Cigar Bar is better if you actually like cigars and don't mind being amidst tobacco smoke. I can't stand tobacco ! You might have more fun if you don't mind the scent or smoke yourself. But don't do that! It's bad for you- your lungs turn black and your tastebuds grow dull and that would lead to you giving worse Yelp reviews or demanding more spices on your food to bring out the flavor- and we don't want any of that. 

Annnnywhooo- we did eat dinner there before the salsa and had some drinks. All were good!
author: Nani B.

description: The music is beautiful but there is a $10 cover on Saturdays and $3 coat check per item (I.e. purse, coat, scarves, etc.) in SF it should be expected to carry a coat all year around... shouldn't be as pricey in my opinion.
author: Jeanette D.

description: Fun place for salsa dancing- Saturday nights! You definitely don't need to be a smoker to have a good time here. Drinks are priced reasonably as well. I will definitely be back!
author: Prabhjot S.

description: Super cool place with live music, different areas and atmospheres, has a classic feel to it and maybe an older/more mature crowd but it's fun, lively and it has class. Definitely a good place to drink good cocktails and have a fun night.
author: Martino P.

description: Terrible service. It's busy but it doesn't explain missing or taking incorrect orders. Live music is nice but it doesn't offset the service.
author: Dan P.

description:
I rate their Salsa Nights a 5 STAR and their food & drinks  a solid 3 STAR - thus average it at 4. 

Please See Photos :) 


The Pina Loca is by far the best and perhaps the only drink that was memorable. You'll love the smokey hint blended in Pineapple delight. Food is good and the service was very attentive and beyond professional from a young girl who was Mexican/Filipino.
author: Lesley M. C.

description:
LOVE the live Salsa bands on the weekends. Even if you don't dance, it's a great place for live music. The crowd is an interesting mix of beginner and advanced dancers, who mostly do LA Style Salsa. I've danced with some really, really good leaders here--some who seem like professionals. :)

If you are sensitive to smoke, this place is probably not for you. The dance area is next to the smoking court yard, and I always leave smelling like smoke!
author: Tenzin K.

description: What a fun place for dancing and not so typical SF pricey drinks! Kinda gives me the NYC vibes with the open courtyard in between the bar and the dancefloor. It was a great band playing the night we were there, I just didn't get the name. Good drinks was had and sweated our asses off dancing to good music. The cover was $10 which isn't so bad and the band got everyone off their seats so it was worth it. The drinks were stiff and not bad for the price of an SF bar. Thankfully the courtyard is open where everyone can smoke because I probably would've died if I got suffocated with all the smoke smell. Cigar smell isn't so bad but the cigarette smell is what I can't stand.
author: Candice J.

description:
Cigar Bar is a great date spot. I went on a Wednesday evening around 7:30. You pick your own seat outside and there are plenty of heat lamps.

For San Francisco, everything is reasonably priced for a date spot, which isn't saying anything. 

The chips and salsa and polenta were great. Live jazz music came on around 8, and the band was great and played at a tasteful volume for conversation and enjoyment. As the name suggests, people smoke cigars outside, so there is a bit of tobacco in the air. It wasn't overwhelming, though.
author: Rishi S.

description: Cute little hidden nook with a lovely outdoor patio for late night conversations under the stars. Great selection of some finer whiskeys, perhaps more extraordinary for a foreigner like me who's not as familiar with American regional specialty whiskeys. Friendly attentive service and fine cigars / tobacco products to boot...
author: Fiona F.

description: Awesome spot in the financial district. The sticks are extremely pricey tho so be prepared to be shocked lol. Great selection of Scotch  nice place to chill before a night out in town. Must stop here.
author: Michael M.

description:
My review is for salsa night!  

Showed up on a Friday night around 10:30. There was no line. $10 cover and they accepted both cash and card. 

I had never been to Cigar Bar in the past, so it was kinda hard to tell where salsa night was taking place. Upon first waking in there's a bar and you can't hear the live salsa band from here at all since it's taking place two rooms over. I kinda like the set up though. First room for drinks and playing pool. Second section is outdoors for socializing and smoking cigars. 3rd section is for salsa! 

I went with a few of my girlfriends and had an awesome time! It was my second time ever salsa dancing, so when the first guy approached me to dance I was like uhh.. I don't really know how lol. But he was super nice, showed me a few things, then off to the dance floor! The guys there were great at leading us beginners. Very respectful with their approach as well. The live band was great! I forgot who they were. There's a bar in the salsa section, so no need to relocate to the first bar for drinks. 

The only things that bothered me were:
1. No one was working at the coat check station, so we had to leave our coats on a bench in the corner. Luckily, there were no theft problems. 
2. Smelling like smoke after leaving. lol I know it's a cigar bar. I should've known. But I'll still be back!
author: Mary O.

description: Had a good time with some friends first time there had dinner played some pool watch the game wonderful evening in San Francisco definitely will go back would have gave them a 5-star but they ran out of a dish that I enjoy that evening
author: Eddie G.

description:
The Cigar Bar and Grill was the first place I visited on my anthropological studies of Earth. Having read much of "bars" in my human arts and culture courses as an undergradling, I was excited for my first experience with this seeming bedrock of civilization.

Upon entering the human drinking chamber, or "bar" as it is known colloquially due to the well known and understood limitations on the species' vocabulary variance, I was greeted with cheer by what I believe to be the chamber's Chief Alchemist. She introduced herself to us as Mariah, and according to my studious observation she appears to be the chaperon of the state altering spirit journey the human patrons pay her to guide. Our chemical cocktail did not have a name, but it was supposedly reminiscent of a fruit known on Earth as a "pineapple," and allegedly her own witchcraft. According to my research, this varies from most human drinking chambers where patrons are confined to the potions listed on what is known as a "menu." Mariah's alchemy appears to be superior in this regard.

We thank Mariah for her assistance with our studies, as this preliminary ethnographic research will surely provide inspiration for future work in the field. Upon my return to my home planet, I will be requesting a grant for additional research conducted at The Cigar Bar and Grill on a behavior that appears to occur regularly in its back room: human courting rituals. Or as it is known on Earth, "dancing."

- Klorp
author: Tamar K.

description:
A couple of friends of mine brought me here when we all went out a couple nights ago and I was pretty interested in trying out cigar or two. I've only tried a cigar once before so the whole thing is new to me. 

Not really a fan of it. I generally don't enjoy smoke at all so this wasn't an exception. However, this place had a cool, hip, laid back ambiance that was unique.

They also served food there. I was a little tipsy so decided to try out their mushroom pasta dish to sober up a bit and it sounded delicious. Took a long time for just for me to get my order in and the food took even longer to come out. 

The entire staff seemed disorganized and not as efficient as they should be. I had to flag down a waitress when I wanted to order, if my food was still coming, and when I was ready to pay the bill. That's a lot of work just for a plate of pasta. 

When the food finally came out, it looked great! Unfortunately, it didn't taste as good as it looked. Noodles were undercooked and it lacked sauce which I thought tasted pretty good. The part that annoyed me though was the lump of green that was placed in the middle of the pasta that would not separate. I literally had to eat it as a chunk - weird. 

Overall, if you're into cigars and enjoy a nice place to have drunk conversations then this place is the spot for you. They even have salsa dancing and the live band is awesome. 

Would I be back? Yes, but I'll just enjoy a drink next time and hold out on the food.
author: Michael T.

description:
The Cigar bar is definitely one of my favorite bars in the city.

As far as the libations are concerned, the quality is good, accompanied by a friendly personnel.

I have been to this establishment a handful of times and the only reason I keep coming back is the following: they had an outdoor patio where you can freely smoke.
Obviously, if you are one of those people that can't stand the smell of smoke, the inside sections protect customers from the outside fumes.

Overall, always a fun experience.
author: Mr. Food G.

description: I walk into the Cigar Bar on a weekend evening is like walking into a different country. Once past the admission door ($10 after 10p) you decent into a dim bar den and beyond is a open-air courtyard filled with eager cigar aficionados (or that's at least what they looked like to me) eagerly puffing away. In an adjacent room, and 6- or 8- piece Latin band is jamming away busting out modern and classic takes on salsa, rumba, cha cha cha, etc. The medium-sized dance floor is usually full, but there always seems to be room for one more couple The best thing to do, really, is to dance. Take a few lessons or fake it-- no one will really notice-- but get out there and shake that booty. You won't regret it. As for the cocktails, they are fairly prices at around $10, and not too sweet. My suggestion: substitute mezcal into the Tequila Tears drink and just stick to that all night. Yum. Looking forward to my next return. And hopefully the salsa lessons will pay off even more.
author: Brian J.

description:
We got to the bar early and had drink and appetizers: stuffed dates, chicken wings and tostones. They were actually better than I had read on these reviews. The drinks were solid. The service was friendly and prompt until it got crowded. We looked for our waiter in the bar and outside to pay the bill but couldn't locate him. So we left our table to dance. Mid dance, our waiter found us. 
We stayed on for the Latin Jazz band and danced until we couldn't stand. Super fun! 

My husband forgot his phone on a table and didn't realize it till we left so we drove back and hoped we'd find it. The guys who took our table turned it in to the bartenders. Thanks guys, you're sweet! All in all a great night! 

We'll be back!
author: Karla B.

description: We went to the Cigar Bar because our favorite jazz band was playing - Dmitri Matheny Group, and we loved it. We had dinner during the show and everything was tasty. The wine selection was good and acoustics for the band were spot on. Nice place!
author: Shelley C.

description: Sangria is less than mediocre. Food was okay. Monitors were bleh.but there's not many places you can go to enjoy a cigar. The night life is fun and the music is always popping!!
author: Lupita R.

description: Nice relaxing spot! Great for a short night out with friends and co workers. I would most def come back I'm back in town.
author: Brittany J.

description:
First, I want to commend Matt for making it so easy for me to plan and arrange my sister's 30th birthday. We did everything through email. I always have a million and one questions, and he answered them ALL (not like others who skip right over questions...super annoying!). 

Second, I want to commend our server, Sean. He was fantastic and took such good care of my group the entire night. Thanks Sean - you were awesome and The Cigar Bar is lucky to have you. 

Ok, on to the details of the night...
Food: I planned for 12 of my friends to dine. I didn't want to deal with the whole splitting of checks or figuring out who ate what, so I love that they require family style ordering for groups of 10 or more. Perfect. I chose the following from the event menu: 
Salad; Bread; Chicken; Steak (chimichurri); Fish; Penne Pesto Pasta; and Asparagus. The proteins were served as 8 half portions (you have the option of serving them as 4 full - but I recommend the halves since people usually like to try everything). It was all DELICIOUS! Most of us are foodies, and we loved everything we tried. My mostly vegetarian friend even tried the meats b/c she was so curious and loved them!

Ambiance: We arrived at 6:30 on Saturday night, and it was fairly empty with the exception of a few folks at the bar. We were seated in the dining room next to the bar. It was great because we were alone for a while. It started to fill up closer to 8pm. I loved the atmosphere here! It's just...so cool! Yes, you can smell cigar smoke the whole night (even though smoking is only allowed in the patio). But I didn't mind it at all and neither did anyone in my group. The people were so chill here, even on the dance floor. So it didn't feel at all like the creepy vibe I usually get from some people at other clubs (back when I'd go clubbing). 

Service: Like I said above, Sean was awesome. He kept checking on us and he would ask me when I wanted to start serving. We brought 3 bottles of wine ($18 corkage fee for each - a bit high but that's the city and worth it to bring what you like) and he was attentive to keeping our glasses filled, as well as other drinks. I also brought a cake, which he promptly put in the fridge for me. He then served it for us and even added the candles (which was awesome and not expected!). If I have to have any con for the night, it's that I wish the table would have been cleared off. It was piled with plates and glasses the whole time, so I kept trying to stack things to make space for us all to just talk and chill.  

Salsa dancing: I can't recall the instructor's name, but he was great! Our classes were included since we dined there, but I believe they are usually $15. This was a fun thing to do with our group, since most of us love to dance. Classes start around 8:45pm or so and go through 9:40pm. They then open the dance floor to all. It does get pretty full, but I'd rather a full floor than an empty one (b/c honestly, who wants to dance then?). 

Thanks to everyone at the Cigar Bar who made this night special for my sister. She was so happy and thoroughly enjoyed her night. All my friends have been talking about the great time they had too!
author: Karen G.

description: Great live music nice patio area, dance floor is a little small, great place to enjoy a nice cigar and a great drink
author: Ultima M.

description: Great place for some dancing and drinks! Went with group and they were very accommodating in splitting our check multiple ways. Will be back for the Sunday dance party.
author: Laura R.

description:
The , crowd is great, good liquor and cigars (from Dominican Republic) if you come here to dance salsa on Sunday's get ready to be some how disappointed due to a DJ that only plays 90% Regeton ,salsaton and the other 20% is just boring music.

I guess The cover is for the band but they hardly play an hour.
author: Oswaldo T.

description: Great spot to smoke a cigar in San Francisco. Great staff and very fair drink prices. Bring your own cigars with no cut fee.
author: Jared P.

description: Had a great time at this place! Such amazing live music and great dancers all over the dance floor. One thing I did not like however was the coat check fee. We live in San Francisco, it is expected to carry around a coat, scarf, purse, etc and I believe with the 10 dollar cover there should be a free coat check or even just a flat fee of 3 dollars for your personal items. Other than that, Ahh-mazing place to dance the night away!
author: Eli K.

description:
This Friday was my wife and I first time there. The food was great and the drinks at happy hour was delicious! However,  it took almost 40 minutes for my second drink which began to piss me off! After complaining about the wait to the manager ( Matt ), he apologized and compt our drinks and gave us a round on the house! Even though at first as the night was a disaster, Matt made our night enjoyable.  
We will definitely return and recommend this place to friends and Family!

Mahalos Matt
author: Michael C.

description:
Ambiance: Came on a weeknight and it was pretty busy, but there were no lines and we were seated promptly. It's REALLY loud in here with the music and conversations though and was difficult to even hear the person next to you. So, not ideal for large groups unless you were coming to listen the live music or dance (which obviously is the point here; we just didn't know). The live music was a nice addition to the evening and we enjoyed ourselves very much. We sat inside and didn't feel too overcome by the tobacco smoke from outside.

Service: This was the only area in which I feel they were lacking. At first, our waiter was attentive but then eventually...he just disappeared. I ended up having to ask a totally different person for another round of drinks and food.

Food: I can't comment on the drinks here because I didn't have any, but I didn't hear any complaints from my group. As for the food, it was so yum!
-Chips and Salsa and Guac: The salsa and guac were fresh. Could have used some more seasoning. The chips are thin and crispy and have some seasoning on them.
-Chicken "nuggets": These were amazing. Crispy pieces of actual breast meat and full of flavor. Came with some BBQ sauce and cilantro ranch.
-Fries: thin and crispy. We loved these.
-Fried shishito peppers: Some were hot and others weren't, but overall these were a hit with the group. Crispy and different! These are not breaded.
author: Susan G.

description: I am just going to say to everyone, specially girls, be aware of your belongings since I was there last night and my phone got stolen also my firends phone plus other two girls that were there. So I want to warn people so they don't have our bitter experience. Also the manager in charge care less about our situation of lost in his estabilshment! Too bad this things hapens in a place where we were having a great time.
author: Paola C.

description:
Trekking out to the city from the East Bay on a Saturday night isn't always the easiest thing, especially if you have kids, but my wife told me to go out with the boys and since we're too old to do the club scene, we wanted to do something that's more age appropriate.

Lets go drink WHISKEY and smoke CIGARS!

We get here around 10pm, and there's a line out the door. An older couple are practicing their awesome dance moves while we wait, but the line moved fairly fast. Pay a $10 cover and BAM, the place was flooded with people waiting at the bar, standing outside smoking cigars, people looking like us trying to figure out how this place works, and sounds of salsa music playing in the other room/dance floor. Bathrooms were fairly small considering how packed this place was, but its not a problem for us guys. The bar was packed, and the bartenders were scrambling from taking and processing orders to helping people get cigars out of their humidor. That whole process led to a lot of confusion, but eventually figured it out. Great selections of scotch, whiskeys, and tequilas... didn't pay attention to anything else.

We found a small area to post against and get our grown man on, and continually dodging and moving to let people walk past. I probably had about 4 people rub against my lit cigar so I'm sorry if I left a burn mark or ash all over your clothes or jacket. Definitely a good older crowd, with cougars hitting on all the foreigners that were there. 

I would actually love to come back here with my wife and find a table, order some food, drinks and bring my own cigars from home to smoke.
author: Jason L.

description: Great environment, and must visit and see to check if your list in the bay. Make sure you enjoy a cigar, a nice drink to compliment it and then go for a twirl on the dance floor for live salsa!
author: Tiffany A.

description:
For your own safety don't go to this place. My phone was stolen there!!!
I went with my friend and when we arrived, some guys there gave us their seats and tables because "they were going to be dancing all the time". I took my phone to take some selfies and then I took it into my purse. So I went to dance just one song and when I came back to the table my purse was open and my phone was gone!!!! the guys that were next to us also disappeared. Coincidence? I think not, they were just watching us and waiting us to be distracted. I talked to the manager and he didn't nothing he just said " it's not the first time" what a f)$&! He said so lightly. Of course these guys are going to come back if they don't get caught !
author: Yaz V.

description:
Nice place to hang out in, with good food, great drinks, with a professional vibe.  Awesome place to go for happy hour after work, due to good pricing.  My friends and I shared one cigar, which was different.  The waitress helped us pick one out based on our requirements.    

The staff and bartender are super friendly and great to chat with.  I've been here several times, and have enjoyed every since visit.
author: Dana C.

description:
My visit was a bit rocky. I was at the bar trying to order a few drinks and the bar tender lady with curly black hair ignored us for 20 minutes! She made eye contact and I even said what I was ordering twice but maybe since I wasn't a guy she wasn't interested In serving me because I kept getting ignored  everytime a male came up. Its a bit bizzare that a bar tender who was off his shift had to get her attention and order my drinks since she wants helping. That was helpful since she didn't care to do her job. 
After that episode the night turned up better since the music was fantastic and of course the bar tender by the dance floor were attentive. Never the less I had a blast after my drink and will surely come back but possibly order my drinks from the other bar.
author: Gardenia H.

description: Came here for the first time for the night life it was ok not to bad the bartender in the first bar as I came in was very rude. As I go on to the dance floor the bar there was great I don't dance salsa but was there just trying something new .
author: Scarlett G.

description: It is not a Cigar Bar, the drinks are not good. The staff does not know anything about cigars. The worst part is the live music is great and is keeps them open.
author: antonio g.

description: Loved loved this place. I don't smoke Cigars but my hubby does and this place has an outdoor area with heaters and live music. They don't serve and food after 7pm I think but the waitress was kind enough to steer us elsewhere for a light meal. They have a lot of seating outside and a covered area that's facing the courtyard.
author: Lorna N.

description:
The only reason I came across this place is that my friend, who is a smoker, wanted to find somewhere where she could sit outside and puff away while we chatted, drank and ate. This was the closest and most interesting option that she found, so we came. The ambiance is quite cool and we sat outside by a lovely fountain, which was great until the crazy SF wind made an uninvited appearance. Everyone around us was smoking, mostly cigars, as the name of the bar anticipated, but I was not bothered at all (I used to be a smoker so I kind of dug the atmosphere).

I had one of their draft beers and that was quite ok. My friends had ordered the cheese plate and also the nacho portion (this last one is sooooo big that the waitress actually told us she has never seen anyone finish it before, which makes me think it's just plain silly to serve so much food knowing it's gonna go to waste)! But hey, I guess lots of people dig oversized food portions so I just have to deal with my distaste for it.

I ended up ordering a pasta dish, since there were not that many options. It came with pesto and some peppers, and although it was not bad, it was pretty boring, lacked sauce and was a bit overcooked. Nevertheless, I was happy to eat it. Prices were not too friendly, but that was to be expected. As we left we had quite a fun chat with the guy who works at the door, and he was very nice and helpful. Overall, I'd say this is a good spot if you wanna grab a drink, some snacks and, of course, smoke away. Otherwise, don't bother.
author: Gabriele J.

description: The live music at this place is awesome. Tap beers and appetizers here give you a lot of options to choose from, all are worth a try!
author: H. T.

description: This is a classy bar to get your dance on! I love the live band and good dancers.  As a single female, I met a lot of men here.  I met my current boyfriend here! (We are in love and have been together for 1 year and 4 months.) Most of the men smoke cigars and don't know how to dance, but dancing is a great ice-breaker and way to start a conversation.  It gets crowded.  Great way to meet people!
author: Brenna F.

description: I loved loved loved this place, the environment, the music, the people, the food. This should be always a first option if you are looking for a place where you can dance and be able to talk and drink. 100% recommended
author: Fernanda A.

description:
Nice idea - cigars, drinks, and live salsa. Pretty unique in San Francisco!

While I'm not a smoker, I'm an occasional drinker. I enjoyed my Gin&Tonic there, wondered around the ground floor which includes a humidor, headed over to the large outdoor patio and saw smokers mingling, and finally arrived at the dance floor where an impressive amount of people swung their hips to the tunes of the salsa band.

It wasn't overly crowded on a Friday night so if you look for a bar with dance floor, this is a good choice.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
The cigar bar is some kind of special! 

Because not many bars have a heated open air courtyard like this (perfect for cigar and cigarette smokers)

Not many bars feature a fully stocked humidor. 

Not many bars offer salsa nights on the weekends in an otherwise dead neighborhood of Jackson Square. 

The Spanish style decor adds to the cool ambiance, but you know what? the cocktail list sucks! Stick to your plain G&T and watch the scene. There's lots of it here!
author: Janice C.

description: Ive come here before for drinks and dancing. We came this day and the place was dead no one was here but yet they hit  us up for the $10 cover fee for about 1 hr of music. My drink was a mojito and it was pretty bad. The guys had better luck with their shots. 3 stars for the live music that is always really good. The bartender this night major attitude and just plain rude. Even when Im sure she needed more tips since the place was empty.  She didnt help any with the whole  scene.
author: Theresa G.

description: So on Saturday October 18th I attended a private party for a special young lady and as everyone finally started to gather around the table I decided that a bottle of bubbly for the first toast was in order. So I asked the two staff members to assist me with that and they provided all of the champagne flutes and a bucket with the bubbly! I specifically asked that no one in the group be billed for this small gesture! After everyone was done with the toast I asked our server to bring me the bill. They came back with a bill and a credit card and something did strike me funny about the credit card and looking back because the only thing I had was a sip of sparkling wine that what was different was that there was no gold lettering on the credit card and yet I still immediately in order to pay the bill put the credit card back in my wallet and even though something was telling me something was amiss I focused on the festivities! At some point a patron complained that she had not received her credit card and demanded they locate it. It was in my wallet and they finally figured out that I was the one that had the credit card, the problem with that is they did not bring me back my credit card! So from an hour and a half to close to two hours I had no idea and neither did they where my credit card was! Even after I finally demanded that I get my credit card immediately it was still another 20 minutes before they finally returned my credit card! So for close to two hours I had no idea how many hands my credit card had passed through! What I am absolutely sure of is that this business overextended themselves and in order to reach a greater profit they booked all the private parties they could but did not bother to staff up! As a result of that the staff was obligated to take up the slack and our server Katy was amazing but you could  see that she was running flat-out and somebody decided they were going to jump in and complete transactions not knowing who the patrons were and who's credit cards went where! So I received someone else's bill and also someone else's credit card! I have had the luxury of dining out 7 days a week for the last 25 years I go into just about every four and five star restaurant in the city and I have both large and small parties! I have never experienced this lack of professionalism! This was sheer and absolute carelessness on the part of management! The server who attended to our every need every moment she had a chance (her name is Katie) came over and apologized profusely even though I know she was not the one that lost the credit card! So this episode took place on Saturday night and on Sunday afternoon I left a message for Matt to call me I was respectful and courteous Matt is the general manager I did not receive a call back! I called again on Monday again I did not receive a call back! At that point I decided that I needed to call my bank because I did not know if my card had been breached and compromised! Security was definitely lax at this place of business! So in looking at my bank account online this morning I noticed that I was charged twice! There are two separate charges! I feel terrible for the young server because Everywhere I Go Everywhere I conduct personal or business-related Gatherings everyone knows that I usually leave a 50% tip regardless of the amount! The waterbar can certainly attest to that! I did similar on the first bill and when I received the second bill I did sign it but I left no tip! My plan was to talk to Matt the general manager at which point I assumed I would get some minor apology for the inconvenience because after they did that I was no longer in a festive mood! It took me an hour and a half to stop worrying that my credit card was being used somewhere! I had hoped that after speaking with the general manager that I could drop an envelope for Katie thanking her for working so very hard! I lament the fact that she lost a nice tip because of the incompetence of the team! I've attended a number of political events there because it is the place chosen by the number one political consulting firm in the city 50 plus one. My Hope Is Never to have to go back there again given that there are so many top notch businesses that serve any type of libation and food fit for Foodies! I unfortunately had to cancel my credit card with my bank and I now have the inconvenience of not having the ability to use that credit card until the new one arrives! So I have to establish a new balance on one of the other credit cards which is a great inconvenience to me!
author: Jim S.

description: This place is awesome! I had a date last weekend here and I loved how they have it all in one place!  We had dinner and drinks at the restaurant side.  Smoked some good cigars on the patio, which feels like you still inside since your surrounded by the building.  Then dance to a live salsa band.  Everyone was really friendly and we had great service, even with it being a packed house.  I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Sophia A.

description:
I was just here celebrating a birthday with my cousins and husband over the weekend. I have to admit, it was not what I expected. The food was absolutely amazing!!!! My cousins are picky eaters and even they liked it all. I kept my drinks simple (mojito's) I rarely drink but these were pretty good. 

Around 10pm we went over to the salsa area, this is kind of where our buzz went down. If you know salsa (this wasn't it). 

Overall, I had a good time here. The service was good, food good. Only thing we didn't like was the music. I would come back though.
author: Jessica P.

description: This is a great little place to get some drinks, smoke a cigar or two and chat with friends. The courtyard style seating is really what makes the place for me.
author: Mahesh L.

description: I went here to get a cigar for a friends birthday. The cigar selection was small. Well that disappointed me but the club didn't. Great live music and salsa dancing. Lively and contagious fun. Got to have some food there which was also yummy. The night turned out well in this small version of Havana
author: Martha E.

description: Favorite bar in the city. Love the layout, live music & salsa! A night out at cigar bar is a guaranteed good night.
author: Talya R.

description: Came here for late night drinks with some colleagues. Seemed like a pretty big place with tons of seating. I'm not really into cigars, but it was a cool ambiance. Happy hour seems happening here, so I'll have to give that (especially the food) a try some other time. Very casual vibe. I did not feel anything special about this place, but I'm willing to give it another try!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I hope management takes this review seriously. 

First of all someone was sucking dick in the ladies restroom, not sure if that's a pro or a con...

Secondly bartenders were very rude, specifically Leo. The doorman holds your ID in a drawer as collateral and you pay the $10 cover at the bar downstairs. When leaving I asked the doorman for my ID, they told me to ask the bartender; bartender Leo tells me I have to pay the cover to get my ID but I explain I've already paid, he says I have to talk to the doorman; doorman tells me to talk to the bar; bartender Leo then says he doesn't have my ID and accuses me of losing my own ID (wait, what?); bartender Leo and doorman refuse to help me further and tell me to "come back tomorrow when you're sober."

Why did I come to this bar? Why am I first told that I have to pay to get my ID back, then moments later told they don't have my ID at all, then I'm accused of being too drunk? Why is Leo so hostile?
author: Claude M.

description:
I came here for paintnite with my bf around 6:30 pm, not too many people, self seating. They have a pool table in the back for $1 so bring quarters! They have a room with sit down tables, another room with a few couches, and then a large patio middle where people can smoke their cigars and enjoy their meal. 

We ordered the ceviche, meatballs with garlic bread, and the hanger steak.  The ceviche was excellent, I liked how they had bits of mangoes in it. The meatballs were just ok. The hanger steak was really good but I don't know if it was worth the $17. It came sliced med rare on top of some greens and mashed potatoes. We also ordered a big bucket of their garlic shoe string fries which I absolutely loved! For drinks he got a bottled cider and I got a pineapple/fruity cocktail that was good, you could hardly taste the alcohol but it did the deed.
author: Linz C.

description:
Normally when I go to a bar and don't even have a drink is hard to give a review, in this case I have no choice but giving one star to a very very bad service:
I arrive here for a happy hours with a lot of friends. Happy hour was finishing in 5 minutes when we all try to order together but the bar attender asks to make one order at a time...BIG MISTAKE! After 5 people ordering and waiting for their drinks he gets to me and say:SORRY Happy hour finished 2 minutes ago! Now seriously who can be that rude after making me wait on purpose there and not making me order!
BAD SERVICE! I ended up walking away because too upset!
author: Irina P.

description: This place is awesome! Came here for a birthday party on Sunday and had a wonderful time! Drank tons of Jack Daniel's and smoked a beautiful Romeo y Julietta. Definitely coming back here again!
author: Rodney D.

description: Came back again recently and although the ambiance is always nice, the service, not so much. We had a waitress named Caroline who was good at first and then she just completely forgot about us towards the end! She didn't tell us that she was leaving for a break, she messed up our order and we literally had to ask a bus boy if he had any idea where she went. The people next to us arrived hours after we had been there and apparently Caroline knew them because they greeted her with hugs and kisses and of course she was prompt on bringing them their order. Terrible! Hopefully you don't get her as a waitress.
author: This Is M E.

description:
I went for a Latin day party and it was a really nice place. The staff is very friendly and although there wasn't a huge crowd they were well staffed at both bars. 

Once off the dance floor there was a really nice courtyard area between the two bars to grab some fresh air. 

Will definitely check it out again!
author: Lourdes R.

description: I had a horrible time at this bar. The live music was not even playing when I went in. Barely any alcohol options. The seat were so far away from the live music. Honestly an awful experience. The workers were extremely disrespectful and were not welcoming at all.
author: Maria A.

description:
I went here for the first time in early May (my review is obviously overdue).  As a serious cigar smoker (2 - 4 a day) I have several regular spots in the Bay Area that I frequent.  I knew of this place but had just not made it since I had a rotation for years (with my primary spot on Santana Row in the South Bay and Occidental in SF).  Anyway, I very much enjoyed the atmosphere here and the live salsa music that night.  I did not have any food so cannot comment on the food.  

There cigar selection was limited but it is ok to bring your own.  I would have given this place 4 stars but the pours on the Scotch were weak.  The MaCallan 18 was way overpriced, especially for the pour (not even a 2 finger pour).  The Balvenie 17 and Obahn was a little better on price, but again a weak pour.  Regarding the Scotch it worked out to about $8-$12 a sip.

I will probably go back, but will do mixed drinks. A bit frustrating as I love Scotch or Wiskey with a cigar.
author: Don G.

description: What a mess there!  The service is beyond terrible and the drinks are mediocre. We were there on a Friday late afternoon for Happy Hour and were hoping to stay for the salsa band later. It took us over 20 minutes  to order our drinks at the bar. The bartender was right in front of us ignoring us the whole time. When we finally ordered and opened a tab we sat down and asked a waitress for a menu to order some food. She never came back!  I went and got a menu and my friend told her again to come to our table for us to order. We waited for over an hour  and she never came. I tried to go back to the bar to order a beer since the margarita wasn't good and the line didn't move in over 10 minutes.  The same bartender was ignoring the people right in front of him.  We will never come back to this place again!  Stay away please...
author: Paula A.

description:
I don't smoke so my review won't apply to the cigar part. 

Some kind of small "hidden gem" feeling when you arrives on the interior patio. 
Great selection of drinks, good group food platters and live music. Will be back.
author: Lionel F.

description: Had at least 5 types of Cheese here, all taste amazing, and I bet other foods are awesome too. We were having a event in C5O room near the garden area. Absolutely great. It's was a also cal networking didn't use much facilities there, other than the open bar, but they have projectors, and many things available. This is definitely a high-end, joyful place to stay. Cannot wait to come back.
author: Donna Z.

description:
Came here for a.... let's call it a club meeting. 

I don't think this bar gets a lot of traffic because they had a hell of a time waiting on everyone and by everyone I mean the 7 people at the bar. The bartender reprimanded a guest then another waitress. It was weird. It took me about 10 minutes to get a drink. 

The atmosphere is kind of cool if you're into cigars.
author: Emily E.

description:
Probably the only place left in San Francisco where you can smoke a cigar with an appropriate libation.  Walk down the stairs into a nicely old fashioned bar area and out you go into a patio with heat lamps and plenty of seating to indulge in your carving for a stogie and wee dram after a heavy meal.

Cigars are not horribly marked up and service is slow to start but attentive once you finally get your drinks.  Have not tried the food, but the bartenders pull of standard cocktails reasonably well, but they are not the quality of better places in town that specialize in those, so stick to the basics and you will have a decent time.
author: Sunay P.

description:
My friends visit this place to enjoy smoking cigars. Heard there is salsa night and came to check it out. When w walked in saw what appeared a salsa dancing class and we sat down. Then a woman walked towards us from across the room waving and screaming at us "Move! Move!" With no explanation told us to get out. Then she pushed my back as if I was not walking fast enough for her.  
1. There was no signs anywhere not allowing people to sit or be in the room
2. No reason to scream at customers
3. No reason to touch and push people
4. No etiquette
author: Cindy R.

description:
Celebrate Obama allowing you to bring Cuban Cigars across the border (for personal use ONLY, not resale) by re-discovering Cigar Bar and Grill.

A useful patio (in San Francisco, a rarity), a dance floor (albeit a small one), live music (and not just on Friday/Saturday), great cigars, and yes, top-notch entrees and apps.

Not to mention, a very fun, attractive, mid-twenties to mid-thirties clientele and some truly EXCEPTIONAL bartenders.
author: Mike V.

description: My husband and I and 5 other friends went to The Cigar Bar and had a nice time dancing and enjoying the music, wine and cigars last evening. Our bill was $89.55.Imagine our surprise when we got a fraud alert that someone tried to charge $9,811.00 an hour later!!! Thank God the bank denied the charge! Now it is locked so they cannot use it.....BE CAREFUL OUT THERE!!!
author: Teri K.

description:
So cool! A huge open courtyard studded with an old, weathered fountain. Spanish tiles and wooden tables dot the surrounding rooms and long bar. Great selection of whiskey, decent beers and they let you byoc-igar. 

The drinks are decently priced, I foresee a future date here sometime. 

It's got that gun-guitar case kinda feeling.
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
This place is weird. It makes me feel like I am in some European country.. mainly because of the EDM they blast, the tobacco and cigar smell, and well, the Europeans. 

Some bartenders pour lightly, and others poor very heavy. Not sure how I feel about that. I also noticed some people chose to dine here... that was weird. There's also pool in the back. It was surprisingly large in here. 

Overall, not a fan. It's just weird.. not so SF.
author: Angela L.

description:
This experience is based on their Salsa Night on a Saturday night.

Cover is $10 after 10pm, free before. We arrived around 9pm because we met up with some other folks having dinner there and as we waited we ordered some stuff off their dessert menu... as in... all of the things off their dessert menu. Their flan was really really rich, very different from the Mexican and Filipino styles I've had but was tasty.

The music started pretty much right at 10pm and... wow... the live music was AMAZING. I came with a trio of girls, one being Cuban born and raised in Miami and consequently a die hard Salsa lover and she said this place had to be one of her favorite experiences for Salsa dancing. The gentlemen were quite gentelmen-like about dancing -- except for one crazy drunk salsa man. But he was easy to avoid amongst the many other people to dance with. We also ordered drinks at the bar -- very reasonable around $7 a drink. If you don't feel like dancing, there is the freedom to watch from the sides or the back, there are benches that line one wall which is enough because everyone ends up dancing at least once! I brought a friend who had NO prior salsa experience and still had a blast. All in all, I had a fantastic experience and will definitely be returning for the live music.

A perk if you enjoy a cigar or two once in a while, their patio is inviting for that scene and you can avoid it if you're allergic to tobacco like me!
author: Janelle S.

description: BEWARE! *** BARTENDER MANIPULATES TIPS*** Check your credit card bill when you get home. I recieved horrible service at the back bar from a brunette female bartender. I did not speak to her other than ordering 3 drinks. Only had one round all night. I bought a drink for myself and 2 of my friends. Despite waiting patiently at bar with no interaction, I was skipped over repeatedly when trying to order. Despite poor service, I tipped the bartender to what I believed reflected the level of service. (I worked in the bar business for 4 years when I was in college, and usually tip 20%.) As it is the end of the month, I reviewed my credit card statement before paying my bill. I FOUND THE BARTENDER HAD ALMOST TRIPLED MY TIP!
author: Marko I.

description: The cigar bar tries to invoke a feel of Havana ... but the rude bar tender and rancid sangria killed its potential.
author: ursula l.

description: Had a great time here. Loved the space, drinks were tasty and the staff was friendly and helpful. Just stayed long enough for a couple rounds and a smoke but would definitely come back the next time I'm in the area. Much better experience here than the Occidental Cigar Club. Very chill
author: Jennifer A.

description:
The bar and food are cool.
The bill had an extra fries we were not served.
The waiter did not want to remove at first, but finally did it after our insistence.
The waiter hand wrote 20% tip before giving the bill to us.
We crossed it out and wrote 10% tip (legally tips are optional).
Still the Cigar Bar and Grill managed to charge 20% on our credit card.
I feel ripped off.
I am not ever going back.
author: Joel C.

description: I love this bar, the staff is exceptional and very attentive. I love that you can sit outside and smoke a cigar under the heaters. The best part of our visit was that we were here for a coworkers going away party, and the waitress...I think her name was Caroline or Carolina, made sure we were very comfortable, and that our drinks were refilled before they got empty. She also made sure our heater was turned on promptly when we sat down. I'll be back for sure.
author: Brian D.

description: I was in town looking for a good place to have a cigar well I didn't find one I found a great.place.to.gave one. The open air and great choice of beers makes.it a great.place.to go. I.loved the atmosphere was amazing . Will go there Everytime I'm in town.
author: Mike S.

description:
Came on a Friday, which was salsa night.   

Pros
Spacious seating with a beautiful outdoor seating area 
Nice selection of drinks

Cons
Small dance floor, easily crowded
My friend complained about leering men lol seemed like a bunch of 'those' haha
author: Sarah F.

description:
I'm not sure what to rate this place. Maybe more like a 2.5 - 3 stars. We go downstairs which gets us inside. I don't think it was the front, so we walk around and found the bar. Couldn't quite determine who was an employee or the customer so we waited a bit hoping to be greeted by someone. Nothing. I think we asked if we just sat ourselves. We roam around once again, found an unoccupied table & sat down. Minutes pass. Even more minutes pass. Finally was able to hunt someone down to see if we maybe somehow someway we needed to talk to someone about ordering. The answer was stay seated & someone will be right with us. Phew. Ok. After a few more minutes someone finally took our order. By the way they were not packed at all. No apologies, the server was nice enough. But fine. We order flat bread and some drinks. Good lord, we really didn't even think it was ever coming, it took so long.  Well, luckily the flat bread was amazing. Of course you guessed it, the bill also took lord knows how long. We were still hungry but decided there was no way in hell we were going to place another order and wait an eternity. 
So I guess the 2.5 stars is perfect. Service needs a lot of work. It helps that no one was rude. But for me, I don't think I'll be back unless I'm the only or maybe 2nd customer upon arrival...and only for the flatbread.
author: Paige J.

description:
I'm not a smoker or anything, but that doesn't stop me from coming here to drink!  I somehow picked up an interest in scotch whiskey and have had the chance to try various ones.  The list is quite extensive and has more than your usual 10/12 year selections.  Let's put it this way, I don't smoke and I can't stand the smell of smoke of any sort. I can still come here for drinks, that's saying a lot in terms of commitment.  What's nice about the setting is that there's a giant patio, a bar, and some tables in the dining room area.  Most of the cigar smell stays in the patio area, I don't really interact with the smoke unless I need to walk through the patio to the restrooms. Hence most of the night, I can enjoy my whiskey and my friends' company smoke free. 

But wait, there's more! Surprisingly, the food here is pretty decent too.  Last time I came here with my bestie and shared their bruschetta and scallops. We weren't extremely hungry so the portions were just enough, also, we've gotta save room for drinks.  In my head I've expected typical bar food more than actual entrees being served here, perhaps I might be bias. But hell, it's my review, I get to be biased all I want.

Anyway, the people working here are really fun and interesting too. Definitely one of the bars I enjoy in SF.
author: Connie C.

description:
I've been here a handful of times, at various days of the week. It can still be pretty busy on weekdays, but it shouldn't be hard for you to find a table. Weekends can get packed, and they charge a cover fee after 8pm I believe. Still worth it to go though, in my opinion. 

The cigar selection is decent. Something for everyone. 

The bartenders are okay. Not great, not terrible either. 

For bar food, it's actually pretty good. 

Overall, I really enjoy having a nice cigar here with friends, listening to the live music, and just hanging out on the patio. I definitely recommend this spot if you're looking for a place to have a smoke.
author: Caroline C.

description:
Yes there's a cover for the salsa dancing. I'm not sure of this is an every night thing or just saturday nights but i had a blast great music!  Definitely a bunch of novice dancers my feet were stepped on any number of times but just keep dancing.  

Very cute lounge feel with sprinkles of a club good times.  Lost a star for the cover but i like that it looks uppity when salsa isn't.  Lol 

Have fun!
author: Niah N.

description:
It's important that you don't mind smoke when you come here.
Many people smoke outside in their enclosed patio/garden, but also indoors so sitting near a window doesn't help.  

We liked the bouncer.  He was professional and wore a nice fedora.

Salsa night has a $10 cover -  we were disappointed by this surprise which was not listed on their website.  However, I liked it more because then there aren't servers pushing you to order.  The music was ok - Josh Jones - played salsa and cha cha cha music.  I am not a good judge of this type of music.  Music started at 9pm, but they start charging cover by at least 8:30.

It's very difficult to get seats if you're a big group.  Even if you try to rearrange the tables and chairs, the place is set up so that there are french doors that can open into their enclosed patio/garden, so they will tell you you are blocking traffic.  So even if you are sitting to save seats for your big group, the staff will come and steal the chairs away again.

The people are financial during the weekday happy hours.  On Saturday night it's more of  an older mixed group.
They do have a coat check on salsa nights.  

Because of the surprise cover charge, the smoke, and the difficulties the two times I've gone which were both in big groups, it gets two stars.  It's just not my type of scene.
author: Kelly Y.

description: Best place in the San Francisco and Peninsula area to have a cigar, drinks and light food.   Very casual and relaxed and service is awesome.   We come here Thursday and Friday nights.   Saturday's are great to learn some salsa (8 pm) and put your skills to test after.
author: James H.

description:
Now that I am over 30, I shouldn't be complaining about cover charges, so I deducted one star for the slow service at the bar. This could be a good or bad thing depending on how you look at it... 

The lounge has plenty of different reservable areas for small groups and private gatherings and a center patio area where you can sit and enjoy your cigar with friends.

There was a diverse crowd which I liked - young, old, white, and non-white. There was a great live band and even an older Asian plastic surgery obsessed salsero that made my girls and my night an absolute delight! We all had a chance to dance with him and we were able to create memories that we'll never forget! 

We will be back ;)
author: Belen V.

description:
So, I never write reviews on yelp. I seriously have not written even one, but this place pissed me off SO much that I feel prompted to write one even though I am tired and still hungover.  First, I was here for my cousin's bachelorette party in the back room on the side of the patio.  This place is super cute with it's large bar area, outside patio, private room, and dance floor.  It's a cool combination of cigar/cigarette smoking and salsa.    

However, when I ordered drinks for myself and my girls I experienced their less than stellar service.  I ordered a Bulleit, neat for myself and tipped the guy well, but ended up getting coke (yes, soda).  Mind you, I was quite drunk by this time but can tell the difference between bourbon and soda.  I went back to the bartender and told him that he had served me soda and he told me that I must have grabbed the wrong drink.  But, how funny that the pour was the same size as a regular Bulleit, neat. He then proceeded to MOCKINGLY pour my bulleit, neat right in front of me to show me that he was going to serve me the right drink.  Asshole.

Third, I bought a pack of American Spirits from the bar and was told that the pack was $10.  I was taken aback because I have never heard of a $10 pack of cigarettes.  The bartender reacted by asking me, "You aren't from San Francisco, are you?"  No, asshole I'm not because I don't know how $10 for a pack of cigarettes would ever be okay in any other city in California or maybe even the entire country.  Asshole.  

In sum, I don't think I'll come back to this place unless I'm invited for some type of occasion.  I'll take my money elsewhere.
author: Elizabeth G.

description: Threw my husband a 70th birthday party here. Had a private room and served appetizers followed by a buffet for about 25 people of various ages. I brought in cupcakes for dessert. They provided wrist bands for my guests, per my request, so i could monitor and control the drink tab. Everything was fabulous. Jessica, their events person, was wonderful in assisting me in all the details and providing oversight during the gathering. The food was fabulous, really tasty and well prepared, from the crab appetizers and mushroom stuffed phylo, to the pork/polenta and beef and potato dishes. Also the Salsa band scheduled that night was great. Because we booked on a saturday night, which is probably their busiest night, the venue got very crowded, especially the dance floor, so one should always be prepared for that. This is a popular Salsa venue. However  having our own room provided for a cozy social place to always come back to. All age groups enjoyed themselves and though i am a fussy person I couldn't have been more pleased with everything. Thanks Cigar Bar for the quality control and all the good efforts by staff. You folks work hard and customer service was top knotch. Kudo's to all.
author: leana a.

description: Came to Cigar bar for Paint night with a group of friends. We purchased the event off of groupon and they hosted the event here. We were in a private room in the back with the painting group. They had a server come and take orders for food and drinks. The food is way overpriced but we were starving and ordered a quesadilla and some fries. Both were good but probably because we were beyond hungry. Drinks were on the stiff side and average in price. Didn't feel the need for more than one drink though since we were super into painting. Overall it was a good spot for paint night. Parking was a bit horrendous but we were able to find some street parking across the street.
author: Tiff C.

description:
