Great happy hour spot. Came here with colleagues for a little private event, fewer than 12 people. Service was good, the appetizers were solid, and it's a pretty large venue. Though I wasn't cool enough to have a cigar with my cocktails, I sure was tempted! Ok, maybe not. But you get the idea. 

It started to get crowded after 6:30 but it was 9 before I knew it (and time for me to go.) So, it was good night!
author: Juan T. K.

description:
It's called cigar bar for a reason -- you can buy cigars to smoke here. You should expect to come out smelling a little smoky afterwards. It's nice that there's an outdoor smoking patio, but there's still people smoking all throughout. I wasn't a huge fan of all the smoke, but I can imagine this can be a great spot for people who would like to smoke freely with a drink or two. 

I've been here birthday parties and meetups, and they were always very accommodating to big groups. You can reserve the pool table area or the back patio accordingly. They can also serve large portions of food (mostly bar food) along with silverware for large groups.
author: Audrey L.

description:
I'm writing a review for my experience at the Cigar Bar & Grill on Friday the 26th of August.
My girlfriends and I got together and threw a party for our friend, who is getting married in a few weeks.
I am so happy that we had the party at the Cigar Bar. We had a party of 10 girls, and everyone keeps texting me that they had such a great time.
Our server was Sean and he was kind and attentive. He kept drinks and food coming out at a steady pace & was very courteous. 
The bar is large and has lots of areas and nooks for groups & an outdoor patio area that you can enjoy cigars in. Everything has a classy but warm and relaxed vibe. The food was good too- we ordered deviled eggs, quesadillas, flatbreads, dates stuffed with chorizo (yum!) & cheese/charcuterie plates.
Finally- they have salsa dancing later in the evening on Friday and Saturday which our guests had a lot of fun with.
Our party was a hit and there was zero drama!
So many thanks to the Cigar Bar for being a great venue. I will definitely return, whether it be with just my BF or with group of friends. 
Shout out to Neil! Thank you for making this an excellent evening with lots of great memories.
author: janis t.

description: Came here when we stayed in downtown San Francisco one time. Had a tasty cigar in the patio area and danced my socks off to some salsa with my fiancee with a live band!! Very cool underground feel and beautiful lounge areas if you want to chill. Can't wait to come back!
author: Mitchell B.

description:
I've only been here for the salsa dancing but it is awesome!  Usually a $10 cover charge but they have a live band and great dancing.  Im not the best but I love to try it.  The people watching is fantastic!!

Highly recommend this place for dancing!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Just okay. Had a company function/birthday party here, and I can see the appeal, but you'll end the night smelling like smoke, which, I mean, is par for the course. They have a really solid selection of beers (on tap and in cans/bottles) and liquor, so you can't go wrong there. What would be better for the cigars is a menu, but if you want one, you can go up to the cigar stand and pick some out. I mean, Occidental is pretty close, so you can always do that instead if you want a more chill atmosphere. Food is definitely a little pricey here, so be prepared to spend a pretty penny, but their happy hour from 4-7pm on Mondays through Fridays is a great deal for their drinks.

Be prepared for the frat bros, though. It's the Fi-Di, so you can be assured that you'll run into them every now and again, but at The Cigar Bar & Grill, they congregate. And, yell. A lot. Oh, bonus points for the salsa floor on weekends. There's a dress code? Which, I kind of understand, because they're trying to class up their establishment, but they have hipster bartenders with handlebar mustaches, and people are smoking. That doesn't exactly spell classy.
author: Danny C.

description: Great place to grab appetizers and cigars. We were there with a few friends Friday evening and it was a bit too loud as it got super busy. Cigar collection is ok, service was good.
author: Asad J.

description:
I would like to start with the venue hours:
Monday - Friday: 4:00 pm - 2:00 am 
Saturday: 6:00 pm to 2:00 am
Nice place for salsa dancing Friday and Saturday nights 10:00pm to 1:30am with Live music. Also live music Wednesday and Thursday 8pm to 11:00 pm. Finally it is a restaurant-bar and you can buy and smoke cigars on the patio.
author: Elvis C.

description: The servers are so friendly. Came here on a Friday night for a date. Though the outside patio area was great, we couldn't really hear each other so we decided to move inside. It was a better atmosphere. The tequila drinks are strong AND I highly recommend you take a shot of tequila and ask for pineapple back. The pineapple juice is freshly pressed and it's delicious! Like it's seriously good. The date and I discussed it for a good 2 mins.
author: Pawanpreet G.

description:
Initially I wrote the following review based on a negative experience: "If I could give this place 0 stars, then I would. There was 6 of us total and we were in line before 10pm. 4 of us get in and pay the $10 cover each since we had to wait in line and we missed the cut off before 10. The last two in our group are waiting to get in and the lady at the front desk won't let them in because one of our friends is wearing sneakers. Yet, there are other people in the bar wearing sneakers, but she says since we are there after 10, she can't make an exception and she won't refund us, even though we literally just paid. The best she offers is tickets for another night, but we are visiting from out of town. I ask to speak to a manager and she says they are all busy. I feel like she cheated us and wasn't very kind about the situation. Don't go here, bad business and shitty customer service"

***Amendment: I want to update my review since Cigar Bar read it and got in contact with me. They apologized and offered a full refund, gift vouchers, and VIP tickets, which they mailed to me. They definitely made up for my negative experience and I would go back and give them a second chance next time I'm in town. I want to thank them for taking the time to acknowledge what happened and remedy the situation. They even went an extra step by offering the vouchers and VIP tickets. Now I believe they have great customer service and are willing to take responsibility when a customer has a bad experience. I really appreciate that and for that reason, I give them 4 stars.
author: Molly D.

description: I had been several times in this place. The music is great, the food is really good. I plan on continue going.
author: Natalia M.

description: Love this place! Step downstairs into Cuba! Its super cozy cave like, extensive wine and spirit menu. Open patio for cigar smoking, nice dance floor. Check in on Sat. At 7:30 for $15 and get Salsa lessons! Live band Saturday's....
author: Danine H.

description:
I have been to Cigar Bar & Grill on 20+ occasions, so this review is based on multiple experiences. This place is the only open air cigar bar in town. Furthermore, they do not charge a cutting fee if you bring your own. Unfortunately, the service is undoubtedly the worst in the city. The servers consistently forget drinks, and if you are lucky enough to catch their attention for a menu, they will most likely forget to serve you at all. Last night our server forgot our drinks not once, but three times and it was only moderately busy. After waiting 30 minutes for the bill (which occurs almost every time I go here), I got up to ask at the bar, to which the wanker with the hat replied 'go outside and wait' as if I was five years old. 

I am a frequent and long time cigar smoker and only come here for the aforementioned smoking policy, however they need a complete overhaul of their attitude and service to their customers because it's honestly abysmal.
author: Luke C.

description:
As a smoker, I have always loved the patio and energetic bar environment.  I and been here a few times for dinner and drinks before heading out for dancing with friends.   It was an awesome place to have everyone congregate before a night out on the town on Friday...or stay for some salsa if you prefer salsa instead (not my thing, but folks seem to love it)!

Note: They only let you reserve a table for parties of 8 or more (and it is certainly needed if you are a large group with some folks wanting to eat). However, they require a $400 minimum to get a table for dinner on Saturdays, so make sure your friends know if you are not paying the whole tab for them!
author: Amber D.

description:
Been here a couple of times, once for Happy Hour and once on a Saturday night. I couldn't be more different, but both were good times.  

The Happy Hour crowd is more of the Financial District crowd drinking and smoking on cigars, its a more calm atmosphere although it can get crowded.  They have happy hour drinks and small plates that were pretty good.  The menu is "classier" than your average HH food (such as pate and caviar), but its not too pricey. 

On Saturday night, it felt more like a Latin hideaway were people come and dance to a live Latin band and have dinner.  Oh to smoke cigars of course.  Much more lively, but really aimed towards people who enjoy the dancing.

What makes this place standout is the outdoor courtyard in the middle where people can enjoy their Cohibas in the establishment.  Very nice on a warm day/night.
author: Veasna H.

description:
Nice quiet spot for friends and drinks. Limited dinner options. They were out of the fish and chips. Above average wine selection. I enjoyed their rose. Nice seating options. As our party grew we moved to a higher table inside and eventually outside to smoke cigars. 

Staff was friendly. I had to walk up to the bar to ask for menus and to get their attention to order which was annoying. Once they realized we were a good group who was sticking around, they took car of us. I'll be back. Great central location for our group of friends.
author: Jessica M.

description: I went here to salsa dance and was a bit disappointed.  The Cigar Bar is a nice place, say if you are going there with a date to eat and smoke a cigar and possibly dance a dance or two.  But it's not a place to go strictly salsa dancing.  Most folks there did not know how to dance salsa, most women there were with a partner, on a date, and the dance floor is infused with cigar smoke from the adjoining outdoor patio where folks are sitting smoking cigars.  If you want to eat, smoke a cigar and dance a dance, you'll enjoy yourself.  If you however want to dance salsa, this is not your spot.
author: Daniel H.

description: Way too smoky. I had a sore throat for three days after visiting this establishment. The band is good, but the song selection isn't very diverse so it can become a bit monotonous. I would also prefer that songs be played in their original format and not mixed into a protracted, diluted version of the original song. Otherwise, the staff and visitors are very nice.
author: Mary R.

description: My buddies brought me here as part of my bachelor party, and we had a great time! We arrived just at opening, so we had the place mostly to ourselves, but there was lots of space, both inside and the outdoor smoking courtyard. They have a fairly well-stocked humidor of cigars and the bartender seemed to be knowledgeable about both the liquors and cigars. When we ordered food (quesadilla, papas bravas, and shishito peppers), it all came out quickly and was very good. I was disappointed we had to move on before taking advantage of the pool table, but I hope to come back even when we aren't smoking.
author: Bill B.

description: Tiny dance floor gets packed, hot, and sweaty on salsa night; not enough room to dance.
author: Inigo M.

description: What a fantastic experience for a first time visitor to this establishment...  great ambience and a wonderful friendly mixed crowd. Our server was "Carolina".  She was extremely courteous and attentive. We had an amazing time and she and the rest of the staff made this a "come back to San Fran" a must hit spot!  We loved the drinks and the atmosphere. The music was fantastic as well. Great job CBG.... we will definitely be back on our next trip to "The City". We only wish we had one in LA!
author: Kevin J.

description: The place for those seeking to get their sweat on doing the salsa in a backroom full of pretty good dancers or those seeking to enjoy a good cigar in the center area full of smoke puffed by other patrons.
author: Kimberly H.

description: Lively cigar bar with an outdoor courtyard.  Feels like a speakeasy from time gone by. Wish they had a section with comfy chairs to relax in after a long day.  Nice offering of cigars. Nothing too crazy but I had an Alex Bradley Maxx for $8 which is fairly priced.  The pour for the port we ordered was stingy (twice) but I still plan to go back as there are so few places to grab a smoke and a drink after dinner!
author: Jim G.

description: Sub par bar with gross bathrooms and a cover on the weekends. Go to any of the other bars nearby and save yourself the trouble of cleaning the cigar smoke out of your clothes the next day.
author: Brooke G.

description: Not very many places like this. I love some whisky & a cigar. I took a date here & she doesn't smoke or drink. I don't know what I was thinking. I love to go here with friends who we met here & she had a great time. They have live bands & a great atmosphere. Only downside is if you don't get here early enough you have a long wait outside.
author: Fahad L.

description: This has the worst customer service! The security is rachet! Rude as can be to a group of a professional adults!
author: Jag B.

description:
Cigar Bar has been on my list of places to visit for years. I'd stumbled in years ago but it wasn't the vibe I was going for, so I tried again a month ago. I had NO IDEA there was such a huge dance floor! The live salsa band for Saturday was awesome. My only complaint it is appeals to many, so it was crowded. 

Come ready to move those hips!
author: Amanda V.

description:
We came here for a work event, and paid the bill using two corporate credit cards. 

Both my colleague and I have not used these cards for awhile and ironically, both our cards reported fraudulent activity within 2 weeks of visiting Cigar Bar. 

Coincidence?

Love the place and vibe of this place. Been coming here for years. Advice is- pay cash!
author: Joyce L.

description: We love this place! Latin dance, live music, drinks, excellent and friendly service... Expect to dance with some strangers, don't worry, it's always fun!
author: Susana A.

description:
Found this place walking to dinner and stopped in for happy hour and a cigar.  The happy hour itself was fine with no mind blowing deals that are must haves.  I had a $13 cigar that was pretty good.  Was given the needed items to correctly light it, but for a cigar bar it would have been nice to have the cigar cut and lit for me as I have had at other spots like this.  You are pretty much on your own.  

I didn't have any food so I can't comment on that.  But for a relaxing sit down with some drinks and a cigar, you can't go wrong with this place.
author: Russell D.

description:
Service was sub-par, had to track down a waiter every single time so although it's a sit in restaurant, once the music gets going you're better off going to the bar to get drinks. As far as food is concerned they won't take your order at the bar so you have to literally track down your waiter/waitress/anyone who will take your order. They take your card at the bar and then also require a card for food orders, I found it strange so make sure you close out of both before you go.
Drinks: I had margaritas and mojitos. Good flavor, not very strong but also not annoyingly sweet. 
Food: They were out of the chicken nuggets for appetizers so got the shrimp tostadas. They were pretty basic, could have used more lemon and spices. It was a little bland for my taste.
Dancing: live band with a decent dancing area. It was of course packed so it was a little hard to maneuver, but we made it work.
Venue: large place, with both indoor and outside seating. The first room where you enter is the main bar and there are tables scattered about, the center is open and used as the smoking area, and then the other side is the dancing area with a live band.
author: Marcela M.

description: I really enjoy coming here during the day and warm nights. They have a great selection of everything and I'm not a smoker but I always get the chocolate cigar and let it roll around my mouth like candy. Some night they have live performance. Nothing like San Francisco Vibe.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Great place for happy hour, not too far from the Financial District. I've been here with friends and for a company happy hour event. The chips and salsa and calamari that they served us were delicious. When I came with my friends, we finished the garlic fries pretty quickly too. The cocktails are a bit strong. 

Love the space that they have here; there's an outdoor patio for those warmer evenings. You'll see some folks smoking cigars, hence the name of this place :)
author: Katherine S.

description: Amazing, maybe the food is OK but the service is great, the bar is quick, if you are looking for a quiet place this is not the right place for you , i had a bottle of wine smoke a nice Cigar and then i was ready for some live music real Salsa music !! what a great hang out venue !!
author: Hever R.

description:
I ended up hitting this place on a Friday evening right after work with a college friend of mine and this place got packed fast!  It was hard to find a place to sit so we ended up sharing a communal table with some folks who were nice enough to let us sit there.  

It's a hip place that had good food, great drinks, and the chance to smoke cigars! (albeit outside in the patio).  Be mindful when you come in though because after 8pm they had a cover charge, and even though I had stepped out of the front for fresh air the bouncer told me that I couldn't come back in because I didn't meet their dress code (at least I was already on the way out, but still).  

Check this place out!
author: Ferdinand L.

description:
There's nothing quite like having a quality cigar with a glass or two of scotch. It evens the tempo of the group, and creates a sense of intimacy even in a sizable circle of companions. The dabbling anthropologist in me wants to make some further fantastic claims about fire and the primordial nature of man, but I'll leave it at that.

I lived a block away from here one summer three years ago, and I have fond memories of most of the bars in the area. So when my colleagues and I (a dozen total) wanted a place to relax and shoot the bull after a round of drinks, I knew exactly where to go.

Always the courtyard, that's the only place to go. Let the diners dine, the loners lone, and the dancers dance... but at the cigar bar, the courtyard is the centerpiece. A nice splashy fountain in the middle completes the mood. Honestly I've never sat inside, because why would you stay indoors when you have the infinitude of sky waiting to accept your burnt offerings, an ode to the elder technology?
author: Christophe C.

description:
I found this place because of a Paint Nite event.  I was really impressed with it!  Dark, brick cave ambiance with a little exposed "cavern" courtyard complete with water fountain in the middle.  Have the bartender pour you a good scotch and maybe order a cigar.  There was a lot of space so it seems great for groups, or you can find a corner to brood in or get romantic with someone special.

I'll be back for sure on another night to take in everything and enjoy myself.

The cocktail waitress was super helpful in assisting me with grabbing a drink before the event started because the bartender seemed overwhelmed with our group needing drinks all at once.  She even ran down a quick cocktail list with ingredients without me even asking, and I was able to get a super refreshing and delicious white wine spritzer drink with cucumber and mint... and within the 3 minute happy hour cut off time!  She brought the drink to me in the painting area, and came by periodically to see if I, or anyone else, needed another drink. She was a pretty blonde,and I think her name was Kerry.  Awesome service!
author: Super L.

description:
Great place with a lot of ambiance, and good for drinks if you are a bigger group. 

I love the live band, the dance floor, and the outdoor area at The Cigar Bar. I was here on a Saturday, and the band played great salsa music that inspired even me to try some moves. After trying to learn salsa a number of times, I've decided it's not my favorite, however, the atmosphere here couldn't stop me from liking it. My friends and me had so much fun on the dance floor. 

The outdoor area is a great social place for drinks and chatting, both in bigger and smaller groups. Good to keep in mind is that people are smoking cigars and cigarettes. It literally feels like you are in an outdoor bar in Italy or France. 

Also, it is a $10.You can pay with your credit card in the bar, however, the closet and entrance only accept cash. 

Can't wait to come back here for the live band, dance floor, and European ambiance!
author: Erica W.

description:
I really like this place.  My friends and I were just walking the streets of SF and stumbled onto this bar.  We enter their unique doors and take a long wooden table.  They have the cigar bar, but we weren't up for smoking.  They also have a lovely patio, but all we really wanted was to chill, talk, and drink some cheap beer.  

Enter PBR.  The Cigar Bar has bottled PBR and they had this fun game of guessing the playing card on the bottle cap.  If you guess the correct card, you get your beer for free!  At best it's 1/52 chance of getting it right.  Have fun and may the odds ever be in your favor.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
California cigar bars are just a league apart, it seems. The climate allows proprietors to open a place up without subjecting the clientele to punishing elements in a way we just can't accomplish year-round in Washington. Washington clubs are always indoors and shuttered and feel like your great-grandfather's living room. Which is actually fine sometimes...but not in the summer.

This place on a Wednesday night was a breeze to get into and find seating, but still had a brisk and convivial crowd enjoying a social smoke. There is one semi-open room where a (really, really good) jazz band was jamming in the back, and adjacent to that room is a more open patio with heaters and sofas. 

It was dark, but lit just right; felt like a wonderful, languid oasis in the middle of the financial district and everyone seemed more than ready to strike up a conversation. The only gripe I could dredge up was that they didn't have a humidor at all, and their in-house selection, while decent, was very limited. No Short Stories (oh, the humanity!). I'll be returning here with each new visit to town.
author: Necia D.

description:
Apart from the line to get in, this is a pretty chill place. Haven't been to a lot of salsa dancing bars. I can't dance salsa for the life of me, but it's fun watching other people try. Especially after they finish and have sweat stains everywhere. *Whistles seductively*

Apart from that, they have some decent craft cocktails. Surprisingly, loved the whiskey sour despite it being one of the more normal drinks. They make it very craft-like though. That's a term, right?

There's also a patio in the middle where you can chill and get away from the heat aka my body.
author: Victor C.

description:
Been here many times, each time for cigar and drinks never food. At night they have a front door cover charge, and music for dancing. They offer indoor and outdoor seating depending on what you want to do. For the cigar smokers the outdoor indoor experience is perfect. Btw they do sell cigars here! 

Con if your not into crowded places this place is not it. It can get pretty crowded and difficult to get a seat. There is also a wide range of people who like to come here. They have a awesome water fall in the courtyard that sets the mood
author: Azizi A.

description:
Sometimes you just need to smoke a cigar and drink a glass of port and leave the hearty coughing and lung discomfort to handle another day.  I have been here twice - once as a group of three, and once as a party over twenty and I found the space equally accommodating.  They have a full bar with a nice selection of sparkling and fortified wines, as well as your standard fare.  They also have a dinner menu which I cannot speak to.  

The patio is a lovely space and truly has a nice chimney effect to siphon off the bulk of the smoke.  Additionally, there are other interior rooms if you don't feel like being al fresco.  

The only complaint is they are decently inflexible with payment for large parties.  We arrive first and had to open a tab for the entire party.  When we went to leave, we were unable to transfer to another card, but had to settle for the whole group, which was a bit of a bummer as they were planning on staying a few hours longer.  Of course, chaos ensued and we didn't get out the door for another 30 minutes or so.  

Pro tip: this is a cigar bar, so no matter what you do, your clothes will all need to hit the laundry when you get home - maybe leave your dry clean only clothes and coats at home for this one, kids.
author: Virginia B.

description: Love the music, location, ambiance, crowd except that the last time I was there I came home with a *hoarse throat, unable to talk or breath well from all the cigar smoke that gets into dance floor from smokers' patio. It used to be my favorite place...not anymore since then.
author: Tehari W.

description:
The dude with the hat is a douche, he literally ignores you until he's done socializing, and when you do get his attention, he acts like your bothering him. If you are that miserable of a person, why work in a field where you have to constantly deal with people. The other bartender was slammed with drink orders, and yet he just keeps on conversing. I'm a bartender myself, have worked in numerous bars throughout California, bar far the worst bartender I've ever encountered.
Makes sense why the service reviews are so bad. Makes me wonder why people would come to a place just to leave feeling disrespected.  A definite no go for me, I loved the venue, the space is beautiful, but I couldn't imagine booking events at a place where the workers hate there jobs. And are sh***y to there customers.
author: Crystal S.

description:
There are very few places in SF that are as dynamic as the Cigar Bar. Located in FiDi, the outdoor patio is a haven for happy hour during the warm/hot months for professionals in the area. The outdoor patio also serves as a haven for Cigar smokers who crave a place to smoke without having to step out on the street. Where things really get interesting are on Friday nights when said happy hour patrons stay long enough to witness and partake in the salsa dancing that goes on there on the weekends. 

At the stroke of 10, live bands fill the back corner room with vibrant Latin beats. The bands rotate regularly (some great, some ok, some not so great) so keep an eye out for the schedule. From a salsa dancer's perspective, this is not the super stiff, hardcore salsa crowds of the larger, more well known and established clubs. This venue is a casual place where great dancers and first-timers share the dance floor (which makes things interesting once you factor in the party crowds who have been drinking for the past few hours). The caliber of the dancers very across the board, week to week so you never know what to expect other than some interesting people watching. If you are looking for lessons, there are some here on Saturdays at 8:30pm.

The drinks here are ok - I usually stick with bourbons neat because other drinks usually have too much sugar and also because they don't have the large square ice cubes like other speakeasy bars do.

$10 cover after 9:30pm on Fridays and Saturdays.
author: E E.

description:
When you think "Cigar Bar," you think guys sitting around, smoking cigars and drinking scotch.  But, that was hardly the case.  In fact, none of the patrons that night smoked cigars, instead it was a nice extension of happy hour and it was packed.   I remember getting WASTED off rose wine.  Not smart.   

The food, surprisingly is very good.  The oysters, the sliders, hell yeah!   But, because I'm hella classy, I drank like 4-5 glasses of vino, got sh*t-faced, got up and danced in the random dance floor next door, and ran immediately to the bathroom afterward.   Party FOUL!

What I was most upset about, not so much that I got sick, but that I had essentially "gotten rid of the food prior."  :(

Whatever, had a blast!!!!
author: Soo Jin K.

description: Good place to get a cigar and sit in the outdoor patio with a drink or some food. Cigars are not over priced.  There is live music on Saturday nights with a $10 cover charge.
author: Gloria T.

description:
It's all about the smoking patio at the Cigar Bar & Grill. Yes they have nice intimate spaces inside but the buzz and commotion outside is what makes the bar special. 

First off, smoking patios are few and far between especially this part of town. It's an interesting mix of FiDi workers having afterwork drinks and for some, enjoying their cigars while they're at it. It's large enough for bigger office gatherings yet there are single tables along the perimeter for more intimate conversations. Larger groups will appreciate the party platters of guac and chips or quesadillas. I've also had the fried calamari and chicken wings which were both satisfying companions to post-work beers. Happy hours from 4-7pm with $1 off drafts. 

Here's a nice tip. I find the Cigar Bar to be at it's best early in the week post happy hour. By then, the crowd has typically thinned out and the patio is a pleasant place to enjoy a night cap or to have a good catch-up with friends. It truly is all about the patio at the Cigar Bar.
author: Jon L.

description: This review is for the hostess in the front on 12/4/15 approx 12am. We walked in with a group of 5 and immediately the she scoffed at us. My buddy paid for her own cover fee and she automatically assumed that she was paying for all of us since she handed her a $100 bill. When my friend informed her that she was paying for herself she rolled her eyes and rudely said "REALLY?". REALLY? I expect more from an establishment from this. Won't be back as long as she is working here.
author: Brian L.

description:
The good: This place is spacious with great ambience (fountains and Spanish tile in the courtyard, good lighting, pool table, live jazz music). The $6 "Nonoffensive Red" wine special was a delicious, spicy Italian. Good deal for post-happy hour in this part of town.

The not so good: Sometimes you get what you pay for, and this certainly applied to my cigar. I'm no cigar connoisseur, but my cheaper-end ($9) cigar was pretty nasty; no flavor besides damp, dusty ashtray. The other reviews indicate that there is some good stuff in that case; I guess you just have to dole out some cash to enjoy it.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
One of the best spots in the city. 

I come here every once in a while with my work team. Usually after a big win, or a great week. It's a fun atmosphere to celebrate. Kick back, get a cigar and order drink. 

I recommend getting there before the outdoor seating is all gone. When the weather is nice, or even if it's not, the courtyard fills up fast. The snacks food is really good too. We usually get the chips and dip with quesadillas. Fair warning, the portions are huge. 

Lastly, the usually have live music. Never have I heard a bad band there. Fun to dance or just hang out and listen. I'm a lifer. One of the best gems in north beach.
author: Robert F.

description:
I use to always come here for the cigars and salsa music, but to my surprise, the food is actually good here. I'm a big fan of their home made chips and salsa. Nothing like I've ever tasted before. NO BULLSHIT! You will have to try for yourself to understand what I'm talking about. 

I'm also a fan of the Quesadilla platter. No joke, this platter is HUGE (that's what she said).  Love the mushrooms and two different cheeses with red bell peppers. In fact, I'm writing this review because I'm trying to make the quesadilla at home right now, ha! Chef, if you are reading this, prep suggestions are welcome! 

'Til next time Cigar Bar. Ciao!
author: Joanna G.

description:
We came here on Saturday night to celebrate my friend's birthday. She was able to lock a table only for 10 people, and I am glad I was one of her guests because I was wanting to check out this place for a while. I was not too excited about their menu since I looked it up here on yelp. Was hoping it would surprise me when we dinned but was not the case. I did like their selection of cocktails and beers. I enjoyed a watermelon beer all night, well more than one, and loved the hint of watermelon it had at the end. Regarding drinks, I found them to be pretty affordable (inexpensive).

The food was just ok, we shared several plates and some of them were very good while others were not exciting at all. We had the sweet plantains with mole (a-ok); we also had the ceviche and tuna tartar (my two favorites); we had a couple of the quesadillas (size was perfect for our big group); We also shared some fries (pretty tasty!) as well as a flan (too sweet for me, but everyone else liked it a lot).

After dinner, we then stayed for the live salsa party...the group became larger so it was tons of fun to hang with friends, drink and burn some of the calories from dinner by dancing salsa all night. I honestly loved the band and the atmosphere, I have been to various salsa socials and clubs here in San Francisco, and i liked the crowd here more than any other places. I also loved that the band was playing pretty good and songs that I could sing to!. Again, drinks were not pricey so it made it for a great time. I had to pay for water ($2) but this is common for salsa places.

The one thing I hated, but it is expected, after all is a cigar bar....is all the smoke! I left smelling like I had smoked all day and the combination of cigars and cigarrettes smells is not pleasant at all...but again, that is something that you cant control and should expect, nature of the place.

Would love to come back here to dance. Definitely one of the best places in SF to get your Salsa Groove on!
author: Elizabeth D.

description: Came here on a Monday night for Paint Night. It was held in a private room across the outdoor patio. We came early and had time before the event started to grab some drinks. We had the mojito and the pisco paradise (macchu pisco, pineapple juice, lemon--tasted like pineapple juice). Not bad! Very fruity--just the way I like it! The cocktails are ~$10, wine $6-14, draft $5, and bottled $3-11. They have a large wine/cocktail selection. The decor is Spanish style and very hip/modern, yet classic. Popular place to go to after work, even on a Monday.
author: Vicki L.

description:
I'm stunned at the rudeness of the 'hostess' here. I arrived alone to meet friends and wanted to be sure they are here before paying (?!) 20$ to enter. She was rude and refused and would not allow even if I left my purse. 
Unhelpful and ungracious. The word 'hostess' should be defined for this young girl.
author: Christine B.

description: Let's face it, SF can be very pretentious and too techy, but this place is very organic and full of genuine people! The crowd is great and the atmosphere is one to experience! Salsa is a great time and  service is pretty good! This may not be for everyone, but if your tired of the reg crowd of SF , enjoy this place, feel at home!
author: J M.

description: Lately, they have hired a prick as a security guard there and a few times I have been there and the guy keep getting in my face. I have been going there for 12 years and the new guy has no respect for regulars and I got in a big fight with the guy for sitting on a couch that was empty because it is reserved for the band. The band was playing, and no food drinks or sign was in the area. The guy got in my face for sitting there enjoying my drink.  I said I would move if the band return but it will be only the next 5 minutes to finish up my drink before they finish their set.  So I padded the guy making the complain on the back saying that he did a good job.  Security guard told me to leave.  I left the owner a voice mail.. Matt the owner called me and took my complain and was very understanding. He was very nice  and apologizes for the incident and mentioned he would make correction.  I am satisfied and will be frequenting the to one of my favorite places in the city.
author: Keyvan K.

description:
It's been a while since I've been to a cigar bar.  While I was hoping it would be the indoor version that wasn't the case. I'm assuming it's gotta be a legal reason behind it. Anyway I was pleasantly surprised to see that a place I went to about 10 B.Y. (before yelp) was still around and doing strong business.  The place seemed to be as cool and hip as it was before.  The difference now is I am the right age to appreciate it.  I remember when I was younger I felt like the kid in the crowd.  Now I finally feel like the crowd.  

Service was solid and they have a great selection of cigars.  Mind you I have no clue what is hot these days in the world of cigars so the in house experts are very helpful in helping make the right choice for you and your budget. I give kudos to places the specialize in something and the staff is not pretentious about their wares. Drinks are pretty average so don't expect the bartenders to wow you like some of the more liquor centric bars in the area.  Not saying the drinks are bad but you're here to enjoy cigars and the drinks are there to compliment the experience.  

They also have a nice dance floor and they had a live band as well.  There were salsa lessons earlier that looked fun but I was just a spectator so I have little details except everyone involved was really into it.  There was a long line and cover later in the evening (I think around 10) so keep that in mind. Overall I had a fun little time there and look forward to coming back again.
author: Joco F.

description: Ive been going here for almost 4 yrs now. I cant believe I've never written a review. I obviously I love it I keep going back. The live bands have always been really good. I danced so much the last time i was there i had blisters but loved every minute of it. The food is good and the drinks are yummy. Good happy hr menu The dancing is truly where its at for me. I dont smoke cigars but my friends loved theres and there is a beautiful spacious courtyard.
author: Dana B.

description:
Smelly smelly smoky!
I know it's named Cigar bar but if you don't love your hair and all clothes to smell like hell, and you don't enjoy being a second hand smoker this is not your place. 
Salsa is kinda mice but really the smoke wont leave you alone wherever you go!
Drinks are ok ., nothing extra ordinary.
author: Shirin E.

description: We came to the cigar bar and grill after having dinner at Belden Taverna. It was a lot of fun they have a great selection cigars had a nice bottle of wine,live music fun crowd great ambiance. It's kind of nice to find a place where real people can go in San Francisco.
author: Carl L.

description:
I went for salsa; can't comment on the food - but I'll touch on the venue, drinks, service and salsa:

Salsa:  Note that what's taught in the intro lesson and nearly exclusively what's danced is Cuban salsa - not mambo/New York or West Coast/LA style. Was about 60% beginners / those whom couldn't dance; about 10% good dancers and a mix of the rest.  I was there from just after the dance lesson until midnight and often dance club crowds change depending on the time of the evening, so the mix may be different later.  The dance floor was small and the crowd made it tight.  A mix of predominately 20 and 30-somethings and... a collection of 50 and 60 year old, older Latino men.  Air conditioning was left off - don't know if that was intentional or by accident - so it became HOT fast.  

Music:  Band that night was excellent.  A mix of salsa - both Cuban and traditional, bachata, chacha; even some Mexican folk music.

Service:  many of the Yelp reviews mention poor bar service.  I see why.  While I didn't have much trouble getting served (as some report), the service did come with an attitude.  Unsure if these bar tenders make much $ off of tips, but... if not, I can see why.

The Venue:  love it.  A wonderful space for a restaurant, outdoor cigar bar and salsa club.  The dance floor was small; but the layout of the cigar area and restaurant lent to an interesting mixed use.

For me it would be a "No" about going back EXCEPT for the music.  The salsa wasn't good enough; too many non-dancers tromping around in the way on the floor; WAY too hot; and mediocre bar service = nah. Not worth it.  But for the right band, good friends and a great cigar, I'd tolerate it.
author: M F.

description: One of the WORST bar service experiences you will encounter. Take your business one block in any direction to a much finer establishment.
author: Karl J.

description: Aside from the fact that I don't like cigar smoke and reaked like the smoke after, I actually enjoyed this place. My brother and I came here on a Wednesday night for the live band, a few drinks, and cigars (for him). At times, the music was too loud for conversation but if you sit farther back at the bar, that should be no problem. Great place overall with lots of men in business casual attire.
author: Eva G.

description:
Salsa Friday night. Live band was good. Great dance floor. It does get quite hot so wear light clothing. It gets quite crowded, but you'll still have a good time. 
All night was salsa with exception of about three or four merengue songs. 
If you're visiting from out of town and want to get your salsa fix, this will do it.
author: Zabdi G.

description:
Great spot to enjoy a cigar. They have a nice outdoor courtyard with a small fountain and radiant heaters for cooler days.

Very nice selection of single malt scotches and other liqours.

They have a very nice, friendly, helpful staff.
author: Phil M.

description:
After several recommendations, my wife & I went to The Cigar Bar & Grill for date night. While we did enjoy ourselves, we found it to be more casual than we expected. While the food was good and well priced, the portions were small. The cigar selection was lacking and the humidor wasn't up to par for the name of the place. 

Advice: Bring your own cigars, eat before you come and enjoy the experience.
author: Kyrah A.

description:
The Cigar Bar is a lot like life in general: at some points thrilling and pleasurable, at other times: a total let down. And in the midst of trying to figure out whether it's good or bad, all you're left to do is shrug your shoulders and take it in, moment by moment. 

So yeah, there's some cool things about Cigar Bar. Happy hour, decent cocktail list, live music on the weekends, AND the fact that all the European men in SF seem to flock here to puff away on their cancer sticks and talk passionately into their cell phones in the outdoor courtyard. A very welcome break from the hipster-ridden bar scene.

The food is just okay. We had the ceviche which turned out to be a plate of tortilla chips with some soupy raw fish in the middle. Sad. The carmelized plantains almost made up for it - they were pillowy soft and perfectly decadent.

When it came time to pay with our "coupon" (which we mentioned to our waitress as soon as we sat down) the guy behind the bar made a big, extravagant fuss over it. We were like...."Ummm, is he okay?" It seemed like we really ruined his night with that little coupon. Awkward to the max. 

Did I mention the hoards of well-dressed, Mediterranean-sun-kissed business men? Redemption is a beautiful thing.
author: Nique F.

description:
We had a company party here and reserved a small room and outdoor table. The space was perfect for our size group. We were able to get a second outdoor table, as well, which was very accommodating. The drinks were great and the food was good. We had two service dogs in the group, and they were able to comfortably enjoy the outdoor patio too, with no issues whatsoever. The server was friendly and explained the drink menu to each person!

The only thing I would improve would be to have two servers initially for that size group and have the food ready at the designated time.

I would arrange another party here in the future.
author: Brita L.

description: Perfect salsa night with a live band! Love the dance floor separate from the bar and dining. It was a great mix of place to grab a drink, smoke a cigar, outdoor patio, and dedicated dancing area. It was packed and a bit hot, but not unbearable. Excellent live band. Will be back!
author: Mashka I.

description: I'm not even a cigar guy but I dug this place.  All of the smoking is done in the outdoor patio so it's not overly smokey.  The salsa music was off the hook and everyone was in the mood to dance.  Nice crowd!  The whisky bar is well stocked and service was very quick.  If you can't have fun at this place you have a real problem.
author: Ajamu S.

description:
I really really like this place. Great drinks, nice staff, large open indoor spaces that has both a bar, lounge-y area, and dining tables, and then there's a courtyard in the outdoors area where you can enjoy a great cigar.

The live Latin music is also a blast and complements well with the energy here...

Would certainly come here again with good company, what a fun spot! And the cocktails are reasonably priced...$8-$11...Their Elderflower Cocktail is yummy!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Great place to hang if you like one or more of the following: 

-salsa dance
-Latin music
-cigars 
-whiskey 

I personally love salsa dancing and Latin music. When I first came to Cali my cousin took me to a bar, similar to Cigar bar and  introduced me to salsa dancing/ merengue. I was completely terrified but after a while I became obsessed. I love this bar! Will go again soon !!
author: Jennie C.

description: Love this place with all my heart. Love the ambiance and great service. This place reminds me of hometown in Ecuador, Great Salsa music, Great girls, Awesome drinks and cigars.
author: Roddy D.

description:
My cousins go here for happy hour, so that is exactly what we did. It helps that they also know Brandon, one of the bartenders. He's allegedly half-Filipino, but you would never guess. But that's beside the point.

Cigar Bar is a nice place with a pretty good vibe. I honestly can't speak too critically about it because I didn't get the tab. And drinking for free always roses up the glasses. I would guess that their drink prices are on par with other SF bars. You definitely want to come during happy hour. (I just visited their web site and it's pretty detailed, so I suggest checking there if you're interested).
author: Paolo D.

description: This place is amazing. The bartender Travis really knows his stuff. The outdoor area is awesome. The food..only had small bites but all excellent and the girl that worked at the bar after Travis' shift ended..the most accommodating and friendly bartender I've had in months. Whether you're coming from FiDi or coming for a great ambiance to smoke a cigar this is definitely the place to be. A+
author: Thomas S.

description: I love the live band and the relaxed atmosphere. I made reservations for my boyfriend's birthday. I asked the girl who took my reservation to have someone call me back regarding bottle service. No one called me back and I had to call back. The day of my reservations  they didnt have me down. I had a party of 8 and they were suppose to waive the entrance fee. They didn't and never found my reservation. To get a drink is mayhem. They need nore bartenders and waitresses. I would only go back for the music and the outside seating.
author: Maria G.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night. Pretty busy for happy hour, and died down towards 10pm. Live music, outside terrace was cool. Humidor with cigar selections was ok. Bartender helped find something for me.
author: Chris C.

description:
Don't come here unless you like smelling like cigars. I felt bad for the Lyft driver who took me home.

I guess it'd be good for large-ish groups as there's a big outdoor area as well as large tables inside. 

Highlight: Mid-size bottle of San Pellegrino for $2.50 - not bad!
author: Kira G.

description:
Great place to just hang out with friends, grab a drink, grab a cigar, grab some food, and grab a partner to dance - if you don't do all of the above, I'm sure you would do one.

I've been here twice, once for my best friend's birthday and once for my boyfriend's birthday. 

I love the atmosphere here even though I'm not a smoker, the patio area is really cute and open (and they have heat lamps for those cold San Francisco nights) and great for friends to gather just eat, drink, and smoke. I especially love the little room where there is a live band and a dance floor - I love it!

p.s I love the plantain, the sauce is delicious and I also love the chips and guacamole!
author: Mona L.

description: went here today. loved the vibe and seating area. Didn't order food this time. But one big question about this listing.. It says Vegetarians go nuts for this spot, but looking at their Offerings (menu) on Yelp I don't see veg options. Please let me know about this! Any Tacos type options?
author: Malvika B.

description: My husband and I went there on a date night and had a really good time. The bartender was very attentive and knowledgeable about the drinks. The extra plus was the live salsa music! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves a chill atmosphere with good music. We will be back!
author: Anita O.

description:
Monday night after an early evening downpour and the place looks empty.  No matter.  I just wanted to enjoy a cigar and cognac with my friend.  It is Monday night.  No reason for it to be so vibrant as I have seen it in the past.

I like to bring my own cigars to this place because 1) I have a good collection and 2) the selections they have are not worth the money you pay.

The service, as always, is average.  But, I don't come here for the service or food.  It has always been about the cognac, whiskey, and cigars, with the occasional live band and dancing to change things up.  Oh, how I've missed the Latin bands, dancing, and vibe this place can roost.

Dead on a rainy Monday night, but not gone!  To be continued...
author: Jules S.

description:
There aren't many cigar friendly venues in San Francisco proper, and this is where we go whenever we are in town.  The cocktails are fairly good, and the scotch and bourbon selections are more than satisfactory.  The food isn't incredible, but professionally prepared and good enough.

The cigars aren't cheap, but the prices are reasonable given California tobacco taxes and the surrounding area's cost of living.  We typically bring our own, and fortunately there's no cutting fee.

Service can be better, but this is a trade off we are willing to accept to smoke in peace in San Francisco.
author: Zino D.

description:
Tip: on Friday and Saturdays, especially if it's a popular band like Borinquen, you'll encounter a line that won't budge... and that line will start pretty early, ~10:30pm (only reason I subtracted a star).

Yes, it's a cigar bar. I hate the smoke, I hate the smell, and I have to hop in the shower as soon as I get home. Anything I wear that night goes straight into the laundry hamper or to the drycleaners. My dog wrinkles her nose at me, judging me with those sad brown eyes, as soon as I try to slip into my apartment in the wee hours. But. Duh. It's a Cigar Bar. I knew this going in.

On Fridays and Saturday, I'll pick Cigar Bar over Cocomo's every time. Cigar Bar's dancefloor is a postage stamp compared to Cocomo's (and it can get bloody hot in the danceroom!), but the crowd and atmosphere are just... easier. The patio area is a nice space to just chill, enjoy a bevvie with friends, and cool off. If you're brand new to salsa and hoping to learn, Cigar Bar is probably not the easiest place to start (try Taste at Cocomo's on Fridays), but if you have a few basic steps already under your belt, go to Cigar Bar. It's usually a well-dressed, good-looking crowd, 30-35ish, a little sprinkling of euro-trash turned fidi/tech types, and average to occasionally excellent dancers.
author: Miss M.

description:
They have a fairly good selection of cigars. If you like to be able to smoke in a courtyard setting while you drink, this will work nicely. 

Drink pours are better at bar than tables, though. Food was pretty good. Staff was friendly.
author: Marcus J.

description: I usually come here for salsa on Saturday nights, fridays are good too. The dance floor isn't the biggest, and gets crowded quickly. The cover is 10 bucks if I remmeber correctly, which is pretty decent. The drinks are good too, but as with all bars in sf, it can get expensive. I really like the fact that you can go dance your heart out on the dance floor, and then go to a different part of the venue to just chill and relax. The only downside is that their restroom is really small for such a large establishments. It is what it is I suppose. Parking is really bad as with most places in sf, your best bet is one of the garages nearby. This surrounding area is kind of sketchy at the end of the night so I dnt recommend walking out alone. You will meet new people every week so it's a fun place to go mingle.
author: Satwinder B.

description:
Love this place - it's one of the premier cigar bars in San Francisco and really one of the best places in all of Northern California to smoke cigars, cigarettes, have a drink and also has great food. 

I've been here several times since my last review and I love it again. The bartenders are cool and personable, great selection of cigars and there are so many places to sit, chill, smoke, and hang out w/ friends.
author: Rew C.

description: Terrible place in terms of having a chance to get in.  Waited in line for over an hour to get in after talking with the door guy and then watching at least 20+ people get in who weren't even in line. This is definitely an LA scene type of line if you're into that. Plan on waiting at least 2 hours or bribing the door guy to get in on the weekend. Terribly miss Club Cocomo where this was not an issue. Please someone open another salsa venue!!
author: Colleen D.

description: A few of my friends brought me to this place. I am not a big fan of cigars, but this place is really cool. The drinks are good and the music is great. This is a good place to unwind and hang out. If the weather permits the outside seating is the way to go. Make sure to leave a big tip for the excellent and attentive wait staff!
author: Charles B.

description:
I have been going to Cigar bar for a while now and never miss the opportunity to invite and recommend others to check it out. In fact, I am having my Birthday party there this Friday 11/14! On the weekends they have alive salsa band which are always so much fun. Their tapa menu is also delicious  and the ambiance is right up there with it.
Lets hope my Birthday is equally enjoyable as all my past visits!
author: Esther B.

description:
Two stars because I've had decent experiences previously and my horrible experience was due to a single (possibly drunk) employee. 

We came in last Tuesday for happy hour. At first, we were served by the bar tender with dark hair and a beard, who was fine. The light haired bar tender was taking shots. He eventually took over serving us. When the bill came, he took off 10% for happy hour food instead of the $2 per item (over 20% off). 

We politely said that we thought there was an error. He took the bill to fix it, came back, threw it in front of us and said "Here's the buck you saved." In addition to being incredibly rude (especially since it was his error), this didn't make sense mathematically. 

I looked at the bill and saw he only discounted one item. I said that I thought the discount applied to each happy hour item not the total. 

He grabbed the bill, said he was not revising it again and then threw down singles from his pocket and said "there, now we are even." 

If a server makes an error on the bill, the only proper response is "I'm sorry, let me fix that", especially at a restaurant/bar that is supposed to be nice. The fact that this employee twice responded with such rudeness (when we were polite and good nurtured about the error - I've worked in restaurants before and know that mistakes sometimes happen) is shocking to me.
author: Mr. X.

description:
The Dish: I came here for a fraternity happy hour. They served the best meat quesadillas, bruschetta, and crab cakes. Oh, and their nachos - I've never tasted anything like it. Amazing dip and amazing flavored nachos. The drinks were alright. I didn't have any of the beer, but the tequila shot we had went down really smoothly. However, the sangria was very watered-down as were the other drinks my friends got.

Ambience: The service was AWESOME - and I'm comparing this with my experience at Lake Chalet (when we had a banquet). They moved around us and didn't complain at all. They smiled the whole time and asked every single person if they wanted food to eat and carried around crab cakes/brushetta everywhere. The only thing that prevents me from giving it a full 5 stars (besides the watered-down drinks) is the cigar smell. It's probably something that is part of the ambience and not really something that can be changed, but I couldn't stand the smell. It wasn't suffocating, but still, it wasn't pleasant.
author: Gina T.

description:
Cigar Bar has an inviting atmosphere right on the border where FiDi becomes North Beach, without being on that stretch with all the strip clubs. (Darn.) 

The place has a bountiful wine and cocktail selection, the Smoke & Mirrors was my personal favorite. The tapas were a bit pricey, and unfortunately, not all that filling without ordering multiple plates at $10-$17 a pop. I'd recommend this plate for drinks or light eaters.
author: Kevin B.

description: This place is so bad.  The door man is so pathetic.  The drinks are water down and their cigar selection are sweet tip convenient store quality
author: Seth J.

description:
Can't stop raving about this place.  On the one hand, it's a wonderful spot for a date night: margaritas, mojitos, and a live band?  YES, PLEASE!  On the other, it's a fantastic spot to have a birthday dinners.  Surprised?  Me too!

It was less than a week before my birthday and I had no idea what I wanted to do.  My boyfriend suggested having Cigar Bar as a meeting place for dancing and drinks.  After reviewing and noticing that they also served dinner, I was in.

Emailed Amanda - the host to book a party of 8 for dinner.  She was responsive: quick and very helpful, never being upset when we asked to be moved outside (if there were heat lamps - there were) as well as increasing our party to 10 (when we arrived we were almost 13 in total).

We all had an amazing time: great service, fun music, smoked amazing cigars... Always happy to come back and would definitely encourage people to come.

PS. The Cigar smoke does tend to get heavy out in the patio area, but on the dance floor you barely smell it.  They also cut cigars, as well as charge $10 after 9:30 to pay the band (it's a pretty low cost for awesome live music)!
author: Liz A.

description:
Based on service, cleanliness and prices alone, I would have to give this place an easy 5-star review.  The wait staff was friendly, attentive, and gave me a free beer when they mixed up my order.  

The sliders and fries were awesome.  Excellent for the price point.  The fries were skinny and crispy.

I had to take a star away for the crowd here.  The people seemed nice enough, but at the same time pretty nerdy.  The people you'll find here on a friday night is full of 40-somethings and tech people.  Not that there's anything wrong with that, but I like to drink with people who are actually social.  

I will come back again.
author: Richard T.

description:
I really like hanging out at this place. The Latin music they play reminds me of The Buena Vista Social Club. The fountain they have outside is nifty and across the fountain there's a room with comfy couches where you can hang out with your friends.   It is also conveniently located near a bunch of pizza shops in case you have the late night drunken munchies. There's a strip club just up the hill if you're a man who has never seen a pair of boobies before.  

The drinks were pretty reasonable for San Francisco pricing standards and the noise level isn't that loud so you could actually have a normal conversation with your friend or date. They have this closet full of different types of cigars.  I really liked the one with the chocolate aftertaste amd was like a zero calorie indulgence.  I do not recommend this place if you have asthma or allergy issues.  The smoke can really get intense.  This is definitely one of my favorite spots in North Beach.
author: Shirleyanne A.

description: I love it here. Great alcohol, and my clients all enjoy a cigar after doing business. Great way to wind down along day!
author: Joseph H.

description:
This was my first cigar bar experience. 

My party and I were seated in the back room area and it was a HOT BOX of smoke. We waited for a waitress to come get my friends and I some chairs to join the dining party, but it took them awhile to even notice us in the back room.  We were able to flag a waitress down and make the chair request, but it took to long. Thus a few of us, went to the front bar area and sat to dine there instead. It was a smoke free zone in front, so it made the dinner a bit more bearable. Again, it took awhile to flag a waitress down, but we were able to place our dinner order in with drinks.  I was able to try the 3 mini sliders, fried calamari, scallop over mash potato and steak. The scallop was my favorite dish! 

I would suggest asking for a table out doors, so it would be more breathable and bearable if you are having dinner. 

After 9:30 or 10pm?  They start charging a cover to come in and you are no longer able to smoke inside anymore. They also have a live band that comes in and plays salsa music. 

Not my type of dine, smoke and drink location. But def recommend coming after 10 for drinks and dancing!
author: Chanel L.

description:
Let me start by saying this review is not for Cigar Bar, nor the owners, nor the awesome drinks and food. I frequent this establishment often, and will probably continue to do so even after the following incident.This review is for Elena, the bitchy waitress that we had the misfortune of meeting about 4 weeks ago. 

We came early on a Saturday around 8:30pm. The crowd was not insane, and Cigar Bar was fairly mellow. I came in with a group of 5 (myself included), and easily found a table. After waiting 10 minutes for a waiter, my friends and I decided to order drinks at the bar. Drink one was done, but our waiter was nowhere in sight. Finally after asking a busser if he could help us find out who would serve us, Elena arrived to our table. Her initial greeting was dry and distant, and made us feel like she must have other important things to do other than deal with our order. Strike one. Strike two happened when one of my friends asked if Elena could add a new drink to her open tab at the bar. Elena replied that this was impossible, and that my friend would need to close the tab before continuing to order. Not a biggie except that my friend still wanted to order a drink while she closed her tab. Elena refused. Instead she insisted that my friend close her tab first, and then she would come back and take our order. With that, Miss Thang turned and walked away. The rest of us didn't even have a chance to order food, or anything simply because Elena decided to call the shots. 

I understand policies whatever, but why not allow my friend to simply order a new drink on our groups tab while she collected her card from the bar? Why not let the rest of us order in the meantime? Again, Cigar Bar was not busy, Elena had one other table (I watched her since I was quite taken aback by her behaviour) and there was no reason to postpone service. Strike three happened when Elena took about 30 minutes to return to our table, to finally take our order. Not cool, especially when my friends and I regularly spend a pretty penny at Cigar Bar, and are pretty awesome tippers. We left the restaurant questioning whether we would return, but alas one waitress does not reflect Cigar Bar as a whole. 

I'll just Yelp my experience so that if Elena ever reads this she can whip into shape, and maybe the next table she serves will fare much better.
author: Gabriella C.

description:
I don't even know what to say about this place. Perhaps I should copy & paste texts from my friend about how this place is perfect for me.

But perhaps, what sums it up is entering the place to be greeted by about 30 men staring at me up and down and my friend at the end of the bar, well-cut James Bond type, taking a shot/laughing and proclaiming how this place is a huge #fail for him trying to get girls and a huge #win for girls trying to talk to men. 

Oh, it only got more ridiculous as I walked around the smoking room and the salsa room. At least people know how to dance. Guys, learn to dance or miss out on the fun!

Did I mention the Calvin Klein looking guy? And the other hottie smoking...and the other guys by the wall with eyes shining vacancy looking for a dance partner. 

No, seriously, we came to the conclusion that you better start selling your stock if you wish to get more than a few words with a lady...and we sipped our drinks!

Disproportionate ratio of men:women. Haha. I loved it. 

Oh another note, I love being able to smoke and be so close to the bar and to the dance room. Genius idea!
author: Alexia R.

description:
Fantastic place for a group of friends to get together. You can either watch a sports game or celebrate a fun night/afternoon with drinks and food. 

The menu is pretty much American food. 

Warning the outside patio is meant for people who smoke cigars, so if you are bothered by the smell, I don't recommend this place for you.
author: Sepi N.

description:
I enjoyed this place!  

Come for happy hour.  Stay for salsa dancing and their live music.
author: Pam S.

description:
Really like the remodeled Cigar Bar & Grill.  I have been there many times, but not in the last 6 or 7 years due to intense work schedule.  And I was very pleasantly surprised.  They have added a soundproof glass entrance to the courtyard, which keeps the noise level down for the new condos across the street, but more importantly it minimizes wind in the courtyard.  There are also waitresses now, which is a huge convenience factor.  And, of course, there is a dance floor with 2nd bar and coat check where before there were offices full of cubicles.  I'd say they have roughly doubled their floor space from the old days.

Top-flight Latin bands, as always (Josh Jones Ensemble on the Saturday night I was there).  High energy, great cocktails, semi-enclosed cigar smoking courtyard, and a fairly well-stocked humidor.  I'll be going there as often as time permits.
author: Boso Z.

description: Loving this place right now. Grabed a few small plates (plantains, deviled eggs and fries) a drink and a cigar. Food was good, service was better. Salsa dancing was an added bonus. Overall a good time
author: Sabrina R.

description: This is probably one of the very few remaining bars in SF where you can enjoy a smoke after a satisfying meal with a nice glass of wine on a cozy heated patio. We had a great time there!
author: Violeta H.

description: Live music on Friday nights with good appetizers and drinks! A group of friends took me out here for my birthday on Friday night and we all had a great time dancing to live salsa music!
author: Kyle P.

description:
I went here one night with a friend to finally try this place out. We got a couple of cigars, some drinks, and a lot of food. My friend got braces that same week so I was basically eating for two. We ordered the bruschetta, which was pretty good. Can't say I've had bruschetta with spanish chorizo before. My friend ordered the risotto and I the scallops. The scallops weren't anything special, but the risotto was excellent. I highly recommend it. 

I will most likely come back here again. It's a cool, chill place. I'm not much of a smoker and don't mind a cigar now and again. I do think this is a great place to go for just that, a drink and food.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
I LOVE Cigar bar and Grill! Me and my husband go here very often. I recently booked cigar bar to celebrate my husbands 30th birthday. Amanda, the manager helped me out through the process of booking this place and was very helpful. On the dat of the party we had Brent helping us out and he was phenomenal!! I had around 30 guests and Brent was getting the drink orders almost nonstop. The whole event went off smoothly and the service was great. The live band and salsa dancing in the end is always fun even though I am not a salsa dancer. I definitely recommend this place if you want to have a private party of just hang out there.

And btw, "Tears and Tequila" is my FAVORITE drink here. Must try!
author: Shruti L.

description: Came here for a GNO on Salsa night. Had a great time...the live music was excellent, large (but packed) dance floor, several bars, lots of seating areas, outside patio area for the smokers, and an overall good vibe. A nice eclectic crowd, something (or someONE...;-) ) for everyone! There is a cover charge to get in, I think it was $10 but check on that to be sure. Didn't eat here so not sure about the food, but we had hella fun and I'm sure we'll be back!
author: Malissa D.

description:
I'd been here with a friend once before and this was where I told myself I gotta learn salsa. After paying the $7 cover, our group arrived to a packed to the brim bar but luckily managed to get a bar seat after a little while.

I was really hungry but was fortunate enough to dig into B's tortilla chips. Thank you B !!! The chips were surprisingly really good (thin, crispy, and lightly spiced), salsa fresco just right, and the guac was very very fresh and amazing; not much spices or additives to mask the fresh avocado flavour.

For me, the (shoe-string) fries with garlic and herbs were the highlight.  Whenever I drop in there, I promise I will always have these fries. By the way it also comes with your burgers (and some other dishes). I loved it!

The sliders were really tasty and juicy; the patties were medium done and pink and moist inside, and the little buns were lightly toasted and slightly crunchy outside.

The quesadilla was I think made using spinach dough (it was greenish) and went very well with the accompanying spanish rice, salsa, refried beans, and the spicy sauce on it. It did not disappoint at all. Though I am not sure they gave me chicken as requested since I just didn't taste the chicken at all. But it was still very good.

I had a couple of drinks --- the pomagranito and the new age oranj. Both were good though I preferred the Oranj.

I tried to dance a little bit of salsa with D "Muchacha Sucia," and was reminded how I still have two left feet. Oh well, I can't have everything!
author: Umesh T.

description: Favourite bar in San Francisco. Especially El Dorado 21 yrs rum and Monte Cristo cigar combination is enough reason to love here!
author: Canel B.

description:
There was a decent salsa band that saved the place, but first of all.. there is no selection on cigars.  Come on guys... a dozen cigar choices does NOT allow you call yourself a cigar bar.   If you know your cigars, you probably would only be marginally happy here.   Next.. I wasn't very happy with the drink choices, so I pretty much ordered a glass of sangria, that really after learning its cost, I didn't want to pay for.  Look you guys.. Sangria is suppose to CHEAP wine with a dash of orange juice and some sweet... good grief.. are your clientele really that clueless?  Fun with be with whom you interact with, not with the place.  
Not a place for a real getaway unless you show up really early.  cough cough.
author: Tito Y.

description:
First time we went with my friends, the owner doesn't have respect for women, the band did a break and we approach to him to ask if they have a back up for the music, until we wait for the band back.
 He was so mad, grumpy, and told us if we don't like it, just leave my place, we doesn't have manner's, no respect, no customer service at all. BAD !!
author: Aida A.

description: I LOVE this place. Been here about 5 times and each time was a great experience. Ambiance is really cool, I love being able to sit, smoke, drink and munch on the yummys. They have a few great Belgian beers and the bar tender was knowledgeable and happy to give recommendations. The servers have been friendly and attentive regardless of how busy. When my group has made it clear that we won't need service they leave us alone which I love!! The music is such a great addition to an already amazing and unique atmosphere. Although the majority of customers are somewhat obnoxious men, you can't expect much different from a "cigar bar". Overall, this is absolutely a place I would and will come back to again and again.
author: O M.

description:
I usually do not place reviews but I am so upset with my experience yesterday.  The ambiance is nice.  The layout of the bar is great with a heated outdoor area in the center.  If you are into salsa dancing, it has its own separate area. My issue is the service, particularly the bartenders.  They are rude and use their position to harass the customers.

I was with my boyfriend, his family and friends. We were just sitting around a table talking and laughing.  My boyfriend had a vape, and if you know anything about vapes, they come in various sizes. Okay, we are in a cigar bar, so one would assume you could smoke a vape. For goodness sake if you are allowed to puff on a stinky cigar that puts tobacco in the air, what's the problem with vapor? One bartender passed by and rudely told him to stop smoking his vapor, which he did.  My boyfriend has a pretty big device so he couldn't fit it in his pocket.  He held it in his hand the rest of the night and did not puff on it.  One bartender walks by and says "you've been warned" as if he was threatening us for a fight.  Then second bartender comes up with a security guard and is yelling at us.  When we told them he wasn't even smoking the vape just holding it because it wouldn't fit in his pocket, his response was "he shouldn't be holding it then."YOU have to be kidding me, if they were doing their job and actually watching us instead of making assumptions, they would have known we were abiding by the rules. I definitely felt harassed and wrongfully accused.  They could've handled the situation better.  

Because of this, I will not be coming back. I don't want to deal with douche bag bartenders on my night out, and I will definitely be spreading the word!
author: Amanda D.

description:
i had been coming here sense 2013, the reason is its across the street to my house and they will "let" me smoke my pipe in the patio. Their cigar selection nor their service  has never really been very good, and their food is NOT anything to write home about, its not disgusting, but its very average for a not average price.  after coming here sometimes every single night, just as a nice relax after work,  i decide to go on saturday night, just want to relax with a pipe, walk across the street try to go in, when some door man tells me there is a "dress code" i have on all Lacoste, my socks alone cost more than that doormans goodwill suit, yet he refuses to let me in because.. i have shorts on?! are you kidding me? i have a button down collard shirt, clean shaven, and nice shorts and your really going to pick on that? what difference in the world could it possibly make if i sit at a table, outside, where its STILL hot ??  is someone going to look and say, OMG look at the guy in shorts, lets all not come here anymore because someone is not wearing dress pants ! mind you its one of the hottest days ever recorded in San Francisco,... I've been coming here for three years, (with shorts on) and work clothes and never had an issue.  so i call thinking that ill just talk to them, and theres just a misunderstanding, after telling the girl on the phone about the interaction and she just says "ok" and a long pause. thats it. 
I am so sick and tired of this "the customer is always wrong" attitude. this is NOT a high class place, its a bar. You can't serve Costco frenchfries for 12 bux and try to put on some facade that your an exclusive fancy dining experience, your a tiny bar, in the basement of a building with some hand written signs with a sharpie on some paper bag. you have a few regular customers that come a few times a week, pay to keep your lights on and your lease. once in a while you get a live "band" that looks like the buskers in the bart station... yet Thats really how your going to treat a regular customer ? No actually your not. because i will never set foot in your place ever again. and if ONE person reads this and decides to go to Occidental instead, where i should have just gone in the first place, then its worth it to write this review.  The food is over priced and very average, the service has never been very good as for some stupid reason the waitresses claim to be completely different then the bar staff so if you order at the bar the waitress won't help you, the seating is crappy wood chairs, like sitting on a rock and they have a very poor selection of cigars for a cigar bar. Overlooking all these things i kept going because i could smoke there, but after being treated like some kind of crazy bum, never again. From now on I'm going to occidental.
author: Scrapp H.

description:
what a fun place to come with a large group! Got together with gal pals here last night, and I had an amazing time. I really enjoyed the openness and warmth of the venue, and even though it's a cigar bar, I didn't smell like smoke upon departure. huge win in my book. 

i also enjoyed the drinks. unfortunately, i arrived just a tad past 7 so missed the HH, but i splurged on drinks and enjoyed them. the mojito was a tad sweet, but i'd order it again. i was a good level of tipsy after two drinks which was just right. enough to loosen up, yet not so much so that i couldn't class it back up and walk in a straight line back to montgomery bart station. 

and apparently they have salsa music on the weekends?! i will be back.
author: Jennifer O.
