description: This place used to have a good reputation. Today, this is no longer the same place that it used to be. I visited this establishment on Saturday, March 4th, 2017. I stopped by around midnight. The place was empty, yet they charged a 10 dollar cover. The people working at the door were rude and dressed unprofessionally (baggy clothes, shirts not tucked in -- no style for a place that claims to have class). I do not drink, I was there for a birthday celebration. At one point, I stepped outside for a cigarette and when I tried to re-enter, the same lady guard that checked my ID tried to deny re-entry, although my hand was stamped. She went far enough to say that it's not their stamp. Only when the cashier reluctantly nodded at her, she let me back in, without even apologizing. Several of my friends stopped by some time later and one of them was denied entry, because he was wearing sneakers...yet, he was dressed better than any of the people working at this place. When the birthday guy tried to argue with the door personnel to let our friend, wearing sneakers, inside -- the birthday guy was kicked out. The birthday guy refused to leave without a refund of the cover charge and sat down at one of the tables. Few minutes later, roughly 6 goons, working for this establishment surrounded our group and essentially forced the birthday guy to leave. As a result, 8 of us had to leave as well after having paid 10 bucks a person. I will get everyone to post a negative review for this place from our group. I should also mention that I am myself 35 years old, and most people in our group were of the same age. We did not act inappropriately or irresponsibly at any time. I am sure that the administration of this establishment will respond to my review with some fake claims, trying to justify their actions. I strongly recommend to anyone with self-respect to avoid this place. There are several other decent bars in the area.
author: Sergey A.

description: The food isn't bad but the ambiance is great. They have a bar area, a heated outdoor smoking lounge and an indoor dance floor. This place is sweet. It was a great surprise when stopping thru SF.  Salsa music and dancing.
author: Johnny D.

description: Atmosphere is nice but very bare. Service was horrible (took ages between check ins despite an empty house, made us split up check (5 max), spilled a drink on my friend), and the servings were fairly small for the price. Drinks were food, so was the garlic fries and guac. I guess its more of a place for smoking cigars than anything else, cause they sure don't bother patrons very much.
author: Conor S.

description:
This place is one of the reasons I anticipate my visits to San Francisco. Just a beautiful place with a latin feel.

There's a live band accompanied with acoustic guitars, and well-dressed patrons that are there to socialize and have a good time.

Great place to have a quick bite and enjoy the drinks and cigars.

I'm personally not a cigar smoker, but boy did I have a great time puffing my Montecristo! The staff is upbeat, very likeable, attractive, and very helpful when trying to figure out what you want.

A great place for a good time!
author: Maggie K.

description: I been in this place a few times when visiting San Francisco! Unfortunately  in Los Angeles, there is no atmospheric places like this:-( Here everything is great: people, cigars, mood, music, food. I want to commend the work of bartenders because cocktails were amazing and delicious. Bravo!
author: Ann M.

description:
I recently celebrated my fiance's birthday at Cigar Bar. I called to make a reservation for a group of 20 and they were great accommodating our group with such short notice. Amanda was awesome! 

When we arrived there was no hostess so we stood around the bar waiting for someone to help us, greet us, acknowledge us.. something!  I know they saw us and it wasn't crowded at all so I thought that was rude. Finally, when someone did talk to us they weren't very friendly. We reserved a room which we needed to meet a minimum for. They told us since it was a slow night they were going to close the kitchen early so I asked if we still needed to meet the minimum and they said yes in a rude way. Ugh.. how are we going to meet that minimum in such a short amount of time?? So finally after the first hour they said we no longer needed to meet the minimum so everything worked out. 

We went during the week and it really was slow. They seemed to be understaffed and their waiters/waitresses can work on being more friendly. Other than that, the food was typical bar food - wasn't bad and wasn't great. Overall, it was suuper chill and my fiancé got to enjoy his cigars with great company.
author: Valerie O.

description: Nice spot.. good vibe.. great dancing!!
author: Sheila D.

description:
After picking up the cigar habit from a visit in sin city I was looking for smoke friendly places. I recalled this place from the good old days when I use to reside in SF. The drinks are better here and the mojito is one of the better one's in the city (read strong) I even tried the one with top shelf rum (forgot the name) and I think it was not an upgrade over the regular version. I haven't tried any food there but did go through the cigars they have I guess they are priced ok for place bar. The think I like about this spot is they follow instructions so if you are picky about how you want your drinks this place is good.
The entry fee for the LIVE band is a cash grab IMO as all the people are not here from dance and music.
author: Elvis A.

description: I have been going to Cigar Bar for many years. I love the airy patio in the middle of the place and the disposition of the building reminds me of some old Italian Villa. I usually go there for their salsa night, staff is always nice and capable. But not last night. Last night I received the worst customer service ever!! I am a manager in a upscale restaurant in SF and watching a person behaving like that made me incredibly mad. So this is what happened: it was around 1:30, the place was closing, my husband and I with another couple went to close our tabs. There was a guy behind the bar, asian, an absolute clown with an arrogant attitude and no idea at all of what customer service is. He asked for my last name, and since I have two on my credit card, I told him both. He looked at me like I was an idiot and mumbled something about picking a f###ing last name. I was in shock! But that was not it. It was my friend turn! When she asked to close her tab he answered that he didn't have her cc. She asked again, she spelled her last name but the guy was so full of himself, acting like the king of the bar, arrogant, awful, kept saying he didn't have it. She even pointed her cc that was in a glass but nothing.. I couldn't believe my eyes! He was just standing there giving us attitude instead of looking for the effing card (which he had!!!) My friend's husband lost his patience, not  because of the fact that the he couldn't find her cc but merely because of the guy's attitude!! It was too much!! My friend yelled the guy to stop being an ass, put himself together and try to find the cc instead of being a clown. Guess what he did? Call the bouncer and kick my friend out! He treated us like trash! It was just unbelievable! I hope my review will get to the right person. What happened yesterday goes against any principle of the industry and was a total shame for such a nice bar!
author: Ashley W.

description:
Salsa Dancing!!!  When I peered onto the dance floor, I was immediately mesmerized by the seasoned dancers that were showing off their moves.  I've taken salsa lessons before, but my skills were nowhere near these guys.  I was having enough fun just standing there watching these couples make their moves look like they flowed out of them as naturally as walking down the street.  (Ahem.. Sorry for lack of a better analogy!)

We spent a good amount of time in there and I'd like to personally thank the guys who entertained me by letting me watch them smoke cigars for the first time.  Please note:  If you smoke a cigar, you are supposed to cut the tip first.  I witnessed and laughed at the said friend of the guy who tried to light and smoke a cigar without cutting the tip off.  Wondering what was wrong, he looked at his friend who instead of puffing his own cigar, *inhaled* it instead because he wanted to get a "taste".  Much to my own amusement, the guy who inhaled his cigar told his friend to cut the tip off first and come back.  When he came back, I assumed he didn't know how much he was supposed to cut off because he cut off about an inch, leaving only about two thirds of the cigar left.  Needless to say, these guys were such good sports and asked me take pictures of them with their cigars in their mouths, chronicling their first cigar experience.  

Good times..
author: Lorie N.

description: Great spot. Good music. Nice selection on cigars. The price for drinks and cigars were very reasonable. They did have a cover but they had live salsa band. Would recommend it for groups. Nice patio area.
author: Josh F.

description: I love coming here for a good cigar with great people and some wonderful tequila with fresh sqeezed lime and orange NO ICE.  The open sky is wonderful and the cobblestone seems like you've time warped to a different era.. except when it's time to go...then its back to reality. I always have a great time here.
author: C. G.

description:
I've visited this place about 3 time and I love it. It's a pretty chill spot and you get a little of everything. 
The food isn't the best but it's not close to being the worst. We ended up trying the Spicy chicken wings which were good. The Fried plantains with black beans and sour cream where on point... Almost a dessert. I'm Salvadorean and trust me when I say they were good! Their meatballs where also good. Overall their tapas are good. I also got two Mojito now that I will say wasn't consistent. The first one tasted like a straight up mixer and the second one was straight Bacardi. So my diet coke and Bacardi was my drink of the night.
As far as cigars go I don't think they have a wide selection but some of them are good. If you're a huge aficionado you're better off bringing your own. The patio does get pretty packed after 11 so if you can catch stable before then you will be set.
The music is always great! I love to salsa dance and there's nothing better than a live band which they always have. The dance floor is super big but it's big enough so bring some comfy shoes. 
Overall this place is fun and pretty diverse!
author: Alicia M.

description: Poor selection of cigars and only 2 draft lines. Not sure how you call yourself a cigar bar and all you have is a case humidor. The patio was nice as well as the bartender. Build a humidor and offer more craft brew and the professionals will come.
author: Todd A.

description: Great tacos and drinks. Mediocre service. Awesome music and relaxing atmosphere. Nice place for date night!
author: Carie H.

description: It's 5 de mayo and We waited around the nieghborhood to arrive at this venue only so the bouncer MIKE would not allow us in claiming that out friend was intoxicated when we have been in the city for one hour, didn't ask for an ID or a sobriety test just made a quick judgement because we all had sombreros on for the holiday. He refused to share his name or allow us to ask for a manager. If this venue does not care for its Hispanic customers they should not run a venue only allowing white customers. They were racist against the Hispanic and black community and you should not support such q business
author: Alejandra B.

description:
OK I know this is going to be a LAME thing to say, but I wish they could block off the cigar smoking guests, and the rest of us who don't like the smell, or second hand smoke from cigarettes! 

Yes, its a CIGAR bar, but still... people also go for that adorable courtyard that they have their.  Had some drinks with old co-workers and had a grand ol' time sipping on my great white shark?? (great new find, im a beer noob) but HATED the fact that everyone could smoke cigars and cigarettes - yes, lame comment.. but still true!

Glad we didn't pay cover (reading other reviews, but sounds like its only a sat night thing) - got there early enough to get a big table outside reserved for our large party and got some chips and dip.

PRO - outdoors, relaxing sound of the water from the fountain and can enjoy some vitamin d on a sunny day.

CON - need to deal with the smell of smoke
author: Melody T.

description: We had drinks,  the specials for the day was yumm and a great deal.  The salsa live band and dancing was funn. Love the vibe and service.  Would go back for sure.
author: Kay P.

description:
Total Destination Spot.

The name could be slightly deceiving. Although they have a few cigars sold in their humidor cabinet, the selection is limited and the upkeep on the humidor isn't exactly the best. I suggested you bring your own cigars. There is no indoor smoking, but there is a large heated patio where there is seating and cigarette ashtrays.

Although they bring in a nice crowd with the full bar, live music, and lunch/dinner menu the setting is more social than it is lounge like. It's a great place to have dinner, drinks, dessert, and top it off with the convenience of a nice smoke, but not really a spot for a regular cigar smoker looking for a cigar lounge to sit back and enjoy.

I will remain a returning customer.
author: Jacquelyn G.

description: After a sad experience not being able to get in for a friend's birthday, the manager was kind enough to get in touch and apologize/invite us back to try it out again. Really appreciate him going above and beyond, and taking the time to respond. Looking forward to going back and giving it another try.
author: Callie R.

description:
Went there on a Friday night with a friend and we didn't know what to expect.  All we heard was that it was salsa night with a live band.  Sounds good to me!  We got there around 7:30PM and the place had somewhat of a mixed crowd.  The table situation was a little off and we weren't sure if we sat ourselves or not since we actually wanted some dinner.  There was no hostess.  

We go to the bar and asked if we can order food there and the bartender gave us a snooty response.  We ordered our drinks there and then snagged a table when it opened.  That all just seems very unorganized.

Food: The fish and chips were not good. The fish was way fishy and lacked all sorts of flavor.  Their house made tarter sauce was no better.  My friend had the scallops and they were not all that either.  Just blah. 

Service: Our waitress couldn't be any more fake.  She turned on the smile as soon as she came to our table, but you just know when someone is not genuine.  I mean, if you're not having a good night, just be pleasant, don't need to fake it.  The bartender, well, she's just a little too sarcastic for my taste.  I asked a legitimate question, you don't have to be smart about it.  

Overall: The band that played was pretty awesome.  The patrons can be a little rude when it comes to giving you space to dance. I was choking with the cigar/cigarette smoke from the patio by the end of the night.  The place is fun, but skip the food and you gotta just deal with the smoke.
author: Meshell C.

description:
Update to my original post. After reading my review and the incident that occurred, the management reached out to me and formally apologized to my friend and me. They offered to pay for the dry cleaning as well. 

This was quite gracious on their part, as they assured me that they spoke with their waitstaff about how to react when an incident occurs.

Definitely looking forward to visiting again.
author: Chris J.

description: Decent happy hour, food and drinks are pretty good. However, it's literally the worst service in all of San Francisco. Service alone is reason not to go. Absurd.
author: Lizzy U.

description: The live bands and outside courtyard are 5 stars.  The bartenders are the WORST I've ever experienced.  We went on 1/11/14 and both girl and guy bartenders were rude, took 20 minutes to even make eye contact (no joke - I timed it the 2nd time I ordered drinks), made the WEAKEST club and vodka (really hard to mess that up).  They seemed too cool for school - like they couldn't be bothered - to take another drink order from me.I used to love to come here because of the live atmosphere and the live music.  Also, the cleanliness of the place has deteriorated.  The girls bathroom sink was flooded (think murkey gross water with food or vomit), paper towels strewn everywhere...probably hadn't been cleaned that day.
author: stephany m.

description: Great place! Outside patio, cool drinks! enough space for a large party.
author: Olga K.

description: This place is sooo dooouchey. Sweaty Middle Eastern guys in suits and fat chicks in hideous party dresses. Just like England!
author: Tracey W.

description:
'The cigar bar' is befittingly one of the coolest spots to lounge in san francisco.  The atmosphere is chill and professional.  The live music is relaxing, art is nice, architecture and design of the building accompanies the ambiance.  I can sit out in the patio area or have a cigar inside and lounge on comfy leather couches.  In addition to this, there is a pool table, always open.

Excellent spot to bring a lady or have a cigar with friends.
author: Wils C.

description: I've not had any of the negative experiences that some have had here so my review is a good one. Its the atmosphere in the open court area with the combined opportunity to hang out with friends, eat some dinner, then enjoy a nice stogie (they have $8-50 cigars), and listen to the sounds of laughter & music while sipping a nice glass if red wine. Very relaxing!
author: Ken W.

description:
I love going here with my co-workers after a long day at work ... or just for the hell of it! Sure, the drinks are kind of pricey, but we love that there's a patio where some of the smokers can sit and drink, and the cool atmosphere. 

The bartenders here are awesome too, helpful with drinks and cigar choices. There's also live music on Thursdays, so that contributes to the fun!
author: Caroline L.

description:
I've been to the Cigar Bar before and had a great evening.  Last week I hosted a work event at The Cigar Bar & Grill.  

This was the only place that was willing to work within my budget.  The space was perfect and the staff was friendly.  We needed to delay the food since my coworkers were working late.  They were very attentive and once people started arriving they brought out the food.   

We will be back!  Thank you!!
author: Lisa K.

description: As a "cigar bar" not very impressive.  Cool open space outdoor seating area, reasonable prices on drinks.  Very small selection of cigars to choose from in a small case near front door.
author: Steve S.

description: Love this place! The live salsa band was awesome and the drinks were not expensive, the service could have been better though, the bartender was a little rude. Other than that, the experience was very good, I would definitely come back!
author: Daniela P.

description: Banker types at happy hour the place it transforms to a Latin salsa bar on weekend nights! $10 cover. Good mojitos. Live music. If you don't know salsa, you'll be sure to meet some experienced dancers who will be happy to teach you.
author: Christina N.

description: Horrible horrible!!! We planned our Memorial Day here for my sister's bday and they were closed!!! We made reservations in advanced and drove in an hour of traffic. How can you not communicate with your customers that you decided to close! There were a whole group of people waiting in front! I'm so disappointed!!!
author: Dee U.

description: An excellent bar for a smoke and drink. The seating is great, its got a lovely patio with live music, and the cigar selection is decent. A great date night or place to enjoy a solid smoke.
author: Jessica R.

description: Cigars are poop. Bad selection and the humidor is a mess. Drinks are reasonable for the city. Bring your own stick and enjoy.
author: Rich S.

description:
Went here last night 1-7-12 for salsa night and had a great time. Good older and fun loving crowd. Has different rooms depending on what you want to do. A pool room, middle area where you can smoke or have good conversation. 

Pro: Great ambiance and good live performances, drinks are not expensive in comparison to other large cities I've visited. 
Con: During intermission of the performances there was no music playing for over 20 minutes. 

I plan on visiting this place again to see if I can upgrade my rating from 4 to 5 stars.
author: Anthony I.

description: A good bar w/a spacious outdoor patio. This place literally is a cigar/cigarette bar (one of the only places in the whole area I suspect can get away w/this) -- so if you're not a fan of the smoke, I'd definitely steer away. I've also heard there's dancing/other great stuff during the weekends.
author: Mel G.

description:
If you're into Havana nights then you'll enjoy this place! I'm not really into cigars and/or second hand smoke. I'm also not really into their Hanky Panky drink that was undrinkable (it was super bitter) or their sorry excuse of a mojito. I live in Miami, I know my mojito's!

BUT this place still gets 4 stars because of its ambiance and impressive live music performances. Also, after I told them what I liked and didn't like the bartender got the next drink just right.  For those cigar aficionados, they have an outdoor courtyard where you could enjoy your cigar and/or dine as you inhale smoke, yum?!?

For those of us wishing to preserve our lungs (like moi), we could enjoy the indoors which has the bar, some tables, and live music! Dance your little hearts (and perhaps lungs) to Latin music here!
author: Diana G.

description:
Walking into this place, was like walking into an episode of "Suits." It was douchebag galore. The two main types of people present were either the lawyer/ FiDi types getting off of work or tourists who I presume were looking for somewhere to go near downtown. 

 I went last Friday night around 8:30 with a friend and we sat outside in their large heated porch. The space is actually quite old world and nice, and you seat yourself wherever there is space. But as far as I could tell there was one person who was serving the whole area (about 15 tables), so it took a while to get your order in. 

And if the name didn't give it away, let me make it abundantly clear. People all around will be smoking cigars, so just be prepared for your clothes, your hair, your skin, everything to smell of cigar smoke when you walk out. 

The food menu had a severe lack of vegetarian options, the only things we could get were their veggie quesadilla platter, or their garlic fries. 

The cocktails were pretty good, but very overpriced for the size and amount of alcohol. Overall, I could see how this could be a cool place for people to hang out, but it's definitely not my scene. Older crowd as well, most people there were around 30 - 45 years old if not older.
author: Krithika H.

description: Slow service. I'm still waiting as you read this right now. Look at the date. Taking forever. I'm still here, still waiting. Zelt.
author: The Dirty Truth F.

description:
First time visit during a business trip. Hard to find a place in San Francisco that'll let you enjoy a cigar, this apparently is one of the few. 

Place appears to be a 'regulars' bar for 30-somethings. It's not indoor smoking, but rather in an outside heated patio. The cigar selection is rather meager and they really should have cigar ashtrays if they want to be billed as a real cigar bar. 

The server was very pleasant, happy, and easy on the eyes. She seemed to be overworked but kept up nicely. 

Food was actually pretty adequate. 

Nice place to hang out bit not really upscale, if that's what you're looking for.
author: Steven G.

description:
4 friends walk into a bar and find 4 open tables, too bad they all still had ashes and dirty plates from the last guests. We told the one waitress that was serving the 50 people around us about it but nothing happened she finally took our order 30 min later, brought us our food, then promptly bounced! I don't know anything about cigars but the display looked nice and the atmosphere was really chill. Oh and the quesadilla was good. 

Pros: great atmosphere (music, open sky, dancing, bar, and pool table), professional crowd

Cons: Terrible service
author: Chirag V.

description:
I don't smoke cigarettes -- but give me something better to smoke, like an Irish Cream and white chocolate truffle cigar, and hell yeah, I'll inhale that ish!

Aside from containing such combustible offerings, The Cigar Bar is a nice spot to hang, with a bar that serves wonderful drinks, a heated, Euro-style patio, and a separate indoor area with live music and salsa dancing.  I went on a Friday night, and it wasn't too hard to find a table on the patio after just a few minutes of hovering.  It gets crowded to a comfortable level, and there is eye candy for a variety of tastes.

My only gripe is that food is not served very late, and I'm more interested in eating than dancing. The website says food is served until 11pm on Fridays, but I swear we asked to order something at around 10:40 and the server was like "Um no" and was kind of a bitch about it.  Also, you have to go up to the bar to purchase cigars rather than be able to order them from the patio, which somewhat detracts from the diva experience one might like to have. Also, there is sometimes a cover -- $7 when we went.
author: Leena K.

description: It has a decent range of cigars to select from. However, what really brings out this place is the fact that it has great music and a nice chill ambiance that you can really enjoy with a nice cigar and your choice of alcohol. Their staff is quite friendly and even when busy will stop to ask if you need a refill on your drink. Four star only because they need a much wider selection of cigars other than just one cabinet.
author: Adelbert Y.

description:
My favorite place for happy hour. Great drinks, great food, great ambiance. Love the outdoor patio and the fact that I can smoke there (one of the few 'indoor' places in SF where you can!)

Saturday nights are also great. Sometimes when I'm feeling it, I take part in the salsa dancing. But that's after one too many of their great sangria.
author: Belle G.

description: When here with  a group of 12 people made a reservation we got there they didn't have our  table ready we had to wait like 10 mins for the table than they said is ready but only had 8 chairs so how ever they took for ever to bring the rest of the chairs , we order drinks and basically wait another 30 mins to get than but the server was missing 3 drinks so wait another 15 mins for those drinks , than order appetizers and server brought a plate extra saying was on the house for the wait time for the table , how ever they took the order for main course but he only got the order from half of the table  than the meal came out and server never asked me or my other 2 friends on the other side what u want for your main course ? But anyways we had horrible service food is OK at the end our  bill was only around 340 something dollars. I only tip the server 40 bucks and I feel sorry to do that because that was not even 18%  but also if get good service I tip up to 25%  but this place was pack and had like 3-4 servers only and this is management problem if they had more staff or we had good service this person that took care of us and the restaurant in general could've make more money because we came here to spend money no to get free stuff so sending an appetizer won't compensate a horrible experience we left and went to another bar because is not worth to wait for ever for a drink or server to come to the table to see if we want something else . That was my first and last time at this place No coming back at all .
author: Alex A.

description: Came here tonight to listen to the band.  This place needs to light up the stairs. While I was walking down their stairs to go down to the outdoor patio, I fell and hit my knee so hard.  No one from the bar came to ask if I was ok and check on me.  Careful when you take the stairs. They need to put lights as it is dark and I couldn't see.  The drinks are ok.  They are more on the weak side, but you expect that from these type of establishments.  The place inside is pretty big. They have a separate room for their salsa night.  Also tried to order food, but was told the kitchen was closed.
author: Diana H.

description:
I went to Cigar Bar recently and had unpleasant encounters with two servers. The first one was over happy hour. We sat down and chatted for about 15 minutes waiting for some friends to join us and lost track of time. At 3 minutes before happy hour ended we asked if we could put an order in and our server flat out said no.

What happened to the days when your server came to your table to see if you wanted to get an order in before happy hour ended? And the place was not busy at all.

It was kind of cool and funky to go downstairs and into the outdoor courtyard with all the cigar smokers and all the different rooms. The food was pretty good.
author: E. J.

description:
Pros:

-Nice venue:  We were seated in the center outside courtyard with the lovely fancy fountain and good heat lamps.  Clean, hip, good crowd.

-Amazing food:  Ceviche was fresh, great tasting, big portion, needed more chips though.  I heard the seared scallops were really good, but only comes with three.  Sliders (3) were very good and fries were cooked nicely.  

-Good drinks: The sangria was very good.  It's only $4 if you get it during happy hour.

Cons:

-STINKY as hell:  Figures... it's called Cigar Bar.

I'd go back and maybe try to sit inside where there's no cigar smoking going on.
author: Mary Ann M.

description:
Happy hour with our team from work. Since one of the partners was paying, I really didn't pay attention to prices of anything. We got so many drinks and so many plates of food for all of us. There were about 50 or so of us there drinking and having a good time together. 

The drinks were pretty cheap - not too bad if I remember correctly. The atmosphere is really nice. They have some live music, some of my coworkers even danced to it.  I stayed there until about 10. Apparently I smelled like cigars though. Oh well, it happens when you're standing close to the center part of the bar that allows smoking. It's pretty nice if you want to do all that, if not, it's a pretty cool place to hang out and talk with friends. Definitely a place to go with friends and have some fun!
author: Nina Y.

description: Went here for a birthday party.  Like the open patio and the freedom to smoke.  Loud music and cool interior bar are a plus.  Place gets crowded and a wait can be expected many a night.  The drinks I had were alright but nothing about the place really turned me on to write a raving review.
author: Sin F.

description: This place is always a lot of fun! I come here later at night, so I've never tried any of their happy hour appetizers. But I've had some good mojitos and there is so much good energy here! They have a bar area, an outside area in the middle, and a big dance floor, so there's a good amount of room and you'd feel comfortable even if you didn't feel like dancing. They have live salsa music on Saturday nights, and everyone is friendly and eager to dance even if you have no idea what you're doing! Cover is $10, which they stop charging after a certain time (1 AM?) when it gets close to closing (2 AM).
author: Cynthia W.

description:
So close to home, why did it take me so long to get here?  I really enjoyed the vibe at Cigar Bar on a Thursday night.  They have a lot of space, which is really nice considering all the people who like to cram into San Francisco bars, and having the options of multiple rooms, bars, patios, and seating was a huge plus.  

We spent some time in the main bar area, tried our luck at the pool table, enjoyed a brief sojourn in the patio, but mostly used the time to catch up with out of town friends.  

In terms of the drinks though, I only had 2, made by two different bar tenders.  I went with my standard Dark and Stormy first and it was not good at all.  It was strong, but that wasn't what I was going for.  The flavor was not doing it for me.  The second time around I tried my luck with the Pomegrita (pomegranite marg) made by a different bartender and it was much better.  Not phenomenal, but definitely enjoyable.  

So it seems like you come here to enjoy the atmosphere of the music, cigars, and various seating options.  It'd be nice if all their drinks were as impressive as the rest of the venue, but I would definitely go back since an n of 2 is certainly not statistically significant.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: PERFECT place for a swanky, Latin-flavored happy hour or party. Delicious cocktails and food. Love, love, love this place.
author: Serena Q.

description: I love the food, drinks, and the overall layout if this place. I always have a great time here. You can chill outside with your favorite stogie and a drink or chill at the bar. The food is great and they have great service.
author: GT R.

description:
If there was a place perfect for the Hubby and I - it would be the Cigar Bar & Grill in SF. We went on a Thursday night and lucky us, they had live jazz that evening! Woohoo! We decided go have dinner there and just relax afterward.

- Limited menu - but everything we tried was delish
- Loved the live music
- Loved the diverse crowd
- Hubby wasn't too impressed with their limited selection and small humidor
- Parking is a bit of a challenge, but we scored street parking...that's SF. 

Would definitely go back again!
author: Shaye G.

description: I'm not sure what else I excepted! Read the name of the place for crying out load: "The Cigar Bar"...As soon as I walked in it "stunk" so bad! Again, helloooo..what else did I expect? Not sure I will go again. It will have to take allot of convincing from my friends. The place is actually nice though, love the outdoor area. Hmm, we'll see...
author: Carla F.

description: This place is great. Went with friends and smoked, drank and ate. Great selection of cigars, great humidor and great drinks. Nice little spot and will be back.
author: Karl S.

description: Great food, great music, and great alcohol. I had the time of my life. Only thing is the choice of cigars could have been a little bigger. Other than that the spot was perfect.
author: Christopher P.

description:
I would say, this is a financial district man's playground.  Walk down to a dim lit basement, where you'll get a feel of brick walls and cobblestone floors.  The dark colored wooden furniture adds a feel of Italy or Spain, while the smells of cigars eases into view, you get easily taken away by this place.  

And every where you look, there are men dressed in suits holding a glass of whiskey or bourbon, or even a glass a wine.  Rarely do you see shot glasses or Pabst here, so it definitely sophisticated in a way.  

Pool table in the back, and a outdoor fountain area with couches for you to smoke, so it was quite pleasant.  Too bad there wasn't some kind of music to make it nicer. 

I didn't try the food, but I got their Tears and Tequila drink.  It was very refreshing with all the cucumbers and spicy kick.  The rest of the crew had wine and imported beers, and they were pretty happy with the selection.

This is pretty much a more social spot, for a bit of a Marina crowd, and a bit of Financial district.  So expect that superiority attitude to come with, even from the bartenders and bouncer.  I seriously had to say excuse me, into a girls ear, 10x before i finally had to gently push her to get through.  I know you're busy talking with a bunch of boys lady, but don't mean you can block traffic with your flat ass.  And the bartender chick, smile a bit please.  Yes you are considered hot, but attitude makes your hotness go down, way down.   

So if the staff was friendlier, crowd was more pleasant, had some tunes, I can see myself chilling here.  Its got a nice ambiance to it, where you feel very relaxed and coming here after work, I can totally see it.  So you get only an OK from me.
author: Janice F.

description:
If you're into the Spanish flare, this is a good spot to kick it!

Great patio seating.  Good drinks and food.  Nice bartendars. Live Salsa bands.  Pool table in the back. Mixed crowds. And cigars, cigars, cigars!  Great spot to hang out during the summer nights of SF.  

Ambiance is fantastic!
author: Diana M.

description: This place was awesome.  It feels like a margarita place when you walk in and they have an open area within the establishment - for the cigar smoking.  We went last night and there was a live band jamming out to some nice rock and jazz tunes.  They had a nice selection of bar food and whiskeys.  Not that much of a cigar selection but what do I know about cigars.  Will go to again!
author: Kyle I.

description: As a non-smoker, I was happy to shower and wash everything after this to get the smell out of my hair and clothing.  It was super busy when we were there (and had a group of about 10 people), so the service at the bar (where most of us had to order, since no one came to the table), was iffy at best. Bartenders weren't very friendly at all.  We sat at a table that had a "reserved" sign on it (reservation was for 45 minutes from when we sat down and were very happy to get up when the party arrived. No one ever came to the table, so we stayed a little longer.  A guy finally came over (that worked there) and basically yelled at us and called us rude and disrespectful for sitting at the table because "clearly, it says that it's reserved and they have been waiting for their table." I'm sorry, no one came and told us they were waiting. Had an employee told us that, we would have happily left the table for the reservation. Poor service gives this place a lower rating.
author: Sheena C.

description: Great bar with plenty of seating, including spacious outdoor patio + fountain seating (with smoking), and a live band for events and parties.  The drinks were a good serving and decently priced (vodka tonics and vodka cranberries:  $9).
author: Charles Y.

description:
A good place for people like Latin Music......

Enjoyed the atmosphere....Good place to bring a date!
author: Mo I.

description:
I am not normally a cigar fan.

Actually, I can shorten that: I am not normal.

It was with this firmly in mind that I walked into Cigar Bar, in the company of those more worldly and fabulous than I, a state of being that I am, by now, well familiar with.  For a place whose very name is based on the notion that one could light up some cigars inside, you have to walk a long way to get to the cigar part of Cigar Bar.

One of my compatriots had brought a selection of cigars with him, and asked me which one I wanted.  I asked him for the one that wouldn't symbolize me satisfying my oral fixation by chewing on a giant leafy dick---the one that even Freud would agree was just a cigar.  He kinda smiled at me confusedly, so I ended up with an El Capitan Robusto Habana de Honduras Al Segundo De Mas Profundo.  I think.

The cigar was nice enough, but the tray of bourbon that soon made its way out was far, far nicer.  And so I sat on the deep leather couch and chewed on my giant Carribean leafy dick and drank the smooth, amber salve of the south.  And just as the profusion of chemicals contained in all of the above were finally beating my emotions into something resembling contentedness, someone said "so, who's getting the girls?"  The sentence took awhile to lodge appropriately in my brain, because it made no sense the first three times I repeated it to myself.  Then, I became concerned: crap, was I supposed to bring....uh, girls with me?  Was that on the invite?  "Last names A-L bring cigars, last names M-Q bring girls, last names R-Z bring bourbon?"  Had I blown it?  Where does one even get girls at this time of night?  And will they take AmEx?

Instead, apparently, my companion was referring to what maybe possibly is a practice of corraling one or more otherwise unattached young women to keep company with us gents while we smoked our cigars.  I was not familar with this ritual, but given that my companions managed, in several passes through the bar, to actually bring back more than a few women to sit and talk with us, I am forced to acknowledge this must be a thing.  Later on, when one of my companions left to walk a woman back to her car, and it took him more than a half hour, I decided it must REALLY be a thing.

The whole situation was very surreal.  And I'm sure it showed---I regressed back to eighth grade, standing on the far side of the gym from the girls and dancing with absolutely no one.  This whole thing makes my uncomfortable.  My palms are starting to sweat just writing this, so let's wrap it up.

Thanks, Cigar Bar, for taking me back to the childhood I was using your booze in an attempt to finally kill from my mind.  Also, I had to scrape my tongue the next morning.  Never fun.
author: Ben P.

description:
After the owner contacted me and gave me VIP passes I decided to bring a good sized group here. We ate a little and drank a little grenacha and had fun.

I had so much fun I had forgotten why I had even gotten the passes or gave the low score. Then I took a sip of my mojito and I remembered the mojito tasted average with limp bright green mint. Now I remember! 

The service, ambience and food were better this time around but those mojitos can be improved.
author: Jade W.

description:
I suppose you could say that I like the clandestine.

The underground, the places that mask the dark deeds, where you can behave in an illicit manner and not worry about anything.

Just the name- Cigar Bar- makes me think I need to break out my flapper outfit and do the Charleston.  Stepping down the stairs from the entrance and going behind the curtain led me to a warm, inviting, alcoholic Oz.

I came here last night for a couple of drinks and potentially some food.  Although I didn't sample it, it looks like they had a great liquor section- especially scotch.  The wood bar is sleek, and they get bonus points for having those hooks under the bar where you can hang your purse.

I managed to sample a few glasses of wine (my favorite was the Zinfande- that's how they spelled it on the menu), but they also offer a $5 wine special which was named "not so offensive red wine" or something of that nature.  I like a place that has a sense of humor.  I managed to sample the chips/pico/guacamole combo (my companion said the guac needed more lime, and sadly he was right), as well as the veggie risotto, which was delicious...and I'm not a risotto person.

The menu could have been a little more extensive, in my opinion, but as the word "bar" comes before the word "grill," I shouldn't be too surprised.  The patio looked like a nice place to hang out on one of the 5 warm SF days a year, although the trek to the bathroom is not something I would recommend in an inebriated state.

I really liked it here, but why only 4 stars?  The permeating smell of onion rings.  It smelled like an carnival, minus the barnyard and carnie smell.
author: Pam S.

description: If you like to smoke cigars or to smell 'em, this is the place for you.  It's a popular hangout for socialites and international expats especially in the outdoor patio and various rooms for salsa, billiards, dancing, etc.  The bar is friendly to accommodate your drink of choice.  Parking can be tough on the street in this neighborhood.
author: Jenny L.

description: A fun, hip place on Friday night.  I went to go salsa dancing, of which there is a very small space, so it gets crowded quickly.  Enjoyed going into the courtyard to cool off, but be prepared to join the cigar smoke, it's not that bad really.  Got stepped on by a woman's heel...so be careful...tight space means you can't truly salsa...better for a couple dances and then grab a drink and enjoy the ambiance. Nice mix of ages, not too young nor too old for this 30 something gal. :) Cocomos is now closed, so maybe it's a bit busier than usual, not sure as it was my first time.
author: Rachel M.

description: The food was decent. Our group had a good time. That being said, members of our party were waiting for food for close to an hour only to be told by another waitstaff (after asking for another waitstaff member) that the item was not available for the evening. Later we ordered a drink where there was a fruit fly smashed into the lemon peel. At the end of it all one person was charged our entire tab without being asked if it was alright and we had to hassle with having bit reversed and charged properly. No comps with all of the hassles
author: Melissa H.

description:
Review for HH only!

So I've been here 4 times now, and there is one consistency: very very slow service during the happy hour.  Now, it's not like the place has bad staff... I do see them working hard, but it's just awfully slow here.  Come on owners/managers, hire more people because the place is clearly understaffed!

I was here last Friday for HH... joined my friends who were already there and the server came relatively quickly to get my order (just a draft beer).  About 10 minutes later, my friends ordered another round of drinks... 10 minutes after that... nothing.  10 minutes later, my friends get the round of drinks they ordered... but nothing for me :(  We informed the staff of my situation and the girl apologized for the delay and said that she'll "get it right away".  Another 10 minutes pass by, and my beer finally came.

At the end of the HH, we waited 10 minutes to get the check, and spent another 15 minutes waiting because they charged us for a wrong bottle of wine.

When the drinks do come, they are good, and the food's pretty good as well.  I like the fries, yum.
author: Eric P.

description:
Went to the Cigar Bar & Grill on a Wednesday night for a mixer.

It was a pretty good turnout and there was plenty of space to accommodate our group.  

I was not familiar with the beers on tap.  The bartender was very helpful in helping me chose the right one. I can't remember which one I got but it was very good and worth going back for.

I could see how this place can get very crowded. Lots of tables and open areas, along with some comfy chairs for people to mingle and just enjoy themselves.

Look forward to coming back here again.
author: Johnny V.

description:
Great place for multiple purposes, dancing, drinking, smoking, and just hanging out.
Love the live music they have. Good for a large group because of the big rooms they have.
author: Maitai N.

description:
We came here on a Friday night at about 10PM.  PACKED and for a good reason - what a cool vibe.

We sat on the patio and enjoyed some $10 cigars.  Very nice.  Live music, great people watching, and reasonably priced drinks.

Some math for the guys on a budget:
$7 cover per person
$10 cigars
$10-$15 drinks
Assume you and your lady friend each have a cigar and 2 drinks - you're looking at about $75 minimum.  No different than most other places.
author: Brian K.

description:
What DONT I love about it here?
The atmosphere is out of this world. I really don't feel like I'm in the city when I'm here. Amazing dining area, pool table, a nice area to lounge by the bar and listen to a live band, and semi room for dancing ( but that's the fun part isn't it? dancing in a crowded area with hot beautiful women). 

The food is great. The service is 4/5. The drinks are delicious and strong. A bit steep (to be expected once you pay a cover to come in) in price range for drinks, but I'm usually a bit tipsy before I come here.

I love how most the time people come here dressed nicely. It just adds a little oopmh to the place. It makes me feel classy. Hahaha

I would be Super Duper impressed if a guy took me here. It's pretty romantic with the right band and right night. Do it.
author: Amanda S.

description: You get pretty much exactly what you would expect here. Cigar smoke fills the air and whiskey filled rocks glasses line the tables. It's pretty simple. If you want somewhere to relax and kick back with a drink and a cigar, you've found your spot. Take up residence in the patio outside on nice nights and let the hours slip by
author: Taylor C.

description: I went to the Cigar Bar & Grill  for a friends birthday and I had a blast. It was real salsa music and everyone there asks you to dance. It's so cute! Even though at first I was shy but the people are a bit older (26-40). The music was good, we had appetizers and drinks only. I even smoked a Cuban Cigar for the first time. Met a couple creepers but hey... can't blame them ;)
author: Eva Y.

description: The place is nice and big with an outdoor area for smoking.  For people who don't like the smell of smoke, the smoke gets pretty intense.   The garlic fries are amazing.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I've been a bridesmaid 12 times. Yes, you've read correctly, 12. I have so much experience being a "BM" that I could justifiably put it on my resume under "special skills". Don't get me wrong, it is an honor to be a part of a loved one's wedding party and at this point, planning bachelorette parties and bridal showers comes second nature.

So you can image that when my friend (yes, I was one of her BMs) informed me that the groomsmen were not planning a bachelor party for the groom, I jumped in and took on the challenge. (Partially because I thought the idea of a bachelor party could be more fun and partially because it sucked that the groomsmen weren't doing anything.....lame.)

Anywhooo, after much research I decided that we would start off the evening with dinner and cigars at The Cigar Bar & Grill in the Financial District. We were warmly welcomed and promptly seated in the patio area. Knowing that it was a cigar lounge, I knew that they would have an extensive Cigar menu. However, it was such a pleasant surprise that the dinner menu was quite respectable and extremely well priced. I don't think there was a dish over $20. The BF and I shared the salmon and flat iron steak and were really happy with it. With a somewhat larger party, we had several assigned servers who always kept the cocktails flowing. My drink of the evening was the Caipirinhas--delish!

The décor is warm with a Spanish influence. Inside you can find pool tables, bar seating, and some comfy couches. Not being an avid cigar connoisseur, I'm told their selection was impressive. Since I was "one of the boys" that evening, I tried a Montecristo. After coughing half of my lung out, I decided to stick with my Caipirinhas. I looked ridiculous anyway :)

Overall, I think my first planned bachelor's party was quite a success. Cigars, drinks, food, and adult entertainment. It's so easy to make boys happy.
author: Nam N.

description:
So awesome.  I got to smoke my first cigar last night, and I loved it.  It feels so wrong, because you feel like you are in the bar, but in actuality you are outside.  

They also have Oatis...which is so YUMMY!  A wheat free beer, let alone A GOOD wheat free beer is hard to come by in any bar.  I will definitely be back...
author: Jenna K.

description:
Tonight I got drunk with my mom.  Really, you shouldn't be that surprised...Mama likes her wine, and honestly, she's probably more fun than me.  

We ended up at Cigar Bar for a private party sponsored by her employer and I was quite pleased with the event.  Lots of tasty bar food served by a very friendly staff.  And the space itself is pretty cool - more nooks and crannies than a six pack of Thomas' English Muffins, a pool table and a large patio with heat lamps.  

What's not to like?  Phil H. says check it out for your next event.
author: phil h.

description:
What a cluster....

I came with 2 friends and ordered quite a few entrees and drinks.  The polenta bars were decent but not stellar.  The risotto was not a risotto; it was rice al dente with a heavy orange sauce.  I was nervous to eat the scallops b/c they smelled very fishy and food poisoning was the last thing I needed.

We also were not aware that each entree and drink came with a different server.  We literally had 8 servers rotating through our table.  Because each server didn't know who was our last, they would ask us the same questions or bring us the wrong order.  

To make our dining experience worse, the 8th server didn't know which tab was our bill.  After 30 minutes waiting, we decided to head to the server station to find out what was going on.  Of course, the bill was double what we really owed with another table's charges combined with ours.  

Needless to say, my friends and I will not be coming back anytime soon unless we don't have any other place to go and have about 4 hours to spare for dinner.
author: Avant R.

description:
If you're wondering where all of the striped-shirt, neck-tied men go when they're done crunching numbers, your search is over.

Just step inside Cigar Bar (once you pay the five dollar cover)

I mean what is more manly than a big juicy cigar hanging from beer scented lips?

Right?

But seriously. Even though the crowd here can be a little over-dressed  for my taste,  Cigar Bar is a unique space, with class, rustic touches, sexy lighting, and great music.

Their outdoor space is perfect for relaxing, moving your shoulders to the rich beats which flow inside the place, and toasting a fresh glass of sangria (a key drink here)

(I have yet to try their food, but I've heard nothing but rave things about their menu from friends.)
author: Jessica T.

description: Love this place! Crappy selection of cigars but amazing ambiance. Very relaxing, I'm hooked!
author: Brianna C.

description:
I met up with a friend after the Big Game for what I thought would be a casual evening. How I ended up at an engagement party was by pure coincidence. In my Adidas hoody and takkies (South African slang for tennis shoes), I felt under dressed and didn't know anyone but was not going to let that deter me from blending in. One hour later, I had met the lovely bride and groom to-be and used 80% of the social mana points from yapping. I probably made no sense to them. Like the first half of this review.

I used to go to Cigar Bar before the $7 cover charge begins. It's a fun, distinctly Latin, and unpretentious place where you get your choice of 4 areas to park your seat and contemplate what to nibble on while you enjoy a wide variety of drinks or a cigar. Since I don't smoke, that means the outside patio is usually off limits for me once the crowd begins to pour in. On weekends, one of the inside rooms hosts different bands which provides yet another form of entertainment. You can even reserve a private room for a more cozy experience. Parking may be difficult, but it's worth the experience.
author: Jason C.

description:
For Happy Hour:

The patio was amazing and on a nice San Francisco night it's great to be able to look up and see the stars, then look down and see your drink. Pretty good selection - I was pretty happy with my Blue Moon (why was there a lemon, I thought it was supposed to be paired with an orange?). Not a fan of cigars so I wasn't too happy with the smoke but it's not too overwhelming considering we were outside. Totally reasonable.

Also, anywhere that has food makes me a happy camper. At $2 a pop the garlic fries are the most financially savvy option and I loved that they were of the shoestring variety. The quesadilla plate, usually $25, was marked down to the much more appropriate price of $10. Good to feed many hungry after-workers on a Friday evening. 

4-7 Happy Hour, not too many people, good drinks, good people, good times. Gotta love SF =)
author: Christina L.

description:
I've been here several times before but this Friday we had a little birthday happy hour for my gf and it was a great time. So why the 5 stars you might ask. The staff was incredible. I've been to restaurants that are supposed high end white table clothe places and have servers that couldn't hold a candle to the people here. It was busy, really busy. Despite the bar being busy hardly ever too long of a wait for a drink. I had a tab and no hassle ordering from the bar or the server who was helping serving us outside. Lots of confusion over tabs but no attitude just smiles and "no problem". We were all a bit tipsy so I'm sure we were asking left and right for stuff but she was so patient with the group. Drinks are poured stiff. They serve food and we got some appetizer combo deal with quesadillas, polenta, bruschetta and wings. Awesome. Calamari was delicious. 

They sell cigars but didn't even partake in that although many others were. We were too busy having many many coctails and celebrating. As it drew close to 10 pm they started to play salsa music. Apparently they have salsa dancing in the evenings. Pretty cool.
author: Hyung L.

description: I came here last night with few of my friends to enjoy a smoke and get some drinks. This is the only two places in the city that I know we're you can be seated order drinks food and enjoy a lovely cigar. The Waite staff is quick and the bar tabs are reasonably priced for the city standards. They have a great selection of whiskey and wine selection to pair with your cigar. There cigar selection is good however I had brought some cigars from my personal humidor. Keep up the good service and I sure to return very soon again. Cheers you all
author: SAMAY A.

description: Thank you Cigar Bar for accomodating our group holiday reservations on short notice and helping us plan the menu SO FAST! Another place we were looking into tried to bribe us with a free cocktail to check out the venue before we booked - shame shame. You guys dished out the options and worked with us without hassles (except maybe on our part with changes). You ARE the BEST - thank you again! The guests enjoyed the location very much!!
author: Joanna V.

description: They are not kidding about smoking cigars. It's everywhere in your face. I usually don't hang out in bars like this. But I was there for a mixer and it was nice for chit chatting. They had a good jazz fusion band playing in the background.  My friends and I met some cool people from the city there and had some good conversations. Go ahead, have a cigar!
author: Moua L.

description:
Good appetizers! We ordered plantains, garlic herb fries, and the quesadilla platter (huge!). 

There are three sections to this restaurant - a dance floor with a live salsa band on Saturday nights, an outdoor patio where people can smoke cigars, and an indoor dining area. 

This place does have happy hour weekdays from 4-7 -  $2 snacks, $1 draft beers, $5 glasses of sangria.
author: Geetanjali J.

description:
Dark, dimly lit, white walls, and smoke that seems almost snake-like and independently alive invites and handcuffs you the minute you step over the threshold.

Was dating an older man who had an affinity for Cuban cigars in general, and one night, he decided to take me here after dinner.

First off, I can't stand smoke (turning up my hand to deflect the daggers thrown by all smokers) and especially can't stand smoke after a very rich and creamy dinner of gnocchi drenched in Gorgonzola sauce.

But what I do love about this place, is the pretty diverse and well-dressed crowd (liken them to the stereotypical Havana style dress and decor) plus Latin jazz playing all night.  The man plays jazz, so he was in heaven.  We stepped outside so that he could smoke his cigar thing while I clung to the brief hope that my innards would not turn inside out from the strong smoke.

But after a brief salsa fling inside, my stomach settled, as did my demeanor.  Great place to frolic and socialize with good people (despite the brush-ups with several slimy guys in Tommy Bahamas and gold chains, yuck) but in all, a great time.
author: Miika M.

description:
It was a typical story - boy meets girl, boy asks girl out, girl says she is going out with friends; boy offers lamely to go wherever she is going in attempts to hook up and promises to bring his nice friends for her...

...and that is how I ended up at the Cigar Bar Friday night after listening to my friend promise me this girl would have pretty friends and how badly he needed a wing man.

So here we are. At a cigar bar. Ooooookay. 

It felt a bit like I was in Europe with the high density of Euro's in the room. My poor friend seemed oblivious to the fact that the girl he wanted to meet would more than likely be ogling the dusky men with accents.

Oh well, off to the humidor! We didn't leave him flying solo, but quickly a few of us decided drinks and cigars were top priority and if the ladies wanted to join us that was fine, otherwise damn the torpedoes!

A bit later some funky Latin music started vibing from the band that was playing. Apparently my friend brought his "A" game that night and convinced the ladies that we would entertain them. Soon enough I was on the dance floor shaking my hips and doing Shakira proud or thoroughly embarrassing myself. By then I was 3 cocktails in and having fun.

But after a while the smoke started getting to me and kinda brought my mood down. It reminded me a bit of Vegas where after a while everything smells like smoke. So it was a little good, a little bad, but nothing really ugly (except this one guy sporting a HUGE V of chest hair - wow).
author: Nick B.

description: This is a cool place to stop in and have a smoke. They had some excellent food to be served as well, but just note that it opens at 4pm daily. Their humidor selection is weak and a big pricey, but this place has live music and gets quick crowded in the evenings. It's a great place to enjoy a smoke, but don't expect the 'humidor experience' as there is much knowledge around there.
author: David M.

description:
Cigar Bar and Grill is a GREAT place to host a private party.

I hosted one this past Saturday eve and everything went really well. I rented the back room behind where the music plays and it was great for my guests to play pool and hang low before the music started. Instead of an open bar, I applied the fee towards wine which really afforded me a lot - the last bottle went around midnight. The server was on-the-mark with us even though she had a large party dining before the band set up in that space. We also had a reserved table on the patio which was perfect for cooling off and smoking cigs and cigars; hence why people choose to spend an evening here along with the awesome Latin bands that play.

Thanks to Matt and Mayra for making our night loads of fun. Everyone had a fantastic time.
author: Meredith R.

description: Celebrating a bachelorette party last night we decided to give The Cigar Bar & Grill a try after hearing good reviews. The line wasn't too long, so we decided to wait. When we asked the guy at the door how long the wait would be he said "long time." Every question we asked resulted in a rude response from this guy. Even so, we still thought maybe it would be fine. But once a fight broke out inside we knew this wasn't a place for us! Rude staff AND fights inside?! No thanks!
author: Heather P.

description:
This place is a jack of all trades and it does each of those trades basically well, but some things are better than others:

Basic bar-ness:  they have excellent sangria that is not overly expensive, munchies, ample seating, music that allows for conversation, a comfortable outdoor area with heat lamps, and a pool table.  5 stars.

Food: their appetizers aren't the best thing ever--fries are a little too crunchy, chips aren't served with enough salsa.  But it's decent and relatively cheap, especially during happy hour.  3 stars.

Salsa night: good live band, super crowded dance floor (good if you're a beginner), but the tiles aren't great and there were a few too many guys who got way too touchy.  This is not the place to go if you really want to salsa, but a good place to take your friends who want to learn. 4 stars for the music, 2 stars for the dancing. 

Air quality: deteriorates as the night goes on, but surprisingly good, considering the name of this place.  I am not a cigar fan and I still like hanging out there.
author: Sydney H.

description:
Cute decor - very spanish feel and architecture. Great music and outdoor patio with a fountain. Plenty of space for big groups. $5/beers :) If you dont smoke and/or don't like the smell of cigar smoke you might be miserable people are smoking everywhere...

There's a pool table in the back. Also, they make a great Hot Toddy!
author: Kimya P.

description:
It's Saturday night around 11pm and we were here for a friends b-day party.  No line and cover was $7.  The bouncer was quick and friendly.

The place is pretty big with small rooms off on the sides, courtyard that is full and open to the night air, small dance floor and a long bar to get drinks from.  It's a pretty typical spanish theme with big red brick tiles, bright colors and black iron tables in the courtyard.  Typical but fun.

We came when there was a live band playing salsa music and what seemed like covers for regular songs.  The band had a long of energy and fun music.  Even though I can't salsa, I tried and had a great time - wedged on the tiny dance floor.

The drinks - the margarhetias were a tad too limey for me and $8 a pop.  So not cheap but pretty good.  The bartender was pretty quick and friendly though.

While I wouldn't go out of my way to go here in the future, I would recommend it if you like live salsa music.  Decent drinks, good staff, cute place and always a good time with the right company.
author: Sabrina A.

description: i have been to this place many times but after last night I will never step foot in there again. 5 of my friends and I tried to stop in and as we were paying they said one of my friends may not get in because he was wearing a 49ers shirt. she told us to pay and wait while she checked with her manager after a few minutes of sitting there waiting it was clear we were not getting in so we asked for our money back and were told "Sorry No Refunds". We paid $50 to stand next to the entrance and not even go into the bar. I have been going to this bar for years and will never go again.
author: Adam M.

description: I just want to say a few things about Cigar Bar's events program.  They totally nailed every detail of my wedding from A to Z.  The personal attention from owners to the 'no detail missed' approach of the event coordinator Amanda.  The planning stage was thoughtful to all of our needs and everything was delivered to the exact specification on wedding day.  We had a 150 and the venue was perfect.  Though it easy to see how bigger and smaller groups would be as happy.  The food was on time, on point and plentiful.  No better feeling than making the rounds with family and loved ones and getting complimented on how great everything is.  Thank you Cigar Bar for a great event.
author: Don D.

description: The staff were excellent in accommodating our bachelor party. From setting up a reservation to amazing service when we arrived, not to mention a great atmosphere of smoke, drinks, food, dancing, and laughter. We will be back for sure. Thank you!
author: Jay E.

description:
Sometimes you  don't wanna wear neon clothes 4 sizes too small and hit the Mish. 
Sometimes you refuse to dust off that pink polo that Aunt Sally gave you 5 Chrismases ago and hit the Marina. 
You've grown tired of the Polk scene that now is fusion of the above mentioned neighborhoods. 

A friend set up a gathering at Cigar Bar and Grill last night and I have to say I was very impressed with everything, from the bartenders quick service, to the door guy saying " Hurry! It's almost 9! You don't wanna have to pay a cover !" ....Good lookin' out!

A very good looking crowd filled with talent that I approve of. This is rare in the Sco, but at times like this, often appreciated. 

The drinks are fairly priced, the food menu extensive, with a plethora of options ( saw many order the skirt steak..it looked incredible). 

Whether you are trying to chat with friends and strangers on the outdoor patio, or flexing your latin roots to the salsa band inside, you have a glut of options here. 

Def will return. As I left at 11 ( I have a lot of places to be. ) the line outside was 20-30 deep. So get there early, fool.
author: Taj A.

description: Awesome chill place to eat, drink smoke, and just chill! It's open seating outside so you can eat and also smoke cigars. The food is actually pretty good. I had the fried calamari, it's fresh, crispy and a lot for $10. It redeemed my previous calamari experience I had early for lunch at the lobster place. Anyways, the other food is pretty good. Service is attentive. Nice chill place.
author: Arnold W.

description:
You have to be in the mood for loud chatter and merriment to appreciate the Cigar Bar - otherwise the patrons here can seem obnoxious and downright rude.  The establishment itself?  Lost in competition.  Too many similar places in San Fran vying for your money.  Where oh where should you spend it?  Maybe ONCE at the Cigar Bar.  But a repeat visit?  Nah.

Friendly bartenders, though, and quick service.
author: Kristen S.

description: Unique place with great food and good selection of stogies!! Go when you can sit outside in the courtyard
author: Mark J.

description:
I really liked this place, but I'm pretty sure that I'm slightly allergic to tobacco; thus, the chances of me returning are slim. However, the atmosphere is great and the people are some of the nicest in town. Everyone was friendly and the place was packed. We ended up sharing our table with another group and about ten minutes later we were the best of friends.

They have an indoor bar area and an outdoor patio. Live music was playing the night we went, so I got to get my Salsa on with some pretty snazzy dancers. Don't come if you like to breathe fresh air, but do come for the drinks, music and atmosphere.
author: Ericka A.

description:
This is a nice spot to hit up after work or after dinner to have a few drinks, mingle and listen to live music. 

The food and service at Cigar Bar & Grill  was just ok. The meat on the sliders were overcooked so the patty was quite small and dry. I didn't really like the combination party platter (crispy polenta batons, smokin' hot wings, chorizo bruschetta & chicken quesadilla). You can have better appetizers at places like BJ's and E Bar.

So, dine elsewhere and then stop by Cigar Bar afterwards. Check out the courtyard where people hang out and enjoy company and music. Check out the mini private room right off from the music room and courtyard where people are lounging, looking like a fashion spread out of GQ.

4 stars for having St. George whiskey on the menu.
-1/2 star for not having St. George at the bar.

3 1/2 stars total.
author: Sam T.

description: So nice inside! I was so surprised, as I didn't know what to expect from a place that let u smoke inside, but once I got in I was in love! So beautiful! I will definitely be back!
author: Lisa N.

description:
I've only been here for after work drinks.  First time was for a farewell on a Thursday night and it was super crowded.  We had reserved a table outdoors but ended up just standing around the table drinking while nibbling on apps.  The outside is great when the weather is nice but it got super cold/windy near the end of the night.  Plus outside is where people smoke the cigars.  So if you don't like the smell better get a table inside.

Second time was for another farewell but on a Tuesday night and it was much more quiet.  Got a nice little table inside.  Waitress wasn't very attentive but maybe b/c she had to handle a few tables.  The pom frites and guac/chips were good and large enough to share amongst 6 people.  

Good place to grab a drink.
author: J B.

description:
Stopped by after work for a beer and a cigar. Yes, a couple Speakeasy Big Daddy IPAs and La Flor Dominicana DL700 in the city of San Francisco. I can count on one hand the number of places this is possible within 60 miles! A truly unique haven for the cigar afficianado aka social pariah. 

The atmosphere is intimate and open all at once. A cross between an open air cuban jazz club and an enclosed mediterranean patio. The bar staff was friendly and probably a little bored, due to the sparseness of the patio crowd on a foggy Friday afternoon. Brought my own sticks, but was pleased to see a decent selection at reasonable prices. By decent and reasonable, I mean... if you don't have a humidor at home, this place isn't going to screw the novices. 

For the seasoned smoker, bring your own, hang around for a couple hours, relax, and watch the awkward transition from Happy Hour People to Night People. 

Cigar guys should really support this place... the odds are stacked against them in a big way. I'll definitely be back.
author: Kevin A.

description:
If you're not a smoker, or cannot tolerate cigar smoke...don't go here. 

I'm not a smoker, and I don't mind cigar smoke at all...so I like it here.  It has a different kind of feel to it.

But their drinks are phenomenal (they make 'em strong), and I love their setup, with plenty of overstuffed chairs, tables, and outdoor seating (beautiful courtyard with a fountain).  They have enough space, that if you want to dance, you could.  There are also some 'secluded' areas.  

I love coming here with groups for a night out.

Parking is a pain!  I know that they have a menu of food...but I have never gone here for food.  I usually come here to socialize and have drinks with friends.  

And on nights with live music, this is a small cover charge at the door.
Warning: They are packed on the weekends...so get there early, and grab seating fast, unless you don't care, so it won't matter.
author: Fannie S.

description: Rude bartenders!!! The place seems nice, drinks are affordable, but the guys behind the bar were so rude that I preferred to look for other place.
author: Adriana S.

description: Looks nice, great patio. Opens at 4:00. Went in at 3:30 because gate was open, told "not open until 4:00) Went back at 3:55 to eat, drink and be merry and smoke a cigar. Was told by bartender "We don't open until 4:00, you have to leave the building" bad attitude, no "sorry" no "you can wait in patio"....(he must not work for tips) did the establishment and servers a dis-service because we went elsewhere. Why would I spend $100+ there and endure a bad attitude.
author: Robert R.

description:
I've had 3 happy hour events at Cigar Bar.  All have been reasonably smooth and very successful.  Negatives for large groups include their insisting on splitting between no more than 6 cards, even for very large groups, and slow service.

But the drinks are good, the atmosphere is peppy, there's a nice outside area, and they have great deals for happy hour.  Last time I was there, a rum sponsor was handing out lots of free rum, which was a fun addition and big money saver.

Overall, it's easy and they'll always have an area for me to reserve, for a range of party sizes.
author: Bailey D.

description:
This isn't the sort of place I would normally frequent but when an adorable bunny from Sac. and a local gorilla invite you to join them,  hey!

I like this place.  It's quite large by North Beach standards, just a couple blocks up from the Trans America building,  a somewhat misleading store front ( you don't get the impression it is as large as it is).  There is a nice bar area, outdoor patio and a couple of enclosed lounge type areas and a room with a pool table; cozy.  I didn't eat here but the plates I saw of some of the patrons looked delicious!  I like the fact that the tables were not all smashed together like so many places.  It was quite crowded when I arrived and  the population continued to multiply while I was there.  First impression was that it seemed very white,  very North Beach, but hey,  when in Rome.  Overall a nice spot.
author: John P.

description: Never expected to have salsa music together with wine and cigar. It's a little bit of everything and i love the mixed feature there. Love cigar accent! Definitely a super plus!
author: Shell J.

description:
Kinda gets smokey - if you dont mind the cigar/ette smoke on your clothes and hair the next day, you will be fine.

I actually enjoyed it very much. The outdoor area is awesome on a beautiful SF night and drinks are decent. There was salsa music and good selections (not that i know cigars) so the atmosphere was very authentic. I loved it.
Yes, i tried a heavy cigar and i liked it at the time as well.  (i don't smoke).

I would go back - music, outdoor space, cool crowd, authenticity ..all great!
author: C A.

description:
A jem in the city. For a long time I have waited to check out this place. 

First off,, if planning for dinner before the live music starts @9:30pm w/cover charge, I would definitely plan for the dinner and somewhat of an early arrival, maybe around 8pm. 

Parking can be a bit difficult to find on the streets but you can get lucky if your patient and there are a few paid parking lots for about $10 down the street. After walking in around 9pm, there was no one to greet us right away but the place was already starting to get full of people. Most of the tables were taken and luckily there was table left for us inside by the bar.

After sitting down, someone eventually came to wait our table with a big smile and a warm welcome. At that point, more people started to fill the place up. We had ordered the Veggie Quesadillas,, Plantains,, and the Rissotto,, everything was delicious and just the right portion of servings. The non offensive $5 red wine was very light /smooth tasting and the pamergrita/mojito were also great too. everything came out to about $50, which is very reasonable for 2 people given the fact that the food/service  was outstanding. 

Oh yeah,, we tried the honey flavored Cigar,, very smooth/great flavor/mild cigar with my glass of wine. 

Josh Jones Latin Jazz band was playing that night,, They were great,, one of the best Latin Jazz Bands I have seen in awhile,, there selection of music kept everyone dancing all night long. The dancing area is a bit small/ and be prepared to get bumped into if your out there but its all good and fun because everyone is having such a great time. And plus the band is right in front of you. 

The outdoor area-patio is a great place to smoke your cigar/ cool off/ dance and enjoy other peoples company. Everyone we met there was friendly and talkative. To me this place kind of felt like being at home / having some good food/ listening and dancing to music/ making new friends/ and having a good time..

Overall I would highly recommend this place for a great night of fun/ food/dinning/live music/dancing/networking/and just having a great time. It is a very diverse cool and fun place to hang out..
author: Gabriel M.

description:
When it's nice outside and the patio is open, this is a great happy hour/evening spot with a mature, relaxed ambiance. I actually wouldn't recommend it when there's a live band though b/c it gets really crowded and there's a cover.
