The food was good, not great, and you really need to go on a day and at a time where the bar crowd won't overtake your dining experience.
author: Megan S.

description:
I didn't know places like this existed in the city (oh, what a sheltered existence I do lead). 

Some adjectives to describe cigar bar and grill's ambience - great, warm, tastefully funky, and rich (as in chocolate rich, not pretentious rich).  Classy in a non-snooty fashion, the patio area is uniquely positioned in an open atrium style (with ample heat lamps) and the sounds of a live band drifting throughout, dancing with smoke of the cigars for which this place is named.  (sadly I can still smell that unavoidable smoke, but if you like cigars and smoke, this shouldn't be a problem)

Great for any occasion - parties, romantic date (earlier in the day), or a chill place to lounge with friends.  I was there for a going away party so didn't get to try the food - drinks are decent standard fare, mixed drinks a bit watered down (just the way I like :P)
author: Shinny L.

description:
Yay! I'm a fan.

This place is awesome.  I went here on a Wednesday night with a great pal and we sat on the patio. Granted, we were the only ones there at first, but it was only 5:15 in the afternoon and the place filled up not loo long after.

Our waitress was very attentive and made sure we were comfy with our drinks -- we didn't have to wait for the next round at all.  The drinks were made just right.  If there was one thing to be iffy about, it was the quesadilla that we ordered.  Yes, it was gigantic but very thin and I couldn't really taste the meat, but it definitely was not horrible.  I look forward to coming back here soon!!
author: Becca M.

description:
Absolutely a lovely place- outdoor courtyard with fountains... a very Spanish feel.  The place had a live band playing salsa music which just adds a more flavor to the ambiance.  

I will be back.
author: Michael L.

description:
A great place for a drink with friends and co-workers after work. The patio is especially fun on a warm day...which is probably 7 days a year in SF...

The service could be a LOT more attentive though. Our server was awful. Had to remind her that i ordered a glass of sparkling wine and she was completely missing when we were trying to settle the bill. I had to walk into the establishment to look for her...only to find her chatting with another server. Inattentive and careless. tsk
author: Jocelyn L.

description: When you first walk in you expect it to be such a cool place. Then the server comes after sitting for 15 minutes and brings you the wrong drink. Shortly after you notice she also brings another table the wrong drink. The person bringing out appetizers didn't know which table to take them too and the drinks were ehhh. They weren't bad but they didn't leave you wanting another. And even when we wanted another the waiter wasn't around. The place was not very busy and there appeared to be several waiters to go around. I'm not some place my friend and I feel like we will be at again. We were disappointed.
author: Brenda M.

description:
I really like this place.  Which is funny, because I'm not a smoker,  but this is such a nice chill bar to come and hang out at.  Last Friday, it was raining, and my husband and his co-worker had had a tough day at work, so we came over here, grabbed a table that was pushed under a wide overhang, and they smoked cigars and we had some drinks and foods while the rain fell in the patio. 

A relaxing, chill place to spend a couple hours and have a conversation.  

One day I might even try out the pool table.
author: Tasha D.

description: Not a big fan of cigars or smoking in general so this isnt a fun place, IMO. It's for the higher end crowd, rich ppl smoking cigars and drinking expensive alcohol. Not a fun place to go to if you are looking for friendlier environment. shots were more expensive that regular bars (14 bucks a shot of Hennessy, the cheap one) Will not be back here.
author: Q W.

description:
Now, I've never been to Europe, but this place is what I imagine Spain is like. 

It's got a great outdoor patio area. The live salsa music is ALWAYS a plus. The dance area is tiny and hazardous to your health if you're heels (it's tiled, which looks nice but doesn't work so well on a dance floor).

Their mojitos were pretty good. Parking is a NIGHTMARE. Beware.

I don't remember the cover being outrageous. $10 at the most, but I tihnk it was closer to $5. I refuse to pay more than $10 in SF.
author: Carlos A.

description:
If you can stand the smell of cigar smoke enveloping you, Cigar Bar is a pretty smooth place to be. After starting off at Aventine, my co-workers and I decided to take it up another notch and walk up to Cigar Bar.

For a big group I would recommend getting their appetizer sampler. It is a reasonable price and you get a good variety of things (polenta, quesadillas, wings, etc). I would probably only come here for happy hour, where the drinks and food are cheap. I noticed that they started having bouncers and charging some sort of cover by the time we were leaving. I wouldn't pay a cover to come in, but if I'm here for happy hour it is definitely a good deal.
author: Angela L.

description: This part is absolutely beautiful. The rustic design and dark leather furniture in certain rooms make this one cool bar. Also, the drinks are reasonably priced! If I had to say one bad thing about this bar, it would be that it takes a little too long to get drinks, every round took about 20-25 minutes to receive. Other than that, one awesome place.
author: Chris L.

description:
This is one of the best places for an outdoor cocktail. The patio really doesn't even feel like it's in San Francisco, but instead like you are somewhere tropical...well, until the fog rolls in. But I guess that's life in SF. 

Cigar Bar is one of the few places in SF that will allow you to smoke cigars (hence the name) and they have a good selection for purchase. There's a full bar and a great food menu. 

I really love going here on Friday's after work and it's good for groups. My single girlfriends have said it's a good spot for "scoping dudes", so now you know. Enjoy!
author: Kandace K.

description:
The fries, bruschetta, and chicken queasadillas are excellent.

I also had a nice glass of champagne here.

It's very smoky but the atmosphere is festive.
author: Niniane W.

description: I was admittedly wary of joining some folks here, not being a fan of anything smoke-related. I was pleasantly surprised on many levels: devent sangria and the spaciousness of this place, plus above average guac. And not nearly as smokey as I feared.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I used to hang out here quite a bit.  Good menu, good bar selection.   BUT....they do have their issues:

- parking SUCKS.  I almost always took the motorcycle because of this.
- they no longer are open for weekday lunch, which was my fav time to go there.

and the winner - if you are kicked back in their GREAT patio area smoking a bone, and someone comes in for a meal or drinks that doesn't appreciate the fine aroma of a good cigar...well, this being SF, you're going to have to move on.  In a cigar bar, mind you.  Happened to me not once, but twice.  Kinda lost interest at that point....luckily, Knickerbockers reopened to satiate my need.
:-)

IF you're in the city and want to smoke a bone, this is not a bad place at all...just be forewarned that you might not be able to smoke said bone....kind of a bummer for a cigar bar.
author: Bill O.

description:
The salsa/merengue lover in me comes to this place way more often than someone with a good man at home should...

However, there is nothing like a good salsa partner and this is pretty much the only joint in town where I can go and not get molested by my dance partner.  (Working on salsa lessons with said good man at home).

The monkey-suit wearing, number crunching person inside me has to pretend i don't know a lot of the said good salsa dancers when i frequent happy hours with my work team- they would most likely find me shocking and appalling. 

I love the cigar smoke, the live bands, the caiprinhas, the good dancers...who needs to vacation to Spain- just drink enough and come to Cigar Bar- best stay-cation destination in town!
author: Gabrielle J.

description: I give them 3.5, been here several times throughout the years and always enjoyed their food and drinks. I just don't go too often because I'm never in that area of town. Real good french fries, I didn't like the bruschetta, too much goat cheese and the sausage on top was not too good, tasted funky. Sangrias were real good! I like the outdoor and indoor seating and the party room in the back.
author: Karen T.

description: I really liked this place, especially on Fridays and Saturdays when they have the Salsa band. It's a great place to go with a group of friends. The environment is really nice and classy. There were only two things I didn't like, the rudeness of one bartender and the size of the girl's bathroom, too small.
author: Natalia Q.

description:
it was my friends birthday and he was visiting from out of town. I had no idea where to take him as he usually likes to remain low key and drink with the boys. We opted to meet some female friends here, and ended up having a spectacular evening!

the bar itself is small, and intimate. The bar's most attractive features include live music, and a large, quaint, outside patio. The bar, however, does not stay true to its title. Their cigar selection was rather sparse, but the ambiance compensated well for this minor shortfall.

their mojitos were excellent. i'll return here, but hopefully i won't stumble out. the cigar knocked me on my ass.
author: Peter T.

description:
Just celebrated my 30th Birthday at The Cigar Bar and Grill. We rented a room and had a great time. The minimum was very reasonable and easy to meet. Daniela, the woman who coordinated it with me, was responsive and helpful. Sofia, our server for the night, was awesome. The food we ordered for the party was also reasonably priced, and more importantly, delicious!

The only downside was that because the room we were in was right next to where the band was playing and off the courtyard, a bunch of randoms kept coming in and I had to politely ask them to leave which made me feel like a meanie. Still,  I highly recommend this place for an evening out or for a private party.
author: Sarah H.

description: Definitely nice a place for cigar aficionados.  Not over the top but not a hole in wall either.  Just middle of the road.  Nice place on friday nights...salsa, stogies, and scotch.  Works well for me considering this town has a dearth of cigar lounges.
author: Paul J.

description:
Had an incredible Friday night at The Cigar Bar & Grill.

Good place for salsa dancing and the music was terrific.

Had the Big Daddy IPAs. Two thumbs up.

The overall ambiance made up for the average service.
author: Harry S.

description:
Cigars and Cognac.  
These are two of my favorite things.

What is better than going to Cigar Bar after work, sitting out in the patio with some friends, and enjoying a nice cigar and a glass of cognac as you chat the night away?  Perhaps getting a nearly free limo ride there.  Not bad, not bad at all.  

I had the Avo #9 cigar which was good.  It was a little on the short end, but it went well with my glass of Hine VSOP.  Service was pretty attentive and the bar wasn't too crowded.  The bartender was pretty cool and gave our group recommendations on what cigars we should get and what liquors would go well with what.  The crowd is about late 20's, early 30's.  This is exactly the type of place Barney Stinson would hang out.  haha.  Definitely one of my new fav places.
author: Bert N.

description:
How many bars/lounges can you honestly say that you have frequented for a decade?  I barely have friends that I have known for that long!

That is either a tribute to the coolness of this place or my alcoholism and I hope that it is not the latter.  

I have moved away from and come back to San Francisco numerous times over the last 10 years and one thing is a constant:  The Cigar Bar.

It's changed ownership a few times and the crowd is obviously different but The Cigar Bar has never lost the laid back, relaxed attitude and environment (except that time when management reprimanded us, though nicely, to stop doing body shots on the bar, which was probably appropriate on their part).

It's become a ton more popular over the years.  Friday and Saturday nights can get a little crowded, but if you are a Latin music fan, it's worth it.  I highly suggest the Cigar Bar as a weeknight/Thursday hang out/Happy Hour scene/weekend pre-party meetup spot.

One of the owners, Neil, is a great chef.  Love the salmon and, ironically, they have one of the better burgers in town.  The harisa fries are SPICY.

As far as the drinks, I recommend the Patron Silver shots (smooth baby!).  Ben pours them the BEST.

Overall, a kick back spot where you can actually hear yourself think and not get bumped into left and right.

Sleeper hint - their back room has a flat screen TV and it's a little known gem to watch a Cal game on.  Go Bears!
author: Deron D.

description:
This place is a nice place to hang out with a group of friends. They have an outdoor patio area and an indoor dance area.

I've been here twice but the most recent time I went it was raining. They had the salsa band set up inside. And they had speakers that blasted the hell out of my ears. The music was great but it was so freaking loud. A friend of ours who goes there regularly goes with a group of friends and they literally bring ear plugs and dance on the dance floor. They love it there but the music is intensely loud.

I think if it wasn't raining and we were able to dance on the outdoor patio it would have been so much better. The dance floor was packed and people were havin fun. It's a fun diverse crowd and I liked it.

It was fairly easy to get a drink and the bar service was nice. I had a raspberry lemon drop and that was about $9.
author: LinLin L.

description:
this place is alrite.

the physical space is great, indoor seating, open patio seating, so great on a warm night. they have space heaters for the not so warm nights, but they are on FULL blast, so be prepared.

the workers were all nice and attentive too.

awesome live band. mixed crowd- can see how others say it can get douchey.

food is just your normal bar food. nothing to write home about.

it's a good place to gather a larger group for happy hour, if you can get there early enough to grab a table.  my friends arrived around 5pm on a friday and were able to save us all a spot.

**if you sit outside, be prepared to smell like cigars.
author: Hannah M.

description: found this interesting place as I walked through the streets to find a good place to eat & unwind after a tiring & busy day ..was traveling alone to the city on work ..good food, great ambience ; the bartender was really nice & understood a lady's need for some lone time after a hectic day ( there are crooks everywhere , but thankfully these guys knew how to make it safer for a single woman ), thanks guys. If I come back to sfo, definitely wanna go here with frnds and chill next time..the sangria's were really yum..a must try..
author: Subhashini S.

description:
Actually, in many ways, I prefer the Occidental cigar bar in SF which I visited last night. But this place is much better to visit with non- cigar smokers. The courtyard is very pleasant. I wonder what they do when it rains???
I would happily bring my wife here. 
Again the humidor was limited but had good cigars. I brought my own ( a fabulous Arturo Fuente Hemingway Classic) and washed it down (if you can wash down a cigar) with a glass of their excellent Malbec ($9.00)
A good live band kicked off with some Latin beats which somehow added to the cigar. 
Friendly staff and nice place to hang out.
author: Nick P.

description:
This is my spot!

After moving here from Seattle over a year ago, the first thing I had to look for was a friendly place to smoke cigars. 

I don't really have much to say about their food, though their sweet potato fries are really good. Whenever we come here it's usually to smoke and have a drink. Their drink prices are about average compared to other San Francisco bars. I would just recommend that you bring your own cigars though as they have a limited selection of cigars and are relatively expensive. 

It is a great place to kick back with friends and family, smoke a cigar, and have a drink! I love their outdoor courtyard, very European. They have heaters for those cold San Francisco nights.

Friday and Saturday nights can get really crowded and there's a cover fee after 9 or 10; it's a club atmosphere during the weekends. If you're just looking for a place to have a smoke and drink, then I would recommend you check it out during the week.
author: Joe B.

description:
This is a pretty fun place to hang out, great music, fun people, cigars -- what more could a person want? 

The courtyard has a tendency to get really crowded, but you can just excuse your way through the masses.
author: Jennifer P.

description:
this bar is very cute......indoor area is little bit small and claustrophobic, low ceiling, small bar. we went on a saturday night bar hopping through north beach and walked passed this place. there was a short line and it was pretty bumpin' so we decided to try it out. 

we had to pay cover, i think it was $10 per person.  there was a live band playing, not too bad. i think it was like latin or something. mostly 30+ crowds. the best part of the bar was the outdoor courtyard area. it was very spacious outside. alot of people were eating outside so im assuming they serve full menu even at 11pm or so. we stayed for only one drink and went to another bar afterwards.
author: Sara C.

description:
I've been back a few times since, and this place is more to my liking than I first realized.  Befriended a waitress who'll tell us when an outdoor table opens up. and it's not been so crowded lately.  We've had perfectly crispy fries, chips + salsa, great service and tons of gin here.  Can't complain. 

You can add a pack of marlboro lights to your tab, but they'll hit you for 8 bucks. For 8 bucks you could also get two orders of those fries, or 1.333 well gin + tonics at hh.  Choose your choice.  Umm, yeah, all three, thanks.
author: Meg W.

description:
Great place. Has a large, open patio for warm evenings, salsa dancing for hot nights and lots of good looking people for eye candy. What more could you ask for?

I like that it has separate rooms, reminds me of the bars in Europe. Definitely a great place to hit up after work. Swing by, you won't regret it.
author: Shreya C.

description:
I really loved the atmosphere in this place-- you could dress up as much or as little as you'd like, the music is great, the crowd not pretentious (although the areas for actual cigar-smoking might be different) and the staff were laid-back yet very professional.

Bartender makes excellent drinks and they have no.209 gin, distilled right here in SF.

The polenta-gorgonzola-olive fritters are just ridiculous. Great place to be for happy hour with a bunch of friends!
author: Jen N.

description:
First off, I would like to say that this place is really cool.  

I think I would be giving it the complete 5 stars if it wasn't so packed the other night......

*loses keyboard*

HELLO ALL, NO OFFENSE ARCHIE, I WILL LET YOU FINISH, BUT THERE IS NO WAY CIGAR BAR IS ONLY 4 STARS!!!!!!!

CIGAR BAR IS ONE OF THE GREATEST BARS OF ALL TIME AND THAT SHOULD BE RECOGNIZED!!!!!!!

ARCHIE'S OPINION IS GOOD AND NO DISRESPECT BUT CIGAR BAR IS THE GREATEST BAR/LOUNGE OF ALL TIME!!!!

*keyboard given back*

Man, that Kanye is getting really intrusive these days.

Classy.
author: Archie R.

description:
Dinner ended early and we had about 1.5 hours to kill before heading to the The Bubble Lounge to meet up with more friends to celebrate the rest of my birthday night.

As we wanted to sit down, my friend Sandra J. recommended this place to chill until then. 

Great recommendation, Sandra! =D.

This place was really laid back and made kick-ass drinks for cheap!

---DRINKS---
$8 for a long island and/or AMF. Really clean, strong tasting mojitos. And my favorite of the night: Ginger Cooler. (I think that's what it was called..but basically a concoction of Grey Goose, ginger liquor of some form, and soda). 

Excellent!

---AMBIANCE---
Reminds me of what-would-be a Spanish underground bar for late night drinks, cigar smoking, and salsa dancing. 

---FINALLY---
We came before they started charging the cover fee of $7 (I believe?), so all was well.

As we were on our way out, a live band was just about to start up.

I will certainly keep this place in mind for a future chill outing in the city =).
author: Gail N.

description:
I don't smoke cigar so what the hell am I doing here and giving it 4 stars?  This was part of our pub crawl with some friends and they had suggested swinging by this joint to chill with a smoke.  I don't know how to smoke cigar where you just puff - I'm used to inhaling, unlike Clinton, so cigar smoking is not for me.  Hubby on the other hand, enjoys it with the right company so he was game.  

We got to the front door just a couple minutes before 6pm when they open.  There were already a few ladies outside waiting.  By the time my watch hit 6pm and the door was still closed, I decided to call them.  When I asked them what time they are opened and was told 6pm - I told them it's 6pm and we are waiting outside along with some other people.  She promptly said "oh, we'll be right there to open the door" and someone came within seconds.  We walked in and down some stairs and came upon this room that opens up to the outdoor patio.  The sofa w/ chaise looked comfy so I just threw my purse there and settled - who cares there was a reserve sign on the table?  Anyway, the reservation doesn't start until 8:30pm so we have 2.5 hours to kill.  

I didn't even bother looking at the menu so I am clueless as to what they offer.  I know they serve champagne/sparkling wine and the ladies shared a bottle (Pol Roger Brut @ $78) while the men got their hands on some Scotch whisky (Lagavulin 16 @ $15, Macallan 12 @ $12, Glennfiddich 12 @ $9) and a rum (MMD Uitlight @ $13).  

I'm a bubble girl but what we had wasn't so great but that didn't damper the mood.  It is a very chill place to hang with friends.  I was so comfortable and was practically lying down.  It was just awesome to enjoy good times w/ good friends.  Seeing the men bond and chill over a cigar and their whisky, that's priceless.
author: Gloria H.

description: Visited today for first time!! Great wait staff and very reasonable priced drinks!! Patio was very nice. My new hangout spot for single malt scotch and cigars!!!
author: lewis J.

description: Rude Rude Rude Bartender. Tatooed female bartender deserves to be fired. We were planning on getting food & drinks, but the bartender was too busy socializing to help us. After waiting 15 minutes for her to acknowledge, my husband motioned to her and she astoundingly told her "friends" she was chatting with that she had to help this "annoying" person. Forget it. Didn't get anything. We left.  We will never go back.
author: Lisa D.

description: Went there on a Saturday night.  Nice place with a long bar and several rooms. Lots of people and had to stand in line to get in but it moved fast. Music was great and the crowd was very friendly and easy to meet and talk to people.  Dropped a star because it was very crowded at the bar as well as on the dance floor. This affected our ability to thoroughly enjoy the band and the dancing when constantly getting pushed around.  Luckily everyone was in very good mood and this made socializing easier than usual. It was beautiful inside and we were already talking about returning on a less crowded night if that exists.
author: C. M.

description:
Although the mere name of this bar would normally dissuade me from venturing out here, since I can't stand the smell of smoke... the happy Salsa dancers and fun ambiance entices me to want to dance.  Wow it's been so long since I've been to Cigar Bar or for that matter dancing anywhere... that I was excited that he agreed.  I was surprised that my date has never been here, but he says he walks by it everyday when he goes to work. 
I can see my friend and her date smiling or possibly laughing at me while I was dancing with my tall date.  At this point, I no longer cared about our height difference. We just danced to the Latin music and had blast.  After awhile, my neck was getting tired of looking up to him, so my friend's date had brilliant idea... we went to the back room and played pool. That was so much fun; haven't played pool in ages. 
Cigar Bar has always been a great date place and it hasn't changed since the last time I was here years ago. Now all I can think about is wanting to take Salsa lessons!
author: Myra M.

description:
Anywhere that gives me some Latin flavor to move my body to gets a , good review! 

If you're not a smoker, the outside might overwhelm you, but if u can deal with it its a beautifull place to sit and enjoy a drink with some friends, especially on a warmer sf night. 

The whole place is very 'group friendly' you can feel comfortable walking in a with a large group of friends. 

I didn't eat the food, but it looked good.

I went on a saturday night and they had a nice latin meringue band. people were having a great time dancing, and even more having a good time watching! I'll be back.
author: Shadi N.

description:
One of the more laid back spots in North Beach. 

You must remind yourself this is a neighborhood where tourists and over privileged people come to strut. Young over privileged snooty people thinking their cool. That in itself is funny. Go to people watch, as like anyplace there is the good, the bad and the ugly. 

Choose what you want to do, play pool, dance, drink, smoke, carouse, laugh at the white girls/guys who cant dance, video record the drunk slutty lap dances going on late at night. As i said over privileged, means some people think they are Teflon and the shit they do won't stick to them. You may catch attitude from people so keep a sense of humor, be prepared to acquiesce that stupid people do stupid things, and try not to be involved. 

All in all the drinks are good, the tobacco selection is adequate, the ambiance is that of laid back fun, keep yourself out of the fray, and if you can, take a dance lesson before you get on the dance floor. 

Oh and this place is cougar friendly, cubs are funny, try real hard, and this is not unusual. It is a real people watching opportunity, and some of it is good, some is bad, and yup there is ugly. bring a camera and go straight to youtube.

Bottle service and rooms available. The dance floor can be a contact sport. I know a person who chipped a tooth because of a sloppy dancer knocking a microphonestand with the mic in it over and it hit her face. As I said ...
author: Jennifer H.

description:
What an awesome concept!

Cocktails, cigars, live band, food, outdoor patio for smoking and indoor salsa dancing! This place has everything you need for a fun night with a (slightly) older crowd (older the clubbing scene anyway). Came here once and I'm excited for my second, third, fourth, fifth time..

*Note: order the mojito!
author: Jenny T.

description: Went here for my birthday, great find. Would have not expected this from the location. It was classy but still laid back. Great dancers and live band. Going back!
author: Carla H.

description: Great place to drop in for a good cigar and port or whatever you drink. An oasis for cigar smokers in SF.
author: Lou F.

description:
Stopped by this place with my lady x2 ,nothing pleasing to the eye
food and drinks so-so,crowd definetly seasoned,it is near the
strip clubs so a definite downside. Bartenders a bit rude ,cocky and
can possibly learn from other places such as Comstock Saloon,Absinthe.
Music lively,but one can get that elsewhere.
author: George P.

description:
+ Live salsa band without a cover charge.
+ People watching.
-  Watching sweaty hippy chicks pretending to salsa.
+ Sneaking into a private party and eating their food.
--Slow service on the weekends...which led me to eat other people's food. Maybe a plus/minus on that one.

Overall, enjoyable.
author: Angie O.

description:
I love the set up of this place.  Just had my 10 year HS reunion.  The bar area is spacious enough for plenty of drunk people to hang out and have a grand time.

The outside area was nice when you wanted to escape, the drinks were flowing, the bar tenders took very good care of us.  They also had a latin band playing salsa music that my fiance and I boogied down to.

Definitely don't mind taking a trip out to this place.
author: Amado R.

description: I was visiting San Fran with my fiancé and since he's a cigar smoker we decided to try this place out. Cute little patio to sit outside and smoke. Too bad it started to rain and the patio was closed down. The drinks were good too.
author: jackie a.

description:
The last time I went to the Cigar Bar I was met with a $7 cover, a large bar tab, weak pours and a bunch of people who's heads were so far up their ass that their cigar smoke was coming out their nipples. 

Nipples shouldn't smoke and mediocre overpriced sangria should not be paired with a cigar. However this is the popular choice amongst the regulars. Maybe the combo tastes different once your head is up your ass. No matter, the servers have theirs pretty far up there too, serving not by who has been waiting longest or tips the best or is the most polite, but rather by who, seemingly, is the most attractive. 

They get a bonus star for having some good scotches and a nice patio, but this is still not enough to endure the service and clientele.
author: Drue C.

description:
At first I wasn't impressed, especially after having to pay a $7 cover charge. Then my vodka/rockstar was terrible (I guess it was the wrong thing to order there). It tasted like plain soda water, should of gave it back to the bartender but the bar was so crowded. 
But then I heard the salsa band which was pretty good and then I found the man of my dreams. So the crappy drink and $7 cover charge was worth it. 
Also for being a "cigar" bar, I don't think I saw anyone actually smoking one.
author: Kelley D.

description:
Came here for a friend's going-away party on Saturday nite.

What I liked:
-not as smoky as I had expected. Folks were smoking stogies, yet the area wasn't smoke-filled.
-great live music. Kind of a mix between latin and jazz.
-loved the outdoor patio area; way better for hanging with the group and sipping on drinks. Seats and tables get filled quickly, so keep your eyes open.
-as for parking, drive down to Battery and you'll see plenty of parking, even for a Saturday nite.
-mojitos were great, good drink menu.

What could've been improved:
-Summer sangria was not as sweet or even sangria-like as I thought; tasted a lil bitter at times.
-Cigar Bar is more of a club/bar than an actual cigar lounge. Not many actual cigar smokers; those looking to solely smoke might actually feel like part of the minority
-$7 cover charge; not a lot, but just a heads up to have cash on you.
-with cigar smoke comes smoky clothes. So Febreze when you get home.

Had a great time here; music was lively, yet still enabled the group to have great convos. Patio is great, bartenders were friendly. So here's to feeling good all the time:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PWZF1O3DGFY
author: Neil N.

description: Great spirit selection, relaxed atmosphere.  Bought a 21 year old single malt and a Portofino to smoke with it.  Suitable combination for someone not up on their cigars.
author: John S.

description:
Over the past three years that I have been going to the Cigar Bar, it has never once disappointed me.  Consistent drinks (sangria, mojitos, mint juleps, the list goes on..), friendly non-pretentious management and bar staff, a diverse crowd, a solid menu, and the option to be inside or out is what keeps me coming back.  

It has the charm of a small place that recognizes you when you come in and makes you feel welcome regardless of why you are here.  I have been here for numerous happy hours, farewells, Kapakahi, nights of music, dancing, and smoking.  What also brings a pleasant sense of familiarity is you never know whom you will run into when you're here.

I must mention that Neil, the dark and handsome fellow who walks around and greets you with a genuine smile, is one of the sweetest people I have met in the city.  Great with names and faces and makes you feel like a friend you have known for years.  I only wish him and this space continued growth and success.  Keep up the great work, Neil!  Never give up. :)

5 stars in my book.
author: Winnie W.

description:
We were 3 groups of many people arriving at different times on a Friday night.  Some came for a birthday party in a banquet room, others came to dance.  Few of us came to smoke.  There was no cover if you arrived before the Salsa band was scheduled to start at 9:30pm.  $7 cover after 9:30pm.  I did not see long lines at the door.

We all ordered drinks, and some food at differing times.  Waitresses were very friendly and attentive even latter when it got crowded.

The salsa band "Conjunto Picante" was very good.  There was a dance performance by "Its Only Dance" also very good.  Main bummer was small dance floor so we danced in an adjoining room.
If your main goal is salsa dancing then you may want to try Cocomo.
Good music with large dance floor, but no food, no table service.
 
All in all it was a great night out.  Most of our friends liked the drinks, food, service, music, and dancing.  Those who indulged had a great time smoking their "puros" in the spacious outdoor patio.  We would all return again.
author: Saul M.

description:
A homeless man walked up to me a few weeks ago and told me that if I gave him a chance (and some cash) he could show me things I'd never seen before.

I turned him down.  Not that I doubted his sexual prowess, he looked strong and virile for a 55 year-old derelict, but because I don't need him to show me the secret spots and wow my body, I have Yelp.

One block away from the spa appointment scheduled later in the evening, the Cigar Bar & Grill seemed the perfect place to clog the pores we would later have rubbed and scrubbed.  Oh, and my favorite Yelpers love it, which didn't hurt.

Armed with two friends, my inhaler, and an intense desire to see if this place was really the douchebag mecca I suspected it to be, we walked down the stairs and were transported.

But something was wrong.  Where was the smoke? 

I tucked the inhaler back in my laptop bag.  I suspect patrons puff cigars in the back rooms or on the patio.  Speaking of smoking, the girl-to-guy ratio is verrrryyy favorable.  

We sipped glasses of the "Not So Offensive $5 Wine."  Had we more time, we would have ordered appetizers - they looked scrumptious.

Our waitress was pleasant, the tables were cozy, the lighting was conducive to a business meeting or illicit affair, and it was quiet enough to hear our conversation, but still loud enough avoid overhearing forced discourse at the adjacent table.

We lost track of time, and while making a hasty exit, I had an idea.  I can't divulge my secrets (don't hate the player, hate the game), but let's just say it involves a return visit with a low-cut sweater, fake asthma attack, and CPR from a hottie

Genius.
author: Janney B.

description:
It's been a long time since I've paid a cover in SF, but since my friends were dead set on going in, I dropped the $7. ( I completely understand the economics of a cover, but with SO many great places in SF without one, it's hard to digest at times... )

Anyways, I did really enjoy myself and the live salsa band was phenomenal. Watching the brave souls tear up the hardwood made me secretly ( Just a TINY bit, Wish I could dance like that). 

Then I took a Patron shot and mentally hit myself.

The outdoor patio is fantastic, with lots of seating and ample room to mingle and meet new people. Come Spring, this would be a great place to kick back with a cold beer and enjoy the warm SF nights.

BUT the best part of the night was watching a heated soap opera play out right in front of us.

My buddies and I were at the bar when all of a sudden two guys started to do their best elephant seal impersonations. 

Bloating their stomachs and doing the face to face dance.

I guess one had accidentally knocked over another's drink, but the highlight of the night was watching the guy pour an entire gin and tonic over the head of his arch enemy. Classic.

The guy didn't even flinch, he simply wiped his face and continued to do the stare down. (Now that's keeping your cool)

Mr.I like to make it Rain on people was promptly kicked out, and we ended up all taking Patron shots with Mr.Wet, and then moved on into our Friday night around town.
author: Mike K.

description:
Pretty packed here on the Saturday night that we went to check this out. I'm probably not a good reviewer of cigar bars because a) I absolutely can't stand the smell of smoke (cigar or not) b) never been to one. The place was packed with lots of people (mostly guys)... just standing around smoking... yuck! There was no music and there was a cover charge... 

We basically left in 15 minutes since I was so uncomfortable marinating in the smokey atmosphere, even on the outside patio it was still super smokey. Gag! I wanted to jump in the shower right after I left. Will not be back here again!
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Cool place.  Nice atmosphere, plenty of people but not so packed that you have to throw elbows every 2 seconds.  I really liked the outdoor patio thing, especially when my friend and I were able to snag a table.  The band playing sounded good, even danceworthy.  Although, there was not much room for dancing.  Given the lack of skill of all but 2 people on the dance floor, it seems as though this is not the place to come to for some serious dancing.  But, it is an excellent place to chill and catch up with friends, since the music doesn't permeat the place to the point that you can't hear what one another is saying.

Minus one point for the nasty mojito's.  You would think that in a latin place they would know how to make a decent mojito.  It was so tart that I couldn't finish it.  Now that's a serious problem if I can't finish a drink.  I'm taking away a half point for the smoke that the table next to ours kept blowing in our face.  Yeah,  I know it's a cigar bar so people will be smoking, but I still didn't like it.

Will I come back here?  Most definitely.  I want the chance to show off my dancing skills on the teeny tiny dance floor!
author: Danielle B.

description:
Cha-CHING! Hollaaaa! Happy Hour here is on POINT.

Half-off HUGE Quesadillas - chicken or cheese...
$4 Rum drink - happy hour beers, sangria and MORE!

For the second time - it's been kinda a "sausage fest"...lots of dudes chillin' and smokin'...not that this single girl minds much - lots of dude watching.
lots of seating in and outside...

BUT...the food was yum...my drink was yum...and the prices were really reasonable for the location and the amount of goodies my tummy went home with.
author: Katy A.

description:
I guess I had a really good buzz because I didn't realize I stole their pen... So the next morning I pull it out of my bag & it says "This pen once belonged to Cigar Bar & Grill" LOL

I've been there twice, both times were pretty good experiences. I was there back in December and decided to come back because we have some serious smokers in our group & we were hungry. Last time I was there it was pretty packed. Like you couldn't walk to the other side of the patio without touching 20 people. But this last time I was there, it wasn't packed & I actually ate food and it wasn't terrible. I would definitely come back. :)
author: Angela V.

description:
Another one of my favorite spots in the city. 
Haven't been here in a while
I think it's about time to hit up The Cigar Bar!!!
author: Sergio M.

description:
I have beed here three times now.  This place is more of a hang out for young urban profesionals that want to  smoke cigars and hang out in the patio. As far as dancing goes, they had a good band one time  but the other two times the music was not that profesional. There are not that many good dancers so I got alot of guys that put my arms into a pretzel lock. 

If your looking for good night life, a place to drink, eat and smoke, this place looks kinda fun. If you like to dance, and you know how, you may not like this place too much.
author: Shannon M.

description: You're either fighting your way to the bar or the only person in a three block radius.  Nice bar especially on a warm day but difficult finding a seat or getting a drink.  9/07
author: Suz L.

description: great brand marketing from CB&G in which it's more than just inhaling stogies. the hh means dollar-off drafts and nosh-specials. the salami/cheese and sea-salt almonds were great. good upscale crowd. i left feeling this is a 3.75-star yelp experience, so i'm rounding this up to four.point.oh! (like hottie park ha seon).
author: Derek N.

description:
Tried this place for the first time tonight. It's a nice spot to try out at least once, even if you're just the occasional cigar smoker like I am. A very lively, yet mellow atmosphere, it's perhaps one of the few places left where one can drink AND smoke.

The cigar selection isn't huge, BUT they have decent quality cigars available. I had a Hampton Court which had a nice, mild flavor that didn't clash with my food or drink. It actually went well with my tea (yes, I had tea).

The food was okay. I had the chicken quesadilla, which was a bit pricy considering the small serving, but if I was more interested in the food than a good smoke, I probably wouldn't have gone.

Now for the one reason why I can't give this place a better rating: the parking. I think I drove around for about 20 minutes looking for a place to park. They do have valet parking, but I wasn't feeling it.
author: E. J.

description:
Friendly staff and tasty drinks. Super crowded and some not my choice of clientele including the couple who couldn't contain their salsa dancing to the dance floor and decided that they should salsa dance in the laps of my friends and I to the I just turned 21 let's keep doing shots at the bar. 

Cigars smelt pretty good and considering it's a smoking bar it really isn't super saturated with smoke. I've smelt worse leaving concerts in AZ or god forbid, bingo on the reservation.

 I could do without a cover at a bar but it's fairly standard for live music. If someone else had a party here I'd go back but not a place I would ever pick to host one or invite others to - at least on a Saturday.
author: Allegra F.

description: Very disappointing....I was looking forward to a high class location to enjoy a smoke and a glass of fine whiskey.  My wife and I arrived around 10pm and grabbed a seat outside.  One of the servers, after walking past us several times, briskly informed us that table service was finished for the night and we must order directly from the bar (more on this later).  I proceed to the bar and receive the same quality of service.  I was passed up while waiting at the humidor just to buy a cigar and told to sit tight and he would be right with me.  That moment never came.  While discussing my options, i noticed a table still receiving table service from a server, and here I sat still without drink and cigar.  After about 25 minutes of zero service we decided to leave and go elsewhere.  I found it strange that a band was playing in the open air area and I was informed that they would not be closing until around 1am, yet no servers were supposedly working.  It is possible that i caught them on a bad night, but I cannot recommend The Cigar Bar & Grill to anyone.  If you are looking for a relaxing evening with a drink and a cigar, I would advise going elsewhere.
author: Ricky C.

description: My team loves coming here for happy hour, and while the drinks are strong and the food is good (for bar food), there's just something about this place that doesn't excite me. Maybe just the lighting, it's so dark in here, and tables are spread out throughout the courtyard-style bar/restaurant. I do have to concede that it is fairly spacey, and it's never been crowded or rowdy like the other bars I've been to.
author: Melody L.

description:
Cigar Bar, I really like you. 

There a lot of things at CB that could turn one off...ie: a very mixed crowd as far as age goes, well dressed professionals (some like the grunge), smoking outside (blah blah blah) and noise. 

I happen to love all of the above. Every time I find myself in this area of town I gravitate towards CB. There is always a cover on the weekends ($7) but who cares, there is live music and dancing is encouraged! The drinks are poured well for the $6 tag (G&T) and they take CCs. I am truly over SF's cash only bar atmosphere. 

To make everything even better the bartenders are nice and I love the orange tiled floor and wooden beams. See you soon CB, thanks for another great time!
author: Theresa T.

description: Cigar smoker heaven. Surprising mix of all ages. Outdoor patio great for smoking. Naturally ventilated!  Small but good selection of premium smokes.
author: John B.

description:
Great place and has an ambiance of it's own. The crowd is mixed with people from different walks of life brought together by the simple pleasures of life, that is cigars, music and dance. Bar tenders are friendly and never fail to notice a returning customer.  
Unfortunately, nowadays they stop the music earlier than normal because of serial complains from a neighbor who just moved in. 
The City rezoned this area and the pathetic neighbor across the street that frequently calls the SFPD, very pestling. I ask the Q, wasn't he aware that there is a vibrant nightlife before he moved? Out of generosity and good faith, the owners of CB decided to install sound proof windows at his place and he still calls the cops. Typical sheer harassment from a churlish miserable person, bless his sole.
author: True R.

description: Been here a couple times and always have a good time. It's never a consistent crowd but the service and drinks are always good. The pomegranate margarita is amazing, a must try!! The food is decent and they have good happy hour specials on food and drinks. It's a pretty big place and, as the name implies, they some how get away with an outdoor cigar courtyard in the middle of the place. Not my thing but just wanted to clarify :)
author: Gina C.

description:
There's a mysterious phenomenon going around SF. Bartenders are making drinks that are dangerously strong.  Seriously, this is the second place in a month where I've passed out and had to be scooped up by kind Yelpers. I don't know WHY this keeps happening.

Oh, too much wine you say? Impossible. Um, let's see there was the bottle I split at dinner w/my sister-in-law, then the 3 or 8 I had at Cigar Bar. Wait, I think there was a sangria in the mix as well. 

A few conversations ensued, which I will dramaticize for you to the tune of "Shoes" by Internet Legend Kelly:

Bartender: I think you've had too many drinks.
Me: Shut Up!
Concerned Friend: I think you've had too many drinks
Me: Shut Up!
My Liver: I think you've had too many drinks.
Me: Shut Up! 
My Legs: I think you've had too many drinks [give out and crumple]
Me: [*crickets*]

You'd think that after passing out like Britney Spears in Vegas on NYE (fortunately I was wearing pants and not being photographed by the paparazzi) I'd be a good little girl and get in the cab my friends procured for me. But I was having such a good time that I commanded the driver bring me back! They were less than pleased at having to babysit. God love'em, who knows what ditch I'd be lying in if not for them. 

'Tis a good thing I'm not famous nor have kids that I'm engaged in a custody battle for. I can imagine the headlines: "Alias R passes out at bar again." I'm so classy. 
******************************
[Begin proper review]
This place is a little too strong on the chode element for my comfort, but it's a great venue. Spanish-style architecture, a patio perfect for a beautiful night, pool table, and salsa music.
author: Suzanne R.

description:
I was apprehensive at first because when I heard "cigar" I was thinking: Older. Money Men. Not grounds for a younger Asian female. No "happy-ending" here hunny, no matter how much money you throw in my face.

Well, someone slap me in the face-- I went on a Friday night, the place was full of a diverse group of late-20s, early-30s. The venue seems very narrow but the best part is the outdoor area. Of course this is where people were smoking their cigars, but the open space is ideal for it, I wasn't holding my breath as if there was a shortage of fresh air. 

They have lots of specialty drinks and of course, cigars. A place where you should try anything on the menu (well, at least I would). The crowd was very friendly. The live band was amazing, it played well into the vibe and set a festive atmosphere. I'd definitely go back and make sure I do the salsa next time.
author: Jamie Q.

description:
I'll start off this review with a "I'm definitely coming back here" statement, because this time I actually mean it.  My adventure at Cigar Bar was unfortunately cut short last weekend, but it was memorable nonetheless.

The patio is spacious and it looked like a nice place to sit.  Too bad it was already full by the time we got there.

They have couches and a pool room which look like, after a long day of work, could be really relaxing and bring some joy into the day.  Too bad they were occupied and being played on.

The $4 wine special.  It actually costs $5....the joke is lost on me.  You know how at Carl's Jr they have the $6 Burger that actually costs like $3, and you're all SWEET, I'm getting an awesome deal!...well, at Cigar Bar, saying that the $4 is really $5, you feel a little ripped off.  But the wine was not bad at all, so I just chalked it up to wry humor and drank on.

Hopefully my next trip to CB will be MORE and BETTER everything.  I'd still recommend the place, just get there early and snag one of the hot seats.
author: Erika C.

description:
Attention Single Ladies (who like Chads)!!  This place is a man-a-torium on Thursdays after work. Jeezus. I have never seen so many young professional mostly white men in one place at one time. It was like a locust swarm. If the locusts were wearing Banana Republic and smoking cigars.

It's a funny thing about all the cigar smoking, though. I understand it's the Cigar Bar, but it just doesn't look right on young people. If you're under 50, dude, you look like a little boy wearing your dad's suit. It just doesn't fit. Maybe it has something to do with the fact that half the dudes are wearing backpacks. (Why? Are you going hiking later?) Makes them look younger or something.

Anyway, the pulled pork quesadilla is grubbin', and the bathrooms are nice. Actually, the whole place is nice. Cool and subterranean, decorated in tasteful Spanish Colonial. Really, any place that contains both whiskey and antiques is okay by me.

But the happy hour crowd...yeesh.
author: Megan W.

description:
"It never happened with a big cigar
I never even dated Mizziz Starr.
................................................
I might have risked a little jail
But Monica knows I did not inhale".

---- From Clinton's Testimony during his impeachment.

The difference between Clinton and Matt H is that Matt exposed himself publicly before a crowd of mature yelpers(vis a vis intern(s) on his birthday at the Cigar Bar. Finally, I realized the reason behind making us paying a cover to enter this Bar was to see the launch of the male revue.

So move over Chippandale.. the Cigar Bar is the new go to place for cougars who want fresh meat  with their Salsa  on a sat night. The drinks are strong and some of the yelpers like Alias R and A.K. were in their element.

The word Cigar conjures an image of living life large and trying to be larger than life. So if you like to fantasize that you are getting a Buena Vista Social Club experience of Havana in North Beach, a  visit to The Cigar Bar is recommended provided you get there early enough to dodge the cover.
author: Kaustav C.

description:
Sorry I didn't get to talk to you all individually. We're all busy these days.

Bartender #1: I know my girl has breasts and I don't, but we'll both tip you and neither of us will sleep with you so there's no functional difference between us and thus there's no reason to ignore me and serve her right away.

Bartender #2: A vodka gimlet* is typically made with _sweetened_ lime juice. I'll admit I rather enjoyed your sour/tart creation though.

Bartender #3: Thanks for serving me promptly and making my second gimlet correctly. If you could do me a solid and talk to #1 about service and #2 about gimlets I'd appreciate it. 

Kitchen staff: Good job on the appetizer plate! The quesadillas, wings, and calamari were all tasty.

Other Patrons: Y'all were well dressed and generally polite, but damn, did you all have to pack in here like that? There are lots of bars in north beach. It's the appetizers here, right? And I'm almost disappointed that only a couple of you were actually smoking cigars, being that it's the cigar bar & grill. Whatever. No worries.

Door guy: 'sup.

Matt H: Happy Birthday! you don't look a day over whatever age you were before.

Other friends: You guys are awesome. Sorry I wasn't better company, but yeah. Don't ever change.



*Yes, I drink gimlets. No, I don't care what you think.
author: matthew r.

description:
Right about this time 4 years ago, I was in studying abroad in Belgium living out my wanna-be bohemian lifestyle.  I explored France, Germany, Denmark and Poland.  I descended into dark catacombesque taverns with dungeonous corridors rewarded with a funk-band stage at the dead-end.   

Whenever I walk into Cigar Bar, I am slapped with the sensation that I am thousands of miles away from reality.  My job, my home, my responsibilities are hung up on a hook for a few hours as I sip mojitos by the courtyard fountain or as I pretend like I can play pool. The ceilings are low and the ambiance is dark.  The space is intimate enough, but still had enough nooks to go exploring and move around.  The appetizers are tasty and affordable. 

Hanna S. and I used to come here every Friday when we first began working after college.  I suppose this bar is crawling with memories and memories to be made.
author: Kerry D.

description:
3.5 really.

I can't quite go as far as to say "Yay! I'm a fan!" since I doubt it would be a regular haunt even if I lived in the area so I guess A-OK will do. But it's a bit better than A-OK. At least the night I went. 

This place isn't what you think of when you think "cigar bar". As in it isn't plush chairs & dark wood & old men talking about The War. It's nice in a "we have a large tiled floor like a nice taqueria and we have a gigantic patio so you can smoke your cigars outside." way.  Which is really nice and would even nicer on a warm night.

When I came they had a fairly eclectic band playing, in that they went from reggae to salsa in a set.  They also have blue moon & make a decent vodka collins at a decent price which always makes me happy. Overall it was a good night, a cool place and I'd be happy to go back. Hell I got digits! From two girls but whatever! I need more friends with bewbies.
author: Alexis B.

description:
This is totally the kind of place I'm afraid to tell my friends I absolutely LOVE. LOVE the live latin music, LOVE the huge $8 glasses of decent wine. LOVE the mostly-male bar population. LOVE the mingling of striped shirts, leatherface cougars, and barely-legal drunky girls. LOVE the door man with that sexy, sexy accent and tight...never mind. LOVE the patio/atrium in the middle with the fountain and steps and free-for-all of smokers and boozers. Cigar Bar takes all kinds. And it's far more civilized and sophisticated than other spots in North Beach that tend to draw similar crowds. 

I do NOT LOVE the sight of my adorable man with his head in his hands because the volume is so outrageously high and the patio is insanely crowded and claustrophobic. I do NOT LOVE lengthy waits at the bar. Minus one star.

Alias R and I are heading back for a Cougars-in-Training, Girls Only night soon. Just be warned that if your friends like to get drunk and pass out, there's a hike up a short flight of stairs to get them to the sidewalk. Once you get them there, it can be hard to find a cab to deposit them in :)
author: Autumn K.

description:
Flashback to two years ago: 

Scene:  The Cigar Bar
Occasion: Friend's Birthday
Cast: College Guy Friends, their gf's and myself.

Act I: I arrive to the party

Guy Friends: JAY!!!!  Hey!!!!  TAKE A SHOT!!!
Me: Okay okay....tequila right?  Patron Silver.

Fast Forward Three Hours:
Guy Friends: JAY!!  HEY GIRL!!  ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOTS!!
Me: FUCK YEAH BITCHES!!!  SHOT NUMBER 8!! PATRON SILVER  WITH A VODKA SODA CHASER!!!

(so you know how you get drunk and your voice gets louder?)

(AND do you ALSO know how you get hella drunk and your inner voice becomes your outer voice?)

Act II: I leave the party

Birthday Boy: Hey Jay...girl. Thanks for coming.  YOU'RE THE BEST!!!  I'M FUCKING DRUUUNNNNNNKKKK!!!
Me: Happy birthday HONEY!!!!!  YOU KNOW I LOVE YOU, HOMIE!!!  YOU KNOW WHAT?  YOU'RE CUTE...IF I WASN'T YOU'RE FRIEND I'LL TOTALLY SLEEP WITH YOU!!
Other Guy Friends: Jay!!!  AHAHAHAH...you drunk bitch!!!
Me: I DON'T GIVE A FUCK!!!

Present Day:

Scene:  The Cigar Bar
Occasion: Friend's Birthday
Cast: College Guy Friends, their gf's and myself

Act I: I arrive at the party.

Guy Friends: Jay!!  Hey!!! Take a shot!!
Me: Okay okay...tequila right?  Patron Silver.

One Hour later I leave...I have learned in my age to step away from the embarrassment before it happens.  Any longer than an hour with those boys at Cigar Bar and I'm a flippin' DRUNK ASS DUMB SHIT!!!
author: Jay H.

description:
The location of my friend's weekly Puff and Sip outings, today it was the site of his engagement party.  My first time here.  Great bar in the front room, pool table room, band/dancing area, fantastic patio area, and then various side rooms.  A fun time had by all - especially when Porkchop Express (the band of another friend of ours) played for almost an hour.

Apparently, this place is a restaurant too - and it already sold me when I saw they have mac & cheese on the menu.  Now I have to go back.  Soon.
author: Denise M.

description:
Walk in with a tid bit of knowledge before lighting up. 

Even though I don't smoke them, I like to observe. So, you 20 somethings with your suits so nice, listen up... Proper etiquette for a "stinky" stogie; remove the band after approximately 12 puffs (should already be on it's way off from the heat). The reason to keep it on is to prevent the tobacco from tearing before it heats up. Now enjoy and savor the stogie, but do not inhale! Now to order the appropriate cocktail; With cigar in one hand and a glass of port, cognac, bourbon/scotch, or wine (preferably Cabarnet Sauvignon or Mourvedre) in the other. Before you know it, you'll be a stinky cigar pro, chatting up Castro talk.

All in all as a lady, I love this place for some quality people watching and good conversation. There is a great outdoor patio and all around pure scene. 

Cheers!
author: Dee C.

description:
My friends and I came here on a Friday evening for happy hour. The courtyard is very beautiful. Could be a nice date place on a warm day. However, there was a large group of very vocal people celebrating birthday when we were there. Very very loud. 

Good: Several nice brandy options to choose from. Extensive drink options.

Bad: Food is mediocre and ridiculously expensive. Who charges $25 for quesedillas? (Happy hour prices are much more reasonable. $2 garlic fries and $10 quesedillas.) 

Overall: It's a nice enough place. The outdoor courtyard is a plus, especially if you want to smoke while you drink. The inside decor has low ceiling, tables, dim lighting, natural wood beams on the ceiling. It gets loud, so carrying on a conversation might be a bit difficult. There are some nooks and crannies away from the bar where it's less crowded.
author: Su K.

description:
Not interested in going back to this could-be-classy place in the seediest part of SF after last Saturday night - Sad to say that it was the clientelle rather than the biz itself that's to blame for that....

The inside area/bar itself was an annoying scene- felt like a Private party during Fraturnity rush week. Drunk Marina kids in polos, and tipsy gals in awkward stillettos, pretend-Salsa dancing to authentic Cuban music... which,sadly has to end each night before 12:30am, which pisses all the drunkies off (but keeps complaining neighbors at bay). 

They need to get a sound system-- the musicians have to set-up and break-down thier own sound... not very professional AT ALL, espcially considering the fact that the line is 1 block long and there's a substantial cover charge.

Great, friendly, staff.  The back area is cool, with an verflowing fountain and outdoor seating area, a back room with nice, comfy over-stuffed couches, and the smell of burningcigars in the air.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Let me put it to you this way.
The last time I was as drunk as I was at Cigar Bar, was when I was 16 years old and chugged a bottle of Johnnie Walker Black when a fellow student at my high school dared me to do it after saying NO GIRL could do it.  LOSER, I'd bet he's homeless by now.  

(Alright, so there just might have been one, two, or ninety-four other times, but there was no dare involved, which doesn't make for a very interesting review.... OK?)

Now,  I am the worst nightmare of the women's lib movement, but gimme a break.  If that 16 year old could do it, male or female, then I can do it, simply based on sheer will.
I was right.
I did it alright.....
Suffice to say that my parents grounded me not for one month, but for three months.  THREE.  Put a real dent in my social life.

Well - - forward almost 20 years and there I was at Cigar Bar.

What a cool, cool place!!!!
Indoor bar area with bar seating and some tables - - outdoor patio area with lots more tables and cigar smoking allowed.  Now, I do not smoke cigars, but totally believe people should be allowed to smoke them if they should so choose......... just don't blow it in my hair now.  Please.

Various people were here, and I know this because I entered completely, stone-cold sober.

I drank with two friends here, starting off with my basic "Sapphire and Tonic."  I do not know how many I had.  I don't care to remember because I will never drink that evil liquid again.  

That said, what I do remember of those drinks were that they were STRONG and served in tall glasses with 2 straws.  Two straws means.... double the pace of drinking.  Right?

Believe me - - that's right.


I will DEFINITELY be back to this place.
Whether or not they will actually let me in remains to be seen.... those guy friends of mine are prone to exaggeration.  :-)  


PS - No Mojitos here... but then I guess it is kind of a "foo-foo" drink to have asked for, in hindsight.  I mean, it is a - (gasp) - CIGAR bar.... for the real men.  (whatever)  But, they have Macallan 18 for those of you who love Scotch, the manly man drink!!
***************
Edited to add:
Twice now, someone has pointed out that Cigar Bar does indeed have Mojitos... and one claims it's the best Mojito too.  I stand  corrected.  All I know is my friend asked me what I wanted to drink and I said Mojitos... he went, asked, came back and said, "No Mojitos.  What else ya want?"  So I thought... no mojitos here.  My bad!
author: Grace K.

description:
I've been to The Cigar Bar & Grill many times in the past and have not gotten around to writing a review for them. Maybe there was nothing note worthy before? Whatever the case may be, last weekend has provoked me to write a glowing review for them.

 My roommate hosted a rather large gathering here and I had a fantastic time. We had the back room where the pool table lives - everyone socialized, drank and played pool. There was live music and dancing in the room next to us and everyone seemed to have really great energy! The Cigar Bar was a great host. They stalked us up on wine and glasses and from what I can tell, were very attentive. "Good jobs" are deserved all around; especially to my roommate who chose such a perfect venue.
author: Julia N.

description: Very few places in the bay area offer stogies with your drinks. This is a nice place to go and relax. Drinks are pretty standard and the cigar selection is catered more for the masses.
author: Huy T.

description: Skip the food. The cigar selection is limited at best and the drinks are overpriced. The music is usually great and there's always a good crowd. The outdoor patio area and water features are a nice touch. Just be careful around the center fountain as it is not very high off the ground and I nearly stepped in it while enjoying a beer.
author: Matt J.

description: No wheelchair access, so I can't even say whether or not this place was cool. I can definitely tell you it wasn't cool to go all the way there and not be able to get in. Super fail.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I went here with Busty W. for happy hour specifically because John G. said they had delightful mojitos.  Imagine my irritation when I ordered a mojito and the waitress said, "Ooohhh, yeah, sorry about that.  In the entire time I've worked here, we've never been out of mint, but...."  Look, I think this makes this much, much worse.  I don't need to know that the first time I came to your restaurant, specifically to order one thing, for the first time in the history of the restaurant, it is currently unavailable.  Kind of reminiscent of hearing, "Baby, I swear, this NEVER happens to me, I must be tired/drunk/nervous."  

Otherwise, everything was fine - fine atmosphere, fine chips & salsa & guac, fine vodka-sodas.  

Gas rating: 5
Yeah, not getting a mojito, and being reminded of less-than-fulfilling sexual experiences gives me gas.
author: Soo C.

description:
Another winner for Happy Hour.

I usually pass by this place on my way to Bubble Lounge on friday or saturday nights and it's packed.  I wonder why now, but it's apparent that if it's packing on the late hours, it's gotta be even better during happy hour.  And what other place in the city has the specialty and freedom to smoke and NOT inhale (like some people) on a cigar.   

We got some bites, some shots, and a few beers during the special.  I find it amazing when some of the crowds are absolutely dumbfounded when they see us kick back a few shots.  When they make their face cringe, it makes me feel bad for them.  But wait, I thought I was taking the shot.  

Anyways, the main thing to get here is a few orders of the fries.  The fries are amazing.  It's like a cross between McDonald fries and In and Out, so you can imagine the greatness concealed in each individual fry.  And for only 2 bucks a pop, get yourself an order per couple.  We also had the quesadilla for half off which although normally shouldn't cost $25, it's gratifying to pay half for it.  

I can imagine coming here on Friday and just staying in the area until Bubble Lounge....what a night that will be.
author: Vincent K.

description:
This place rocks. Or should I say, it Salsa's. Got there after 9:30 pm and there is a cover charge of I think it was $7.00. From the moment you get there you feel like you re in Miami. The place is not big inside, however they have a patio that is huge and a few spaces with sofas coffee tables and Plasmas. 

The drinks were good. Not stiff, but not expensive either. I mean 6 bucks for a rum and coke is not bad. They have a pool table that looks like fun but it was packed. It is a a sausage factory but as the band starts playing the girls start coming in. If you got moves you will move up the line with the women. Not many male dancers there so the women are looking for a partner to shake the boottee... 

Net Net, the place is fkn cool even if you don't smoke cigars. The band last night played awesome and the Trombone and Conga players was incredible. 

We wanted to eat some apps, but the kitchen was closed. Need to try it again for the food. 

Will do again...
author: Alex V.

description:
Sorry to  those that rated from the ole read but this is the remix.  It is 3:43am and just got back from what i thought b4 was a 4 star...but from tonite a definitive 5.  Apologies if i misspell still pretty hammered in bed now.  so this dude was supposedly flown in from cuba to rock the party tonight and he did...along with thw raw band and live crowd.  it wasn't even 11pm yet and the dancefloor was thumping and of course i was in there.

this incredibly sexy woman came up to me while i was dancing with the crowd...remember i think i know how to dance..oh no.  i don't know shit.  Rebecca rocked my world, i was sweating like a pig by how fast she danced and afterwards i felt i could honestly say i have an idea about how to salsa...damn lovely i must say.  

the night is not over yet.  i then tried to find my salsa teacher, but instead met a pretty lady named Jackie and though i didn't notice from the music , she explained...this is merengue .  whoah did i learn fast.  both women contributed to what i must say is one of the most fascinating evenings of dancing i have ever experienced.  Thanks to both of you if you hear me.  I am forever humbled in what i thought i did know.  Wow, what a night.
author: omar b.

description:
I've been wanting to come here because it gives me the excuse to smoke a cigar while drinking. After a lovely dinner with my friends we come to cigar bar. The cover is $7 which is no big deal but I would expect at LEAST a pleasant night, well the bartender ruin my taste for this place and I would NEVER recommend anyone to come here. 

We approached the bar to order and the girl with short black hair is already filled with rudeness. WHAT???? WHAT DO YOU WANT??? The bar isn't packed and the music isn't blasting WHY THE HELL ARE YOU SCREAMING?? My friend want Kir, she asked WHAT?? WHAT KIND?? She repeats just plain Kir. The bartender rolls her yes. I asked for sparkling brut she THROWS me the menu so I can tell her the vintage. There is only ONE sparkling brut!!!!!!!

When she tallied up the bill she forgot what we ordered and told us with attitude. WHAT is it you ordered, I need to know NOW. What the bloody fucking hell, do you have amnesia?? It was less than 5 mins ago and you are talking to us like it's my problem. We told her what we ordered and she said NO there is more. What the fuck?? My ULTIMATE goal in life was to come to Cigar Bar so I can LIE about paying for a drink (extremely sarcastic tone) 

I took the change and left 50 cents which I wanted to throw in her face. I later regretted leaving the 50 cents because I could use them to for the parking meters.

Why come here when there is so many bars with much friendlier service, same price range and only a hop skip and away. 

SKIP IT.
author: elizabeth o.

description:
I gotta -1 star for the cover. Why would a BAR charge a $7 cover?!?! thats just ridiculous!!

But the mohitos here are delicious and they will get you in the end.

Also I feel that the crowd is a bit more mature and classy (not EVERYONE but the gist of it) than the other people who frequent the broadway street avenue on weekends

I liked the courtyard area too. I hate the smell of cigars but what can I do. I am at cigar bar
author: Em F.

description:
Cigar Bar is a wonderful place to for some great salsa on the weekends.  The cover is  $7 but in my opinion is almost always worth it!  They provide great local bands with lots of  flavor!  The drinks are pretty good, some bartenders make them better and more stiff than others... overall they're pretty good.  Also, for those of you on a budget, they have a drink called the island rum which is very good for $5.


I have never had the food here but I've heard good things about it..  All in all,  this place is great for off the hook music and although the dance floor is small it's always a great time.  

An extra bonus is the huge patio where you can smoke either cigars or cigarettes or just chill out on a hot night.
author: Michi R.

description:
I had a great time at the Cigar Bar this Saturday.  The Sangria was surprisingly good and the 30 -something crowd was not pretentious and kinda laid back. 

The Salsa band was great - even the DJ who spins in between sets was really good too!  

For nice salsa music without the "hardcore-ness" of Roccapulco or Cocomo, this is the place to go!
author: Clarice V.

description:
Attention: To all guys that want to meet the ladies. Here is your chance. Learn some basic salsa moves (or just fake it) and ask her to dance. 

She will probably say yes... 

It's def weird when someone approaches you and wants to bump and grind. Sometimes repulsive. But salsa? Nahh...very casual and fun and the vibe here is perfect. 

Cigar Bar is intimate, classy and distributes a sexy energy all around. You can even check out the scene from the street and look into the outside patio area if you're coming from Bubble Lounge or Kells next door.
author: Charlene A.

description:
snobbery at 11pm* entrance wait extreme....bridery thinking needed....or trickery of "special guest"....unbearably long standstill statues....robbery of $seven cover....lengthy wait experienced....rarity in today's stigma...cigar bar existence...packed inside and out....bar convenience once downstairs first sight....averaging ten minute waits to order...heavy pours for shots and straight-up....small glass weaker pours for cocktails....finding late night drinking not pleasing....

*after dinner hours scene......
author: Hen A.

description:
When a group of my friends wanted to drink and smoke exceptionally good cigars, CB was the first place I thought of and I hoped that my last outing here was just a fluke.

We arrived and within 1 min. of walking in, we were seated outside. This time around the service was awesome and she attended to us even as the masses began to arrive. Was even patient enough since I was being indecisive about what drink I wanted.

Of course I chowed down on the chips and calamari, no wait 2 orders of calamari. Hey when I like something, I like something alright. To wash it all down I had the pear-ginger cooler (grey goose pear and ginger syrup), lavender gimlet (ketel one and lavender sugar) and a damn good Manhattan (thanks mr. bartender!) Since this is a cigar bar, the other half and the gang brought their own cigars and bought some there as well. Romeo y Julieta, Montecristo, and Eileen's Dream (my sweet tooth cigar) are my favs.

Why a five star from a two star? Because not only was this outing a reminiscence of my past ones before the latter but Matt, the manager, read my previous review and apologized for the service I received. Caring for your patrons' experience makes a place that much better.
author: Lola L.

description:
The place was pretty big - huge court yard for smoke, back room with sofa and TV, another back room with pool table, middle dance floor and front bar section. 
We went for Latin music and it was excellent. Very live music. Lots of cute girls and pretty good amount of cute guys.

Only the reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is they can smoke in the back room with sofa. I don't smoke and cigar stinks so if they all can smoke in the court yard only, it will bump up to 5 stars.

We met cute guys and bartender was cute. We all danced and had great fun. It just I am not good at learning steps of Salsa and get tired of trying hard at the end of the night. 
I just want to dance!

A~nyway, it's cool place.
author: Green Mango Y.

description: Busy place, but the bartenders were really attentive, responsive, and made extremely tasty drinks astonishingly quickly considering the crowd.
author: Megan L.

description:
This place was wonderful!!!!! I absolutely love this place, the ambiance the music the fast bar service and the fact that the bar tenders not only make a fabulous drink but they make sure no one pouts drink on your tab:) They asked my BF if it was okay if the tall girl with the long dark hair could put drink on his tab......
The dance floor is fun fun fun...everyone is dancing!!!!....I danced the salsa with BF like we were on dancing with the stars with no judges........we then shared a cigar cause we were at the CIGAR Bar but it was kinda yucky and expensive and I woke up with a sore throat. I still love this place and would do nothing different except come earlier and stay later:)
author: Setareh N.

description:
I hardly ever venture out of the Mission and Castro, but we came here to celebrate Mama J.'s 30th bday.  The live salsa band was incredible and played some awesome tunes --some even sounded bossa nova and/or tropicalia-ish, but maybe I was just drunk.   Props to them for having a spacious outdoor area.

Overall, very worth going to north beach for.  Nice choice, Justine!
author: Sid D.

description:
The bartender loved me for awhile.  He wanted to show me the ice room.  I declined, but thanks for the free drinks.

Great mojitos, great wine and beer selection.  I heart cigars and I really heart, heart, heart the outside patio area with heating lamps and smokers.  Oh, and the salsa band is pretty fantasmical.

One of my favorite bars in SF.
author: Christina S.

description:
I walk by this place everyday on my way home. I have stopped in a few times to grab a beer and have ordered some food on occasion. The food was a pleasant surprise. I got some fish tacos and chips and guac and it was actually really tasty for bar food. 
I got a cigar here once. I know nothing about them other than how to light them and make a mess with the cutter. I don't know why i ever think it's a good idea to smoke these cat turds. They have a magical quality of making a hangover out of 3 beers and i love the sensation of a sweater on my tongue the next morning. Maybe it's just me but i feel like i have cigar on my breath for the next 3 days. It's not the Cigar Bars fault I'm an idiot and smoked it. I just took a star off because of the weekend crowd and the fact that they charge a cover. come on now.
author: Stephen K.

description:
My 3 loves in one place...food, alcohol and smokes.  What more can a girl ask for.  This time coming here we opted for the inside as I had to learn the hard way that I am indeed allergic to cigar smoke.  I know I couldn't believe it myself.  I freaking love the smell of cigars but don't think I like the fact my eyes get puffy and swollen from that.  I'll still come back here though...maybe with a mask.  

The food here is not bad.  Your bar food with very nice presentation.  We ordered the combo plate came with quesadillas, chicken wings, calamari and fries and ceviche.  Thursday they actuall ran out of calamari and ceviche so they substituted it with bruschetta.  It was good and even nicer that it was on the house.
