The ceviche is good and I do love the calamari so next time hopefully they have it the next time.  

They also had salsa that night what a plus.  I even went out for a spin after a few glasses of wine.
author: Allison T.

description: Awful customer service. The staff is rude and unresponsive.
author: Kelli Z.

description:
I went here for a private event during a warm summer evening and loved it. 

The bar is rustic and they have a wonderful outdoor courtyard, where you can either have drinks or smoke a cigar. I am not a smoker in any way, but after this place, I have really learned to appreciate the smell of cigars.

I haven't tried the food here, but I have tried the drinks, and they have a nice selection and a FULL BAR. IF you want a mixed drink, a beer, or a cognac for your cigar, they have it here.

It is in a great spot, near Bix and the Bubble Lounge. Parking is bad, my first word of advice. This would be a great spot for an afterwork outing or an evening night cap.

Enjoy!
author: Christopher W.

description:
As I end a work week and seek to kick back with a drink, I'd like to think of this bar as a safe haven from the Marina's of the world. Sadly, the Marina people seem to have an outpost at Cigar Bar. 

I went here Friday for maybe the third or fourth time, and I have to say the atmosphere changes from early Friday happy hour to later Friday night or Saturday night. During happy hour time it was busy, but not overloaded. And it was easy to get a drink...but this wasn't a good thing. The two mojitos I had were not too sweet and overly minty/bitter, respectively. When I came for evening dancing and drinks and cigars, that's when this place performs a bit better. Salsa dancing is really fun here since everyone generally sucks at it and the cigars make you really feel like an adult. But the drinks still are mediocre at best and having to pay a cover is a bit annoying.

The crowd is, as you'd expect, the people who have more class and energy than those at Royal Exchange, but who aren't as fake as the Matrix Fillmore folks. 

Despite all of my whining, this place has a great location and if you catch the evening sunshine, it's a warm, soothing way to end a long week.
author: Aaron F.

description:
A $7 cover before 10 o'clock for a friends private bday bash in the back room?!  That to me is just tacky and greedy.  Get over yourself Cigar Bar.   Keep that up and you will have fewer and fewer customers.

I will leave it at 2 stars for the good bartenders and the great salsa music.
author: Amanda P.

description:
HORRIBLE.  I'd give 1 star if I could.  Tried to book a private party - no one got back to me for 2 weeks.  Then they told me that we couldn't have it there.  We've had at least 5 large events there in the last year or so, and we can be sure that no one is coming back.

DON"T GO THERE IF YOU EXPECT ANY SORT OF CUSTOMER SERVICE.
author: Serena Y.

description:
Cigar Bar is fun, even though I do not smoke the cee-gars. Here is what I like about this place:
1. Good drinks- and they are strong! The $5 secret recipe punch is also a total deal.
2. I didn't have to pay cover! Woo hoo! Thank you miniskirt!
3. I like the chairs on the patio. They are that kind like in the Van Gogh painting? Very classy.
4. The Latin lovah salsa vultures are just the right amount of sleazy. Also I like that I am taller than all of them!
5. I like that there are lots of different energy levels throughout the place. Busy in the bar, spicy in the salsa room, chatty on the patio.

One complaint- the clientele can be a little amateurish, and following from this I think that the bartenders only make OK tips. They're not too speedy- a fat tip on your first round would probably be quite motivating!
author: Katie H.

description: Came here to start my night out with friends. Wish we could have stayed longer cause it was off and poppin when we left. The band started off with the Celia Cruz hit Carnaval. The crowd was lookin good, very diverse which I love. There was a geriatric crowd representing. They were gettin down though. The drinks and food were good. Get there early if you want a table. Someone said on their review that this place was huge. It's not. It's several different small rooms with low ceilings but definetly not huge. This place gets packed like sardines so double up on your deodorant and hope others do as well.
author: Lauren N.

description: What a fun place! Went here last night with friends and just had the best time. You can buy cigars and smoke them out in there patio area. It still feels like you are inside which is nice. They have heaters and tables.
author: Jessica W.

description:
I just have to say, when you're ditching a bad date and meeting the girls for an emergency ego boost...this is the place to go.

Yeah, I know, it was already soooo over years ago...but after a recent Friday night smackdown (don't you worry girls--I was the smacker) nothing was more superbly suited for my soul than a bout of Salsa with some delectable Spanish men.

Does it hurt that I enjoy the occasional smoke with my cocktail?  Certainly not.  How about my dance-like-a-white-girl moves?  Hidden by the (rather) crammed dance floor and eased by the guiding hands of some fantastic dance partners.

The bartenders were efficient and engaging, while the bouncer let my friend and I sneak by for half the price (Not like the $7.00 cover charge would set anyone back!)

For a North Beach joint, this place has certainly earned its stars!
author: Kat P.

description:
If you don't like cigarette smoke, you probably will not like it here.  Having said that, I do not like cigarette smoke but this place wasn't bad.   

So the space is pretty cool and laid back and I especially liked the court yard area.  The smallish dance floor served its purpose for letting folks move about to the live music.  The crowd itself seemed pretty cool probably late 20's to 30 something.  I liked it but as a non smoker I can see how others may not!
author: andrew c.

description: Per the obvious name, be prepared for smoke when attending this place.  Smokiness aside, a really great bar with a classy atmosphere and gorgeous outdoor patio. Expect a cover charge on weekends. Would definitely recommend for a more calm and classy night out.
author: Bridget B.

description: This is probably one of the most cigar friendly venues in the City. The staff is friendly, but in need of a little more help behind the bar. Happy hour is a bit cramped. Location and a casual setting make this an easy place to light up.
author: Michael G.

description:
OMG, a salsa venue I don't know about?? What's up with that?

So, I went with my friends on Saturday nite for some drinks and was surprized to hear salsa beats and folks dancing up a storm! 

I didn't wear my salsa shoes so I was not in the best dancing attire but, I still managed to find a fantastic salsa dance partner for two dances and had a great time the rest of the evening with my friends (none of whom salsa). 

The band was great! Mojito's were good! The vibe of the place is hip, cool, friendly and energitic with the great music....

Attention ladies...there seemed to be a good population of cute guys at this place. ;)    [just looking out for y'all]
author: Kristina A.

description:
We went there on a Saturday night around 12 midnight, waited around 30 mins outside, the line was moving slowly, maybe seemed even slower with the San Fransisco's city crazy chilly summer weather.

The bar was packed, the crowd was decent.  The layout of inside was good, with a back yard where people would smoke away their cigars, along with heaters all over the place, it wasn't as cold as i expected.
The drink was just so-so, my gin and tonic tasted more like a soda pop than anything else, my friend's champagne was good enough with cigar.
First timer for smoking cigar, I can't say i enjoyed it, but it was a good experience.
Then we moved to the dance floor, not used to that type of music I had absolutely no idea what I was doing, except moving my hips like a stiff zombie, not hot at all, i felt bad for my dance partner.

It is a nice place to show out-towners, easily one of the nightlife hotspots in the city.
author: Ting R.

description:
Let me start off with my only complaint: a bit too hot inside and a bit too cold outside.  But once you can find a happy medium (i.e. heat lamps or on the periphery of the dance floor), Cigar Bar is a great destination.  

The place is alive and glowing, as if they are making up for the rest of the dull financial district.  The crowd is an unpretentious, eclectic mix of people just wanting to enjoy life.

A little bit of latin america in the financial district. beautiful concept.
author: Zuzzi E.

description:
Full disclosure: one of the owners is a friend and our corporate attorney.  There's two descriptions I never thought I'd use in the same sentence about the same person.  Anyway I had been here a couple times for small after work celebrations of one sort or another and they have a great bar.  They pay attention to little details in their cocktails - like the cherries in their manhattans are really tasy bings - not those nasty candied ones.  On these visits the drinks were good and I noticed a very well made guacamole but never really thought of it as a restaurant.

So it comes time to plan our holiday party and it gets turfed to me.  I have 4 or 5 restaurants put together proposals for me and throw in Cigar Bar & Grill too becuase I know my boss will ask me why they aren't a contender.

The food and beverage manager sent me menus and wine lists and I had never tasted any of their food other than the guacamole but my friend tells me they have a really great kitchen now.   So we put together a menu heavy on passed appetizers and a hot buffet aimed at pleasing vegetarians as well as omnivores and decide to book even though I'm thinking we can get better food at my first choice.

Well they did a great job.  The crab cakes with remoulade were excellent as were these fried polenta deals with, as I recall, cherry peppers and gorgonzola.  Also very good was the ceviche along with hard to screw up standards like procuitto and melon and smoked salmon on cucumber slices.  The buffet was perfectly grilled marinated skirt steak and a vegetarian dish they whipped up for the occasion.  When they found out I had one vegan in my party of 50, the chef prepared a special meal that Mark said was great.

Once again the cocktails were expertly prepared and the wines we selected excellent and reasonably priced.  We came in under budget even though no one left remotely hungry and probably not sober.   

This is a great little place.  Nice to have the outdoor courtyard for a cigar, great cocktails, well conceived wine list and really nicely prepared food. Live music too - latin jazz the night we were there.   I'd plan another event there in a second.  4 stars only to prove it isn't some kind of corporate nepotism.
author: Jon R.

description:
Real nice place! Very good ambiance, nice music and great mojitos. A fun place to hang out with friends and have a good time.

Excellent place!
author: Sandeep A.

description:
I finally made it to check out this place! I've heard great things; but somehow things just always came up when friends or coworkers had gatherings here.

The atmosphere here is amazing, in the sense that it's very laid back and yet also very energetic. There's a very broad range of people here, yuppies just off work for HH, moms n pops (and grandpas too) who want to enjoy some cigars and a good drink, artsy fartsy urbanites, and older executives who book up one of the rooms, the list just keeps going. I love that I would not feel out of place in either my work clothes or casual clothes, though I do not suggest coming here in clubbing clothes, not that kind of pregame spot.

I only tried a few things on the one page menu, the calamari and garlic fries. Very crispy and savory. Love the shoestring fries! And nicely breaded but not overly coated crusty calamari. Delish!

They had a special on the makers mark 46 for $8! Had to give that a try, or 3. By the time i went back for the 3rd, they were already out. Shucks. Went very well with the cigar (mild) I had. I'd recommend it.

The place itself is very nice. Takes you out of the city. Awesome that you have to walk down stairs to get to it. Fairly dim lighting when you walk in. To the right is the bar, to the left is the door to the patio seating area, straight ahead is the billiard room (which surprisingly is the most well lit area if you want that). We sat out on the patio so that we'd be able to smoke. Theres a fountain in the middle, and benches and tables all around. People are just sitting drinking smoking and dancing!! Very awesome. It was very relaxing to just sit there with the 46 in one hand, the cigar in the other, just listening to the salsa music and catching up with friends. Nice to just take it slow. And my friend who actually supplied the cigars (he runs primostogies.com, check it out, those cienfuegos are money and he'll steer you right if you're not sure what you want!) convinced me i must go to Europe though it didnt take much since I've already been dying to go to Sicily since two years back. I'd say this was a successful night. Except the morning after where my tongue and throat are burnt to a crisp. Such a newbie.
author: May Y.

description:
As you may have noticed, when left to my own devices I am perfectly content to prowl the more southerly and westerly realms of the city.  But occasionally, I'll get invited to the more happening part of town (a going-away party, in this case).  I suppose it's good to refresh (or is that confirm?) my stereotypes every once in a while.  

The Cigar Bar tries to do it all--historical architecture, a huge patio area, a live latin band with a dance floor, and plenty of back rooms for billiards or private parties.  And they serve food well into the night.  And, of course, there's the cigar case.  It's just too bad the drinks aren't as well-crafted as the ambience.  

Despite its large size (and the $7 cover we got slapped with for showing up after 10), this place was packed with more young, beautiful, rich(?) people than I usually see in a month, running the full length of the skanky-classy spectrum.  Made for a pretty fun scene, actually, except when you're trying to get a spot on the dance floor...or get a drink...or walk over to the restrooms...call me crazy, but oughtn't a cover charge buy you a little space?  File this place with Bruno's in my "never on Saturdays" list.
author: Wes M.

description:
The Cigar Bar & Grill is really a nice place to mingle and have a mojito also a cigar if your into cigars.
Live salsa bands on Friday & Saturdays are great! The dance floor is not that big but if you like good authentic salsa bands then this is the place to be.
author: Iris N.

description: Glad I tried this place. Try the chocolate lava cake with kahlua mixed with maker's bourban, excellent pair! Crowd was very mixed and friendly. Bartenders were very friendly and attentive. Great set up and a huge plus for the outside patio area. Will definitely be back.
author: Samantha C.

description:
"Cigars for Dinner?"

I'm not sure why we were seated in the outdoor area where the smoking was happened for dinner reservations...  I would've preferred to be seated inside for dinner so I wouldn't have to deal with the smoke.

Down to the food...

First Course:  Salad - The salad was pretty good...  Not sure what type of dressing they used but it tasted like a sweet balsamic vinaigrette.  It was just the dressing that did the trick on the mixed greens...

Second Course:  Potato Hash, Black Beans, and Rice - Potato Hash was under cooked; Could've been season better and cooked longer.  Black Beans were perfectly cooked but under seasoned.  Rice was just rice.

Third Course:  Pesto Pasta - Yes, this was what I was waiting for...  Something seasoned just right and the texture just felt like it was cooked right!  Definitely a must if coming here.

Main Course:  Tilapia - Lime salt with a creamy cheese sauce...  This definitely had a sour kick to it.  If you place the skin side down on your tough, you would definitely pucker.  But when eaten all together at once, it tasted much better.  The cheese sauce could've been toned down a little.

Entertainment:  They had a live band playing salsa music here.  Which I though was pretty cool...  If you like salsa, this is a pretty cool place to check out.
author: Phung N.

description:
A lot of people hear the name Cigar Bar and think that it is purely a smoking lounge, but its actually a bar that has an outside court area for those that want to smoke.    Inside the bar offers the non smokers a place to enjoy some cocktails and some pretty decent bar food without being subjected to second hand smoke.  For those that don't want to be out among the smokers there's the main bar area, a room with a pool table, and two other lounge type rooms with couches. 

The atmosphere is usually pretty lively the later the night gets as there's usually a live band playing and salsa dancing going on later in the evenings.  The crowd is usually pretty mixed as far as I can always remember.   There's usually anything from the corporate suits smoking cigars to the jeans and t-shirt crowd puffing on cigarettes, to the ladies who are there for the cocktails or to salsa dance.  

The courtyard is a nice place to enjoy a cigar and a $3 happy hour beer after a hard days work.  Their cigar selection isn't too broad, and the prices are marked up a bit, so I'd recommend bringing your own cigars if you plan on smoking.

This is one of my favorite places to come hang at out after work though as I always have a good time there.
author: Ed B.

description:
Some friends had a party here this weekend.  The food was good, the live music was fun but the dance floor is small, the cover was annoying (when you're there with a party? seriously? they already paid you $$!).  It just so happened to be an uncharacteristically San Francisco night when it was wonderfully warm, so we took full advantage of the outdoor courtyard.

This was my first time there but I'd certainly go back.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Got here at 5:30.  Got my first drink by 5:54.  And it's actually not even crowded. I wondered if it's because I'm a girl and I was alone, waiting for me friends...

Then one of my friends arrived, a big Mexican guy.  He was looking around for an extra chair and one of the patrons thought he was the busboy and asked him to clear the table for them.  Really??  Just because he's Mexican??  That's the kind of crowd this place draws.

Anyhoo, still giving it two stars because they have a great outdoor area and I love cigars.
author: Claire C.

description:
My boss took me last here last week for lunch. 

good stuff:
-the ambiance. we sat outside, and the spanish style patio is very swank. i felt hip just sitting there. 
-the menu. it all looked good.
-my samich. i am on weight watchers, but was happy to find a grilled chicken samich that didn't have much junk on it. it was only $10, including a side salad with a flavorful vinagrette.

bad stuff:
-the waitress was a lil nuts, geeking out when my boss asked her for cheese after his burger was brought out without any.
-the tables smelled like fresh paint.

i am willing to give this place another try.
author: Stacy S.

description:
Almost 10 years ago, I was first introduced to Cigar Bar by some of my friends in the advertising industry. This was their usual after work spot to go, get cuba libres or mojitos, smoke stogies and sit out in the courtyard on warm weekday afternoons.

A few years later one of my buddies and I decided to host a happy hour event here and everyone loved it. The staff is friendly and professional and I've never had a bad experience here.
author: John Eric S.

description:
I went to The Cigar Bar on a Thursday night for a friends birthday party. I loved the space. You walk down a few stairs to a patio area with a working fountain, tables and heat lamps. The patio is surrounded by a few smallish lounge rooms plus the main bar area which includes a pool room. 

The service was great.  We worked with Daniella the manager to make arrangements, and she was extremely helpful. We were able to bring our own cake with no extra fees, and once we arrived, the wait staff was very friendly and attentive. 

They have live music nightly and a humidor if you want to smoke a cigar, which we did. :)

Minus one star because the cocktails, while very strong, weren't very tasty. However, the appetizers were good.  Try thier  homemade chips and salsa.
author: Benita S.

description: Two words: Go here!  Ambience is great. Music is good. Whiskey selection for pairing with cigars is awesome.  Sitting on patio, smoking a good cigar, chatting with friends, people watching....it doesnt get any better then this.  I could do without the $7 cover (Sat night)...kind of annoying paying for cover...IMHO.  Anyways, this is definitely one place everyone should check out, smokers and nonsmokers alike.  Enjoy!
author: Darius D.

description:
seating may be hard... went on a tuesday and outside was nearly full.

nice warm feeling decor.
wish they had a bigger selection of cigars instead of a 4-5tier case. 
Maybe rename to "The Bar Grill with Cigars..." 

just had the regular manhattan, nicely done.
author: Miss J.

description:
The first time I found myself at Cigar Bar was a Friday night, about 4 years ago. It also happened to be the first time I met my boyfriend-at-the-time's best friend, who was a girl, like me. In between sips of delicious mojitos and caribbean rum drinks, she managed to corner me in the bathroom and give me the "if you break his heart, I'll kick your a*s" speech. She wound up never really liking me, but I was always left trying to figure out the name of the bar the cliched speech happened in so I could revisit the place under more pleasant circumstances. Ya, I never really liked her either.

Last night, I found myself once again at Cigar Bar, in one of those odd-ball, albeit more pleasant, moments... experiencing some serious bonding with my coworkers during the Thursday night, packed-to-the-britches, happy hour. Seems like every other young professional in the area had the same intentions. While the drinks were great, figuring out how to squish between the bar and the boys in wrinkled button-ups was a drag. We had to tackle the waitress, in a tag football kind of way, to order food. Let's not mention what we had to do to get silverware in order to eat the food once it actually got delivered to our table. 

If you get manage to look past the sardines-surrounded-by-cigar-smoke feeling (just drink a bit more), this is a pretty cool atmosphere, whether having warm, fuzzy moments with co-workers or trying to escape the boyfriend-best-friend conversation unscathed.
author: Meredith O.

description:
Don't let the name fool you...Cigar Bar is definitely a whole lot more than just a smoking lounge.  This is a great place to spend an evening on a date or with friends.  They have personal lounge areas that you can reserve for larger parties that have flat screen TV's and nice leather couches (they cater as well), or there is also a lounge outside for everyone to enjoy.  The beautiful Spanish-syle decor is complete with water fountains and heat lamps so you can enjoy your cigar outside and still be warm.

They also have live music!  This is a great place to get your Latin-groove and salsa on. ;)  The band is always really entertaining, and we are not talking about a small band, literally 10 friends in white linen pants (and they get into it!).  The crowd is very diverse...everything from the old couple who has been dancing la salsa for 20 years and is way better than you at it, to the  few Financial District guys who are always socially awkward but also fun to watch. LOL 

But seriously...

They also make one serious Mojito! ;)
author: Carlyna R.

description:
I've been to cigar bar twice. BOTH times I had an unfortunate cough and therefore wasn't drinking. I'm not factoring that into my review, because well, it's not their fault I get sick. 

1. Went for drinks with the ladies on a Friday. My friends are smokers and drinkers and dancers... fun to be had! They raved about the sangria and mojitos, we sat outside on the patio, went inside for salsa dancing now and again, had fun - UNTIL - this is also not their fault - we ran into a dirtbag ex of one of the ladies. We left. Had those stupid boys not been there, I think we would have stayed longer and had more fun. 

2. Last night we took a co-worker for a "bachelor" party there. Since it was mixed company we didn't feel like doing anything nasty, cigar bar seemed good. We appreciated the $4 special wine for $5, the chips and guac, actually the food was pretty good over all and not too pricey ($10-16 for entrees). We had lots of fun - call and reserve the smoking room and you get to sit in an open room, where it's a bit warmer and there is a couch!
author: Elsa E.

description: In town for a football game and ended up here. Place had a very nice vibe. Nice courtyard in the middle of the complex to hang out and talk, while you smoke a nice cigar. Drink prices were average for the city. The only down side I saw was that there was a cover charge to get in.
author: Minas K.

description: Came here for a very special b-day party last Sat..and when we arrive around 9:30 the place was kinda empty. There wasn't much ambiance but who cares about ambiance when you have a salsa band??!! Within 30 mins of our arrival..the place became jam packed..inside and out. It was a very eclectic and friendly crowd. Drinks were good and pretty quick service despite the crowd. Great venue for a party.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Stand outside and stink up your clothes with one of their finest stinkbombs.
Sure, I went here with some friends who think cigar smoking is cool.  It's a novelty that pretty much stinks up your coat.
The outside cement patio thing was packed full that night.  
Whatever.  Eh.
author: Kev M.

description:
Me likey.  Me likey a lot.

I tend to gravitate to the Cigar Bar a lot when hanging out with a group of friends in the city as CB has a GREAT outdoor patio, with a ton of tables and standing room (and since it's outdoors, needless to say, fresh air).  It also has a few little rooms that could be reserved for private parties, which a few friends have done on several occasions.  The food is pretty darn good here for bar food (i believe the guacamole was actually made from fresh avocados on the premises!) and they have a well stocked bar. 

My only ding to CB (1/2 star, so let's pretend we started with 5 1/2) is that they have GREAT salsa music and a salsa band, but the dance space is the tiny.  There are a ton of great dancers who come to CB to toss random open-minded patrons around the dance floor, whether they know how to salsa or not, but it's a very tight space on the dance floor.
author: Ria D.

description:
Tucked away where the Financial District eventually borders Little Italy and the fringes of North Beach, The Cigar Bar was a stop on my Friday night adventure. My first week of work finished off with a company party, plenty of champagne and a crew to wander out with.

We took over every corner of the bar before the sun went down, and it was the ideal place to continue a steady drinking pace and possibly order some of the delicious looking appetizers I saw being eaten. Finally I was hanging out with the guys who actually smoke cigars in places like this--if that's a good thing at all--and enjoying it even more than I did before.

I continued off into the sunset as I exited the brick-clad bar and headed north, toward the beach, very contented lighting a cigarette with a new box of matches from The Cigar Bar.
author: Ben W.

description: I've been here a couple of times and the service has been just ok.  I assume this is because its fairly crowded. However, my weakness for tender melt-in-your-mouth meat makes this a 3 star review as the beef short ribs were delicious.
author: Narayan E.

description:
I hate to pan this place after spending quite a fun happy hour there after work today, but here's the thing:  the place was fairly empty when I walked in, we were sitting right by the bar, and it took FOREVER to get another beer.  I sat there twice with an empty glass.  Maybe they were understaffed tonight, but the place wasn't packed, so I found the service a bit disappointing.  Also, they had very few beers on tap (seriously, I think there were three taps).  More were available in bottles, but that's not the same.

I didn't eat the food here, nor did I smoke a cigar, so I clearly didn't get the whole experience.  I don't know that it would have helped much, though, unless the food service was MUCH better than the beer refill service.
author: Andy G.

description:
Just started going here. and i love it. the bartenders are awesome, and food is great. (get the wings or the burger)
Its got this old world tavern feel, very cozy. I'll agree with everyone else, it is a older group. but from what i hear, its the place to find a cougar.

live music on Saturday, make sure you get there before 9, i think or is it 10? anyways, there is a cover after that. go for dinner and stay for great salsa music. 

oh yeah try the Hendricks margarita. its good!
author: Nate C.

description: I have been here at least a couple of times.  The food and drinks are very good and the noise level isn't too bad.  I love salsa nights so Sat. night is one of the best nights to go.  They extended the size of the club with a bigger room with the band and decent size dance floor.  Also depending on what you want to do, there are several rooms in the club.  A small room with a pool table, main bar, and 2 or 3 other cozy party rooms with couches, chairs, and tables.  Also if you smoke, the courtyard is the place to go there.  Nice architecture and nice place to go.
author: Ann R.

description:
If youre ok with, or can get over the horrendously noticeable Richie-White crowd, this place is actually pretty cool and has the ability to cater to most everyone's needs in a bar.

The very open Spanish Villa-esque set up has a kind of a calming, soothing effect, especially on warm-ish days for those FiDi Happy Hour goers.

Walking through the bar from front to back; there are several open areas to discover, which is fun when you get that exploratory fade on.

Theres a room adjacent to the bar area that is essentially open for whatever, but I have seen it reserved(at no cost!) for poker games, dinners, mini-banquets, etc.

Behind is a fairly concealed pool room, which is pretty rad if youre in one of those "i really just wanna shoot some pool" type of moods.

Next to the pool room is a private pary type lounge with couches, tv's, tables and everything needed to keep drunks entertained.

However...

The best part of Cigar Bar is the outside patio.  
I just really dig open-air spaces within bars(see: Zeitgeist, Bottom of the Hill, Tivoli-Savoy, Il Pirata, etc.)...fresh air does rule.


Youre not going to find drink specials here, and the appetizer menu is just adequate.  I DO want to note that a good friend of mine claims Cigar Bar makes "the best dirty martini in the city"...so if thats your thing, you might want to check it out.

Today is my last day at my current job(in the financial dist.) - and im going to Cigar Bar after work with co-workers and I definitely plan on getting faded -- probably the best description i can give.
author: Ryan R.

description:
I've been to Spain, and there bars are as diverse as ours..to categorize this place into being Spanish is only because of the Toro's on the wall...otherwise it's just a cool little place to hang out.

Had a surprise party here without reserving a room and pulled it off quite nicely. Our waitress was only attentive after I flagged her down with a very loud "excuse me"...and then at the end of the night she had enough balls to say she thinks she did a great job and should be tipped more...wow....she wasn't anything exciting but, I pulled out an extra 20 for her and that seemed to shut her up.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I definitely dig this place.  Went for "Happy Hour" (no real specials except for free chips and salsa) and it was fairly empty and stayed that way until about 7-8pm.  

Pretty good scotch and wine selection.  And they sell cigars to be smoked in the patio area.

Good atmosphere.  Seemed like a lot of young folk early on and then got the older suits later in the evening.  I'd go back, but probably only during the week.
author: Chris M.

description: Had the best time for my girlfriend's birthday. Food is fabulous!!  Music is fun!!  Lots of cute men!!  Great bday!!  Salsa dancing on Saturdays!!  Super good time!!
author: Deb T.

description:
Been going to the Cigar Bar for a few years now. Always enjoyed the Latin music and the indoor/outdoor arrangement. Although it was better when the band played outside, it's not that big of a deal.

The bartenders are always hustling no matter how busy it is and getting them to get you a cigar is not a hassle.

The first time I went to the Cigar Bar, I met Roberto Duran "bonus"!
author: Justin M.

description:
If you don't like cigarette smoke, you probably will not like it here.  Having said that, I do not like cigarette smoke but this place wasn't bad.  I know cigar afficianados want to choke me right now because I'm comparing the smell of cigarettes with cigars -- sorry! to the non-smoker it's all not very pleasant -- but I'm going to yelp my piece.  

So the space is pretty cute and I especially liked the patio area.  The smallish dance floor served its purpose for letting folks move about to the live music (next time a band with some horns instead of just a Casio would be nice).  And the crowd itself seemed pretty cool.  So why just three stars?  I guess I was expecting more because of the glowing reviews here.
author: Helen C.

description:
I went here on a Saturday night for a birthday celebration. I am also a big fan of salsa dancing so I was excited to see what the band was like. I don't like cigar smoke, but luckily it was raining that night so the doors to the outside, where the cigar smoking happens, were closed. I suggest if you don't like cigar smoke, don't go. 

So, what did I think? The drinks were awesome the music was awesome and the dancing was great too! It's a bit cramped at times but not in a bad way. It's on my list of fav places...perhaps it's cause I enjoyed dancing there so much...nothing like getting flung around the dance floor, doing salsa, to leave a good memory.
author: Cassy R.

description:
Okay that's strange, I haven't reviewed this place yet, even though I've been here more times than I can remember.

This place is great! Good drinks, decent prices (on drinks), pretty good crowd and good music.  Location is fantastic (not a crappy SOMA club).. after all, who doesn't like Jackson Square? Selection for appetizers and food isn't bad at all! Cheap for where this place is.

Occasional cover charge kinda sucks (considering that Bubble Lounge is 2 blocks down and free), but there are not many places in SF that offer the same style of venue.

BYOC (Bring Your Own Cigars) though, as they have a VERY limited selection of mundane cigars at a massive markup.

So yes, I like this place.
author: Serge S.

description:
I like the Cigar Bar for a few reasons:

1) They serve pretty good sangria
2) They have an outdoor area where you can drink the aforementioned sangria with a glass in one hand and a ciggy in the other
3) They bring in live music, salsa bands, etc.

Prices aren't cheap, and loser-face Screech look-alike hangs out here with his douchebag entourage, but otherwise, it's good quality fun.
author: Ava S.

description: Pretty decent food, nice staff, and good live Latin music.
author: Ann L.

description:
I love to salsa, or at least pretend that I can....The live music is awesome and the place is huge!

I don't smoke, but who am I to complain when the name of the place announces the agenda?

There is a lovely patio with a waterfountain set some ways into the middle and a few iron tables with chairs.  And viola, clouds of smoke.  But whatever.  The place is fun in a loud, "I'm Mexican today, Rancheros" kind of way.
author: Susan C.

description:
I've been to this lovely establishment once before and right then and there I fell in love with the place and even considered it my fave!  hehe The second time I went I had an even more fun time! =)

I love the whole decor of this place! It really brings out that Spanish vibe! With a live latin jazz and cigars by the cobble stone patio area you would think you were in some place in Spain! It's such a fun and lively place to be! The crowd is very diverse and once the band starts playing, the whole place gets even livelier! 

Expect a few people who should be on Dancing With The Stars start dancing around you! haha It's such a wonderful sight to see! I admit, I can be a bit intimidated, but once you see how friendly everyone is, you'd be on that dancefloor getting a lesson! 

The first time I went there none of my guy friends wanted to dance with me, so I was a bit bummed! But I still enjoyed the music and people! This time around, I was able to dance and it was definitely a fun experience! Some random guy pulled me onto the dancefloor and started dancing with me! Of course I was always able to play off the fact that I can dance to salsa in the past, but this time I was given a formal lesson! haha This guy was definitely a pro and he made me ease into the role quite easily! I admit, for my first time in REAL salsa dancing I was going beyond my overall experience! I was twirled and swirled and even got DIPPED that night! hahahahaa I thought that was cool! hehe I must say, my first formal dancing at salsa was majorly fun! And this time, one of my guy friends danced with me! hahaha Go figure!

The drinks are yummy and I must try the food next time I go! It's definitely a nice place to enjoy dining or dancing or just listening to live music! 

PROS: Live music, dancing, nice place for a date or group outing

CONS: Can get a bit crowded, parking is almost always hard to find! =(
author: Sharon M.

description:
A trip to the Cigar Bar is like a trip to Havana...I would imagine of course because I would NEVER go out of my way to fly to Mexico just to visit a communist country that only has fabulous beaches, illegal cigars, great music and Fidel Castro. That would potentially jeopardize my image as a proud citizen of the U-nited States. Something I would NEVER do.

This place also reminds me of Spain, a country where I actually have been: People smoking cigars and cigarettes in a little courtyard surrounding a cute little fountain.

Inside, there's an ass-shaking that would make the WASPiest person nervous - Buena Vista Social Club style. Luckily it's not pretentious, so white girls like me can hop in and shake what our mamas didn't give us.
author: Eli B.

description:
Fun spot. Nice pool table. Good afterwork crowd. 

I like that you can smoke in the outside courtyard, it must be awful for the businesses that operate on the first two floors of that building. 

Attentive cocktailers and a nice bourbon selection.
author: Sean K.

description:
ive been here a few times now.

always too crowded. 

always seems like tha same whitey douchey crowd.

left because it was too packed. 

line down the block to get in.
author: Euge L.

description: This is a cool chill spot.  Went here this past weekend to do some bar hopping and this was the first place we stopped at.  The bartender was really nice, drinks were good, they played live music, and the best part was the outside area. :)
author: Daniela R.

description: Really cute place. Decent drinks. Just wished they had some music playing earlier in the night. I would have made it a destination.!
author: E. Y. G.

description: I always have a good time at Cigar Bar. Good drinks, fun atmosphere and incredible people watching. Went last night with a bunch of my friends. Cover is $7 but the live salsa band is definitely worth it. It was really crowded since it was cold and rainy outside so few people were hanging out in the outdoor patio area. The crowd is a bit older compared to say Bubble Lounge down the street but definitely a better time.
author: Debbie C.

description:
Stong drinks were this place's saving grace. 

Don't go here unless you want to salsa dance or watch people over the age of 30 making out in plain view. Maybe in 10 years when I'm searching for a bar where the singletons my age are desperately trying to hold onto their youth I'll return and love it. 

Until then, 2 stars... and to the kissing couple looking to role play frat boy/sorority girl at a college party - you have jobs, get a goddamned room already. Or find a dark corner. Even frat boys and sorostitots find dark corners.
author: Lindsay D.

description:
I came here for happy hour with my gf and her mom hoping for some cheap drinks and some early apps before dinner.

The decor is Spanish style inside and the patio area tries to be that way too, but when you're courtyard is part of an 80's style brick building it just doesn't work. The fountains are a nice touch though.

The crowd can get a little douche like and/or wannabe ex dot com types trying to look cool while smoking a cigar, but in the end they look like they're trying to smoke some dudes pole instead. When you smoke a cigar it should be firmly pulled on and from time to time chewed, just like USMC Mechanic Sergeant Andy Micklin from Black Sheep Squadron.

The service can be hit and miss. Most of the time the server's don't now what food is available or what drinks are on special. Sometimes they don't know the pricing either. Anyways, we got a half price quesadilla platter for $10 and we ordered some sangria. The apps were ok and so were the drinks. Nothing to really write home about.

Guess I'll have to come here in the evening some time and see if it's any better.
author: Gary T.

description:
Love this place...and I don't even smoke cigars. Hells yah to fresh, yummy drinks and cool bartenders. By fresh, I mean freshly squeezed stuff. You know, limes in mojitos and gimlets, etc. The only other place that competes is Lions Den from what I can remember at the moment. Food...the sampler platter with calamari, quesadillas, ceviche and wings is pretty delicious and a hefty meal for a few people (I shared it with 2 other girls yesterday). If you want less variety, the wings and quesedillas are probably the way to go.

If you're looking for an unprententious, comfortable yet lively bar scene, check out Cigar Bar. With its inside and outside living rooms - I feel like it's home away from home (with much more yummy drinks).
author: Deann M.

description: The place has good food, but service get too slow during the busy friday evening. If you stick to the bar, you might get better luck. Oh, the cigar smell is strong, so might not be the best spot if you do not like thar cigar smell.
author: Wailin L.

description:
Pretty fun place to grab some happy hour drinks after work . . . . love the outdoor patio area that allows you to smoke and drink at the same time . . . they have outdoor heat lamps here, but IMO they need to turn them on more often.  There have definitely been some chilly days where I was starting to get uncomfortably cold and the heat lamps were all off

Decent cigar selection, although I prefer to bring my own.  they charge cover on the weekend, which is nice as it prevents the place from getting completely packed (nothing worse than getting a cigar/cigarette burn while you're trying to enjoy your evening).  wait at the bar can sometimes be interminable though.
author: Vicki Y.

description:
This place is AWESOME!  I randomly picked it as the dinner place for the monthly fraternity alumni dinner and was the best choice I could have made.  They had: great bar selection, a live band, cigars with an awesome corner couch for after meal smoking and very cool and down to earth staff.  To top all that, the band of the night was reggae.  Not much selection for food, so don't go there for an exquisite feast.  However, what they have they cook well.

And, the drinks are quite inexpensive.  What more do you want?
author: greg s.

description:
This is a new discovery for me, and what a fun discovery it is. I was here for a work party. We drank, we smoked, we hung out. It didn't even feel like the purpose of me being there was to network and shmooze. This is definitely a place I would come back to with friends. They have a bar, pool tables, large patio, and a sort of lounge area. Pretty everything a local hangout should have.

I wasn't to excited about the food, but I wouldn't let party platters be the end all of food here.

The patio is great, large, with plenty of tables and fountain. I can't wait to check this place out in the warm summer months. 

Parking is relatively easy in this area, especially if you cross Broadway.
author: Aubrey W.

description:
Yea this place rocks if your into:
Yuppies.
Smelling like smoke, really every room smells like stale smoke.
Treading through 5" of water to get to the bathroom.
And finally  below average food that gives you food poisoning.

Have Fun!
author: dorothy p.

description:
This is another one of my standards for happy hour with outside seating when the weather is nice. The inside, particularly at the bar, isn't bad either.

As long as you can sag chairs either at the bar or at a table outside then this place is very enjoyable. I've been here with groups and for some reason, I've been here more then once to have a "serious" conversation with a friend or BF. Something about crowded places makes me feel more comfortable to speak candidly.

Also, as per the name, they do sell cigars here so if you're into that then you'll like this place even more.
author: Jackie G.

description: MEMO TO FILE: Stay away from mixed drinks unless you like watered down cosmos, etc. Stay with beer. :) Diggin' the outdoor space around 7:30pm on a Saturday, scene was tame. By 9pm, the place was hoppin' with live Salsa music, women in tube dresses...outnumbered by spectating men. Bounced at 11:30pm. Suggest a shower to get cigar smell of self, unless of course, that's your bag.
author: Miles G.

description:
If you are into crowded meat market scenes that want to pretend they aren't at their usual meat market bars, you'll dig this.

Although I advocate cheap, drunken hookups, I don't like being in places where that is the primary reason to be there. With The Cigar Bar & Restaurant, I expected an entirely different scene (i.e., a chill lounge atmosphere where you can soak up a little gin, get behind some downtempo grooves, park your ass in a nice chair, etc.)

Was I ever so wrong.

Instead, it was packed with 20-something, Marina-ish guys and gals, all seemingly on the prowl, and definitely not into making a mellow scene or feelin' the jazz act.

I'm not sure if The Cigar Bar & Restaurant regularly features bands, because the setup is TERRIBLE for live music. There's maybe enough room for about 20 people to get in front of band and be able to hear them, both due to a lack of stage and a lame little PA system.
author: Derek R.

description:
Great bar with style and character!  There is plenty of room for the smokers and nonsmokers alike.  Great drink and a great crown hang out at this sweet treat of a hangout.  You can enjoy your smoke on the inside-outside patio.  It really is an inside-outside thing.  It seems so strange but cool never-the-less.  Play a game of pool in the back room after your smoke and while you drink.

I highly recommend this cool place!  And smoke em if you got em!
author: Scott A.

description:
I came here for my friend's bachelor's party.  It's quite a nice chill place and the enclosed outdoors patio is a great place to just sit, get some cocktails and have a cigar.  I had one of their Hendrick's Margarita, which was a great choice.  You could definitely taste the cucumber in the margarita.  It's a really fresh combination of tastes and I had to order another.  However, the second one wasn't quite as good and lacked the cucumber in the drink.  I'm knocking off a star for the inconsistency in the drinks.

Also, when walking in, there were no hosts to seat us.  Turns out that there are no reservations available, so making plans with larger groups could be a pain in the butt if you come on a busy night.  I would knock off another star, except they had a live band and the waitress was very nice. 

Overall, great place to hang out and lounge with friends.
author: Linh H.

description:
I've had some good times at this place. Even if you aren't into cigars this place has a good crowd. You can either sit at the bar counter or smoke outside at the tables. They do have drink specials and serve some very tastey foods.
 There is no smoking allowed anywhere inside the bar and they do have a humidor with an acute selection of cigars. You're also welcome to bring your own cigar as well. If you go on their website they have a calender of upcoming performances on certain nights. 

Light up (if you smoke cigars) and have a drink and relax.
author: C G.

description:
unfortunately we had eaten prior to getting here, so i don't know what the food is like. 

my mojito was perfection, however. and had i not been driving, i would have consumed more than one. 

but the atmosphere was so alive! there are distinct differences in the indoor bar area, the outside lounge area and the dance floor/bar where the live band plays.  whether you want to feel like you're in a classy crowded bar, bundle up outside, or show off your moves or watch someone else's on the dance floor, this place has you covered. 

i'm looking forward to my next trip to the city to actually try the food here!
author: Ren B.

description: First time coming here was impressive. I must admit I'm a young 30's guy and this place made me feel like it's a 40+ location. The crowds were ok. Drinks tasted great and the prices were ok. Everyone enjoying a cigar of course it's the Cigar Bar. The area was very clean, plenty of seating area. Also thanks for the enclosed area, the place felt very warm. Well of course everyone lighting up one, how can it not be warm?
author: Matt B.

description:
Stopped by here once, as a pit stop of sorts, on a Saturday night back in December for a friend's birthday. Didnt think it was all that crowded (im no in to places where i have to fight for breathing room) but it was.  
Still, I had a pretty good time. 

Soon as we headed down to the bar area we were able to get a bartender fairly easily. Im from LA and in my experience, with a bar that crowded, you have to choke a bitch to get the bartender's attention. You people are civilized, so that was completely unnecessary. The drinks we got were good, good enough to remember. I liked the primo mojito and the capirinha. I also got my standard rum and coke. They also have a huge selection of single-malt scotches, tequilas and rums. 
SInce there was a birthday in the group, we all did a chocolate cake shot. The bartender was accommodating and genuinely friendly. 

The patio situation was confusing. There were some reserved tables, some that weren't (and those tables were filled with people) and another ton of people just standing or finding any flat object to sit on. The ratio of cigar smokers to non-cigar smokers was tipped in favor of the non; so when we finally found a table to sit at and i lit up, i got a few angry glances. Sorry, but i wasn't about to move or put out my stick.

Some of the people i was with wanted to dance but there just wasnt any room for that, nor enough to see the salsa dancers. Lots of people ran into me, accidentally bumped into me and stepped on my toes but always promptly apologized -my kind of people, the nice ones. We sat, drank, smoked and left on a high note. 

I would definitely want to make the trip back here again when Im back in town. Its a nice, chill place with good drinks that you can light up at. Dont need much more than that to relax.
author: Lauren V.

description: Great location and venue.  It's great that they have heaters because we needed them.  We had drinks and appetizers.  The garlic herb fries were very good shoestring style. I prefer wings that are 'cut' because they are less messy and easier eat so I wasn't amazed by the wings.    The staff was pleasant and accommodating.  Clientele seem to be mixed yuppies.  Rooms are pricey to reserve.  I would probably only go back here for events.
author: Miles B.

description:
I'm torn about 3 or  4 stars.  I don't tend to go to places with cover charges and there was a $7 cover last night, I assume to cover the live music.  it was also loud as hades in there.

But, the patio is what pushes Cigar Bar into 4 star territory.  The noise is much less, it was a beautiful night, we could hear the music and still talk and the drinks were high quality.  The waitresses came by often enough but not so often that it was annoying.

Salsarific.
author: Aaron T.

description:
This place may be great for a late night scene but I came here for an after work drink around 5pm. 

The service was great, the food was very average, the cigar selestion is kind of limited, and the drinks are awful! The soda's they use in mixed drinks were "flat" (not sufficiently carbonated).
author: Shan R.

description:
I just went here for lunch a couple days ago, which they only opened for about a month ago I think, and had some absolutely amazing food! I've been here during the night, which has always been loads of fun, but I've only ever had appetizers, so I didn't really get a chance to sample their kitchen food, but let me tell you, the lunch food is incredible. I had their Hangar Steak plate (medium rare) - complete with yams (mmmm), onion rings (not so big a fan), and a fruit "campote". It was all very seasonal (fall) looking, which was kinda cool, I mean, just to look at it and think it looked like fall, but tasted like heaven :-)

In any event, someone said that they were sorta adjusting to distinguish their lunch atmosphere from the night atmosphere. Well, I think that so far they're doing a pretty good job with their food. They do have iced tea now btw, I guess they added that. Oh and coffee, that helped with the food coma I got afterwards.

I'd definitely recommend the Cigar Bar to anyone looking for a place that isn't so crowded at lunch (probably won't stay that way for too long, but hey, what good secret is kept too long anyways?) that has excellent food and a wonderful outdoor patio (heaters on the walls keep you warm if it's a bit nippy). I'll try the chicken salad sandwich next time I go though, I heard it's pretty good too.
author: Patrik J.

description: Tried to come here on a Friday night with friends after my coworker told me such good things. Well we got there and the doorman told us there was a cover and that the guy who collects the money was inside so he couldn't let us is until he came back. We waited a a few minutes and he hadn't come back. We asked again and he said he'd be there in a minute. Fifteen minutes later he still hadn't come back and we left very frustrated and annoyed. Needless to say haven't had any desire to return yet.
author: Colleen M.

description:
This is a great place to have a cigar and a drink and socialize with friends.  Their selection isn't that great and we usually bring our own.  They have a good selection of liquors and the food is pretty decent.  I've had the sliders and risotto.  

The smoking area is actually outside but you wouldn't think it unless it was raining.  Lots of bricks and dark tables and overhead heaters.  They also have a small room on the side with two couches and another small table with chairs.  Perfect if you are with a larger group.

There is also the "bar" area which is inside as well as two more rooms away from the smoke.  Since I'm there for cigars I don't sit inside nor do I know if the smoke from outside is overpowering.

The staff is very friendly although some servers consistently have problems getting the drink orders correct.

There is a cover charge on the weekends as they usually have a band playing.  Overall it is a nice relaxed environment with a good vibe.  My only gripe is that the kitchen closes around 10pm.
author: Johnny O.

description: Feels like they're trying hard to be Miami. But, I like the outdoors, cigar, and salsa dancing edge. It's hard to get in sometimes, which is annoying.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I just love this place!  I had my 30th birthday here over the weekend and everything was perfect.  The cocktail waitress was great, the bartenders were fabulous, the food was yummy and the outdoor patio was warm enough that I could bare my shoulders in my strapless dress.  

I would highly recommend Cigar Bar for any group event.  Jake was great at setting up an area for us and making sure that the evening went as planned.  It was a night to remember (except I don't actually remember the end - blasted Manhattans!).
author: Jessica B.

description:
A lot of stories about this place, actually, even though I've only known about it for 6 months or so...

...stumbled across it one night while out drinking with a buddy, and I was whining about a lack of cigar bars....we get to Montgomery a few seconds later and, uh, there's a place called "The Cigar Bar." (I probably shoulda wished for something else, I guess, right?) 

We go in, and the selection of cigar's is actually quite small, but whoever chose them knew what they were doing....we select a couple cigars (Davidoff's, I think), buy one for a girl who is eying the case, get a couple of bourbons and the three of us go outside. (It was a very Hemingway moment - uh, minus the shotgun, of course.) A good time was had by all, until the girl's crazy-ass drunk friend showed up... another story in their somewhere.

Since that time, I've been back again and again, with friends, alone, with work colleagues, with work schmoozing, with regular schmoozing...it's all good. 

Definitely go early, tho - it fills up...grab seat outside and plant yourself there for the night. The bar food is actually quite good (but skimpy), so you'll be fine.

Oh, one other thing - every time I'm there, invariably a debutant-wannabe comes wandering in by herself or with friends, and holds her nose or fans the air in front of her and makes That Face(tm)...and then says, "It's so smokey in here!!!"

Jesus, lady, its a cigar bar....
author: Rob D.

description: I've been to Cigar Bar countless times. When friends are in town we usually try to hit up Cigar Bar on a Friday or Saturday- live salsa!!! I've also rented the place out for an event and hired in a cigar roller. Nothing like fresh cigars. The service for the event was flawless and the service in general is ually pretty good. For the event I hired a salsa band (as recommended by the event manager), cigar roller, yummy bites and a full bar. We had a great time! Not a dry glass in the place! (we had about 150 people for the event). The humidor is pretty well stocked. The bartenders tend to have a heavy pour (a little convo and smiling helps with this :), and the vibe is typically lively and fun.
author: C W.

description:
As good as it gets! I absolutely love this bar for two reasons: 

1) It's about a block from my place 
2) It's a rare outside bar in San Francisco. 

It has pretty good apps, but I go here for drinks. Great scotch menu and nothing's better than having a nice scotch and smoking a cigar. It's a relaxing bar during the weeknights, but toward the end of the week/the weekend it can get a little packed. Secure your table early and BAM! you're off to have a great night.
author: Tim Y.

description:
Note to self:  Thinking the bartender is cute should not give you the excuse to suck down your drinks at an abnormal speed just to go get a refill.  

Consequences of ignoring above statement could include blacking out, tripping multiple times in the bar, requiring assistance to walk out, and unfortunately making your friends leave the bar at 1.

All in all though - great spot.  Live music, dancing, outdoor patio with heaters...really what more could I ask for?   OH yeah, and there were a lot of cute boys and reasonably priced drinks.

will definitely be hitting this place up again with hopes of remembering more...
author: Lauren V.

description:
This place is very hard to find and in a very weird spot, AND you have to pass by the Scientologists to get there (our friend almost went into the church on accident). We came here on a Monday night, so it was very chill. There was almost no one there, inside or outside. We talked to the bartender briefly about neuroscience, EEG, and the conference, which was pretty cool. He didn't know a lot about it, but had participated in a couple experiments, so he was interested. Kudos there.

They only had 3 beers on tap, and none of them were great, and a small, but somewhat varied selection of cigars. They didn't have the best of the best, nor did they have the flavoreds I love, and most of the cigars were a bit overpriced. I guess that's what you get for novelty, right?

We got cigars and sat out on the patio to smoke, drink, and chat for a few hours. The bartender was really attentive every time I came in for water; it was like even though we had been out there for a few hours, he didn't forget about us. 

I kinda loved it, mostly for the novelty, also for the cool bartender and the chill environment. Now let's do it again, in LA, and with more draft beers and better cigars.
author: Caroline C.

description: So fun!  Even though there was a crazy lady at the bar harrasing my friends we had such a fun night!!  Especially after craycray and co got kicked out ;)... Anyways, yummy mojitos and generally a great ambiance.
author: Miss P.

description:
Cigar Bar is SWELL!  It feels cathartic to use such an antiquated word, especially after playing Balderdash the other night (esp. defining swallet).

We rented a room from Cigar Bar for my women's political group-- Good Ol' Girls (shameless plug).  Though I've been to Cigar Bar when it's completely packed and you can't move, it was a pleasant change to have a whole room to ourselves.  The space, food, and drinks were great!

** Although big warning to mojito drinkers: Worst. Mojito. Ever.  So sweet that I nearly spit it up.

In any case, I love the outdoor patio ever and I will definitely be frequenting Cigar Bar on many more weeknights when it's not too crowded.
author: Julie L.

description: Went here on both 7/30 and 7/31/2013 with some friends from work. Like the atmosphere and the courtyard, these two nights as with all the other times I have been here,I am impressed with the wine list. Brought cigars one night and bought some the second. All in all a great place for a drink or two. One thing that could be better is that all the servers and bartenders have somewhat of an attitude. Seems like they have a culture of being rude to people. Not very accommodating, does not seem like anyone really cares about you or any other customer. Owner and/or manager has to change this.
author: Walt H.

description:
With a name like The Cigar Bar you would expect this place to have a decent selection of cigars... not really the case and they are all overpriced. However, you are more than welcome to bring your own in which is what I highly recommend doing. I have always had to pay a cover of a couple bucks even when they don't have live music which is basically lame. The inside is kind of cool and I really like the bar area but I always find myself out on the patio which is nice but sort of feels like you are in a condo complex or business park (when you look up). You know the more I think about this place, the more I think I can accurately sum it up rather than rambling on... here it goes: 
Go here if you want a nice place to sit outside to talk with friends over a cigar and a drink.  
Don't go here for the food, the staff or the cigar selection.
author: Mark B.

description:
These guys do a great job! I had to go 3 stars due to the fact that service was super slow on Cinco De Mayo. The tacos were great, the chips and salsa were okay. They didn't have enough help for the many many people who were there so we were not given the best service but it was still good enough. 

If you are looking for a chill place to relax after work  there really isn't many other places I would go but here. They have food, and outside seating. Just go on a warm day :)
author: Devan R.

description:
I had been here for the first time last weekend and I absolutely loved it.  Laid back atmosphere, a decent selection of food & drinks, the live salsa band .....all the good stuff. I liked the fact that it did not feel smoky and claustrophobic though I am told it was relatively less crowded the day I happened to go there.  
Beware of the flavored cigarillos ...  the effect kinda starts to kick in after a while...
author: Rochelle P.

description: There were 9 of us total but 3 people came a bit later.  We all ordered drinks and some food.  So far, pretty good.  When the other 3 people came, they wanted drinks and food too, but our waitress never came around again.  After half hour,  finally got another waitress who ended up getting some woman (maybe bartender or something)  to help us.  I don't know who this woman was, but we placed some more drink orders and she started to walk off to place the order.  We said, "Wait, we wanted to order some food too."  She turned back around, pissed off, and said, "What do you want?" all annoyed.  Do you want our business or not, bitch?  Probably not.  Won't be back.
author: Sage F.

description: Came here for my birthday last week with a bunch of friends; it was wonderful. I had made a reservation beforehand, and we got a nice table on the back patio, which is perfect because you are shielded from any wind (between that and the yummy drinks we didn't even need our jackets). They had a live band and dancing (not a whole lot of room to dance, but that doesn't detract from the ambiance at all...in fact it kind of adds to it). Very laid back, relaxing, and fun for people watching. I am so glad we came here and I am definitely coming back!
author: Kari E.

description: I love everything about this place!  Got drinks with my hubby at the bar, ate dinner outside with friends AND enjoyed live music.  Everything was reasonably priced, which was astonishing.  Parking sucked, but it is San Francisco, after all.  Lots of cool people in their 20s and 30s.  My husband and his friends just HAD to smoke cigars, which to me is disgusting.  But, I can't really complain because I was aware of the name of the bar before entering.  My recommendation: Cuban Pork Sandwich with a Mojito.
author: Alena W.

description: I ended up at Cigar Bar twice a couple of weeks ago as it is so easy to access for drinks after work in the Financial District.  I have been numerous times before as well and always have a good time.  The outside seating area is great when the weather is beautiful.  I'm surprised so many people know of this spot because it's always packed but a fun time.  I've never had food here but the drinks are good.
author: Blake B.

description: I love this place.  I do like an occasional cigar and this is a great place to smoke one.  I can't stand smoking a cigar indoors so I stay away from the typical cigar bar.  But the great thing about this place is that the cigar smoking area is outside!  And its located in a courtyard area (surrounded by brick walls) so you are protected from the wind or really cold weather (there are heat lamps everywhere too in case it gets really cold).  They have a good selection of cigars but you can also bring your own.  The drinks are good too.  I haven't eaten dinner here but I've had appetizer food and it was always decent.  The wait staff are very nice and laid back.  It can get really crowded on the weekends however.  I enjoy coming here on a weekday after work to unwind or meet with a colleague.
author: V C.

description:
Good selection of cigars but it can be tough to get a drink and once you get one, it is not that impressive.   

One night when we were here, two of us got tired of waiting for a cocktail so we left, went around the corner to Bix and had a drink there.  When we  got back the rest of the party who were still at 850 were just getting their drinks.
author: lisa g.

description:
Went here for happy hour last week.  I'm not really into cigars but it's a decent bar.  It's kind of hard to get a table outside but we were lucky to grab a table inside.  The appetizers are good, though a bit on the pricey side.  I can't comment on the cocktails since we just had champagne...the prices are pretty average for drinks, not too expensive, but not too cheap either.

The service was kind of slow and our waitress kept flirting w/ some of the patrons so didn't pay much attention to our group of girls.

It seems like a pretty hip place...I wouldn't mind going back here again but I wouldn't seek it out either.
author: Arlene M.

description:
FUN!!!
The place is pretty big considering its location. Indoors there's a bar, couple tables, and the room where the band plays and the dance floor. There are many huge tables outside where people smoke and eat, and get fresh air. 

The drink (Lavender something?) I had was very well-made and unique. Also tried some wine and whiskey. They were all good. I personally don't smoke, and HATE the smell of cigarette/cigar on my clothes/hair. Amazingly, I almost didn't get any when I left the place after 4 hours of fun.

This is one of the few bars I would keep coming back in SF. It says a lot about this place, since there are countless bars in town.
author: Yuchi C.

description: This is a hidden gem in SF.. totally loved it. We celebrated a friends birthday there over the weekend and the food was amazing (try the calamari!), and the live salsa band was fantastic. Totally loved the outdoor patio with heat lamps and centrally placed fountain. The ambiance and overall vibe was dope. I'll be going back..
author: Mara M.

description:
Great atmosphere and great music! 
The dance floor is very cramped, but who says you can't dance at your table? The place gets packed quick, especially on night where there is live music. So get there quick or plan on standing the rest of the night shoulder to shoulder with your new best friends.
author: Danvin R.

description:
Good cigars at a reasonable price ( I bought a Padron 3000, which is like $4.50 online; $7+tax here).  

The place has an interesting feel to it. I'm going to venture into unchartered waters with this next comment, but I think many people here seemed confused about themselves. Confused sexually, confused all around. 

Whatever, though. 1 star off for the $7 cover and asshole-ish bartenders that weren't too friendly in asking us to leave at closing time.  1 more star off for the inability to smoke inside. =[
author: Victor B.

description:
With asthma, I shouldn't be here, surrounded by second hand smoke.  Yet I still came, it was that enticing to me.  

This is where the cool kids go, the ones that work downtown and need a release after work in the form of an alcoholic beverage.  Inside or outside, it is crowded, lively and fun.  The food is good, (the mac and cheese with lobster in particular stands out as phenomenal, not overly cheesey but just enough, and the lobster is a great addition, prob to justify the price markup but still worth it), the waitresses are on it, the cigar smoke is not overly suffocating to me, and the sangria goes down quickly and easily.  

There wasn't a cover the night I went, and I found the crowd to be very friendly.  You can't smoke the cigars inside, you buy them inside and go outside to the patio/courtyard to smoke them.  When it gets colder the heat lamps come out, and if you stand too close to the water fountain, you will get splashed a little.  Just wanted to inform you of a few things.
author: Denise B.

description:
One of my homies had his birthday party here.  Very cool spot but maybe not so much if you're not into cigars.  You might leave smelling like cigars but not as bad as you may think since the whole thing is outdoors.  The food is on point - we did the party platter thing instead of individual entrees off the menu.  The Cuban pulled pork was on hit as were the roasted potatoes and black beans.  We also had platters and platters of chips with pico de gallo and quesadillas that got tore up before I ever got to try any.  The staff was very friendly to our rather large group, although the bartender was trippin' a little too hard when one of us made the mistake of smoking at the bar.  The drinks he made were very good though.  

From what I hear, it gets really packed after business hours and especially on weekends.  It's the type of place people go to mingle.  I can't really see myself going here often, unless I'm with a bunch of friends like I was this time.  But all in all, I had a great time.
author: O'Shea J.

description:
Cigar bar is excellent.  
$7 cover wasn't so nice.  The dark smokey patio with the fountains and the loud n' lively salsa band were worth it.  So were the stiff drinks, furiously tiny dance floor, and humidor full of cee-gars.
author: Eric S.

description: This place is the hotness....had a great time on Friday night here. The drinks are strong, the music and atmosphere was fun and the dancing was sooo much fun. This is a must-visit spot if you are a local San Franciscan.
author: Julia M.

description:
Once again following in Jessica S's wake...

Since I only gave my orders to the (lovely) waitress, I cant say I had the horrible experience that Jess had, despite the fact that we were there together.  The Cigar Bar is a refreshing change from the normal bar scene.  While the crowd is slightly older than I (Mid Thirties crowd, and there was also a 40th B day party going on), there's something for everyone here, and there is plenty of room to accomodate a crowd.  If you happen upon a mild-warm night in SF, consider stopping by here for late dinner and drinks.  The menu is small but interesting, and of course there are plenty of drinks and cigars to be had.  Great for groups.  I'll be back in 10 years!
author: Cathleya G.

description:
Being able to smoke "inside" (actually in a decorated/sometimes heated courtyard) is really the primary draw here. They don't have an especially diverse/interesting selection of cigars (only one dresser- sized humidor) and staff doesn't seem particularly knowledgeable about the cigars that they carry. 

The drinks are mixed well- I particularly like the Mojito (not too sweet!)- and not over-the-top pricey for the area.  They also have an interesting sense of humor on their drink menu ("$4 wine special" is actually $5). 

Live music is good, and it can be a very relaxing place on a nice night when the crowd isn't too large (weeknights).  Watch out on weekends, though, when the place gets soooo packed that you can't get service to save your life and can barely get a seat. They also charge a cover of something like $7 after 9:00.  

In summation, if you come on a weeknight and bring your own special cigar, you'll probably enjoy your experience.
author: Jenni D.

description:
Cool little place to hang out an put down a Cohiba. The crowd is trendy and tends to be younger, and there is the odd pack of lonesome women that are walking around together trying to look like they're not lonesome... and then you watch them get individually picked off by the Enrico Suave wannabe wolves that stalk the courtyard.

The space inside the bar itself is small, so when there's a live band, IT'S REALLY LOUD inside... so much so that when I walked in the door, the drummer almost blew me away. That's too much.

The courtyard is great. It's open-air with water fountains, and a great place to kick back and chill and chat. The noise level out here is on the louder side, but better than inside. It's by no means a place to have an intimate and relaxed chat with a friend or loved one on a busy night. It's a place to go see people and be seen.

Would I go back? Sure. I've been a couple times already. Will I be found frequenting it on a regular basis? Nah, but I'll be back.

Kudos to the door bouncer being cool and not even bothering to check my ID when I'm obviously over 21, and being courteous when we came in AND when we left. Cool.
author: Gregg G.

description: I've come here before for Salsa Dancing, and this time I came with a bunch of friends to smoke some Cigars. I can't say enough about the location and atmosphere. The drinks were good, the Cigars were relaxing.
author: Eric A.

description: Woohoo! They pour them heavy and cheap here at happy hour.  Our group of seven had GREAT service from the only bartender on staff, who was a sweetheart.  The place was deserted on a Monday afternoon and I can't wait to make a habit of being here.
author: Adam T.

description:
Full disclosure: a friend of mine is one of the owners.

I've had two meals at the Cigar Bar, both on someone else's dime. The first was a catered event at night, where I and 20 of my fellow (mostly) non-cigar-smoking techno-geeks had hors d'oeuvres here. The food was *excellent*, particularly the skirt steak appetizer, and the ambience was great too. And I'm both a non-smoker and non-financial district type. I give their evening event five stars.

Recently, I went here for lunch with a co-worker. Now, the Cigar Bar is a very different beast at night and during the day. Lunch time is non-smoking, which makes their patio a particularly pleasant place to have lunch.The service is quite good, and I enjoyed the food. As mentioned in other reviews, they have a bunch of outdoor heaters for cold days, too.

Lunch wasn't entirely without a hitch, the biggest being that they don't have tea,  They're still figuring out their lunchtime identity, which is necessarily different than the evening smoking and drinking thing, and I suspect they'll address this.

Oh, the food: the cheeseburger is tasty and a generous portion, but mine was overdone (medium-well instead of medium rare. It's OK, though, as I'm not a picky carnivore). I liked the chicken salad sandwich too. They also had one dessert item that day, a chocolate fondant cake, which was tasty and nicely presented.

Summary: Five stars for the evening party, and three stars for lunch.
author: Pat T.

description:
I wanted to write a review for Cigar Bar, but since I am there so often I found it was like trying to write my own bio: I've got all the information but still difficult to put into words. 

You can find me, along with the rest of the PnS crew, on any given Wednesday. Although we are never really there to eat, the pork quesadillas are the best.
author: Cat S.

description:
This place is so  much fun on the weekends. The dancing, the drinking the live music. The smoking is tertiary to me since I quit, but let the others do it for me, while I dance and drink the night away.

The friend I went with has only ever been there during work hours and was expecting that atmosphere. He was very surprised. Which in turn surprised me.

What he expected? A place practically empty, but with men sitting around smoking cigars and drinking whiskey, talking business thinking they're important.
