MY surprise was that that was his interpretation of an environment where folks were having big fun.

His surprise was that I expected people to be smoking, dancing, drinking and eating even at 10pm. 

So we sat there me with my drink, and he with his cigar and whiskey.
I wanted to dance. He wanted to go. So we did.

So sad!
author: Marz W.

description:
I like this bar just fine, minus the smoke in the patio.
On a busy friday happy hour, it could take me up to 20 minutes to get a drink.  I always end up asking my friends to order for me, because I just don't want to stand there!
author: N. C.

description:
Not sure how to write a review when 206 others have already been cranked out - but I guess I'll give it the old college try!

If you're looking for a place thats way more fun than a funeral home but way less crazy than some of the North Beach Clubs, this bad boy hits the sweet spot. It's well lit on the inside, so retards who get hammered and stumble around are *more* likely to be embarrassed the next day. Bonus points :) 

The music is decent and the crowd is very diverse.

Overall, very chill and a great Thursday/Friday spot. I wouldn't go there on Saturday though, not jumping enough!
author: Saumil M.

description:
Why 4 stars, because it's cool there. I was expecting to hate it but ended up actually like the place.

A co-worker was playing there so we dragged our butts out on a weeknight. A weeknight! We never go out on a weeknight. It was worth it though. 

The small quaint rooms and the large courtyard/fire pit made us dream that this was our house. It felt cozy sans the drunk Financial District workers. Actually the drunkards made for good entertainment. Would she fall with those high heels? Is she hitting on that guy?! Is she hitting on that girl?! Whatever, the music was great, the atmosphere was fun and the food was decent.

We got the appetizer platter - man was that a lot of food! It was about $30 for the whole thing and 4 people could have polished it off good. Hubby and I did a good job and left only a couple of scraps. The chicken wings were pretty good, not great. The rest, I don't even remember.

We were lucky to get a table both inside and outside. It got pretty crowded for a Thursday night though. I cannot even imagine going there on a Friday or Saturday night. Crazy busy and packed. I no likey.

Service was good and we're looking forward to going back...on another weeknight before the crowds hit.
author: Wendy B.

description:
I'll admit, I was a little apprehensive when my friend told me she was hosting a birthday party at not just a cigar bar, but THE Cigar Bar. I'm not into cigars *AT ALL*, but I sure do love a little salsa dancing.

It was a little crowded, but who are we kidding -- it's the Financial District -- I expected and almost enjoyed it on a Saturday night. I have to admit, though a highlight of the night was watching the cops (fire marshall?) raid the place and force them to stop letting people in. It wasn't THAT crowded. Sissies.

Ordered a couple margaritas (to get me in the salsa mood), and the bartender was pretty attentive and quick on the bottles. Drinks were pretty cheap for the locale, too. 

Headed out on the dance floor and it wasn't too crowded, the live band was a nice bonus. The guy-to-girl ratio was a little off-balance though, maybe too many lurky businessmen for my taste. 

The smoking patio is great too, it keeps the cigars outside (thank you California law!), and actually doesn't get that smoky for times when you need some fresh air or quiet conversation.

Anyway, I would go back. I'd like to see what it's like on a weeknight. A little less chaotic and I would consider becoming a regular.

PS: There's a cover. You wouldn't expect it, but there is. And good luck finding an ATM -- it's quite the hike.
author: Megan B.

description:
This is one of my fave Happy Hour spots.  Sometimes when things get hectic in the financial district its nice to take the short walk to Cigar Bar.  Like I said I've been to several happy hours here.  Last night started out as Happy Hour and I didn't end up leaving the bar until around one.  It was the first time I had been there post-happy hour.  And I was pleasantly surprised.  There was live music and it stayed pretty crowded.

It was a friend's birthday.  They rented a room for it and got some appetizers.  It was a nice little deal.  

I know I'll be back again very soon!
author: Angela S.

description:
We went to the cigar bar for a party.  My friend had paid for a private room off the courtyard months earlier.  When we got there, they made us wait 20 minutes outside in the cold because they had let other people into our room.  My friend was pissed... understandably.  

The bar, dancing area, courtyard and our private room were nice (not extraordinary, but fine).  I could see why people like this place.  The crowd was mostly 20-somethings.  It was all going well until someone in our party had her purse stolen from our private room.  Her purse was found empty in a toilet in the men's restroom.  Who the hell are they letting in to this place??  That definitely put a damper on the night, especially considering it hadn't started off well.

I'd def go back to give it another try, but for now it only gets 3 stars.
author: Elena I.

description: Thank you for existing.  Good drinks, great set-up and I love the taste of of a good cigar every once in awhile.
author: Heather M.

description: Great place with a great atmosphere, and they are not trying to rip you off. The drinks are reasonably priced (especially during the happy hours) and the food is very good for a bar. Ideal place to hang out and meet up with a couple of friends after work.
author: Cameron D.

description:
This place is aesthetically pleasing.  There's really warm light to the place, and it reminds me of a hacienda.  I get the feeling that most of the locals don't even KNOW about Cigar Bar and Grill.  This is probably because it's completely off the beaten path, so that said, pretty interesting mix of your not-so-normal SF night.  It strangely appears to be an international crowd here.

Great Latin jazz here. Have the mojito, it's a specialty. I hear sangria is as well.  

Cigars purchased from humidor can be smoked outside in the European-style courtyard. Nice atmosphere -- very lively (mainly due to the music I'd imagine), when not invaded by that guy in the striped shirt.
author: G B.

description:
Pretty sweet venue minus the $7 cover charge. The outdoor area was awesome and there a plenty of heat lamps to keep you warm. Also there was a live band playing fun salsa music. This place was packed on a Friday night. 

Another plus, I left without even smelling smokey. I would probably come back here but maybe before they start charging cover at 9:30.
author: elissa w.

description:
If I was 35 and really boring I would love this place.  It has the potential to be pretty cool, but it caters to a certain 30-something "I'm totally not into the scene" scene.  Dancing was pretty much prohibited being that there were only professionals and freaks cutting up the rug, but we tried our best.  Plus a star or two for the cigars, and but minus a few for the weak mixed drinks made of pure lime juice.  

Overall I have one word to describe my one night stand with Cigar Bar: meh.
author: Morgen N.

description: Recently went to celebrate my fiancé's big 40.  He actually found the place and we loved it!  Food was great, drinks were yummy and he enjoyed their cigar bar selection.  My favorite on the menu...plantains!  Very reasonable menu too.  After 11 p.m. they play live music.  We can't wait to come back!
author: Ria D.

description:
This is due to service after I rented a room.  I had a birthday party there on a Saturday night.  The waitress was super nice, but they let so many people in that she became overwhelmed,  My guests were uable to get a drink.  Furthermore, one guest arrived late, and the bouncer wouldn't even let him in (he was willing to pay cover, it was the line was so long, boucer was rude, didn't care that we had a private party).   No one who worked there was around to talk to.  

This is after paying about $1000 for a private room.

GOOD ATMOSPHERE, POOR SERVICE
author: Will S.

description: What a friendly, hospitable and proactive team!  My organization recently hosted a professional event at The Cigar Bar & Grill.  In addition to accommodating our event needs by giving us the right room(spatially and logistically), menu, service and level of flexibility, our guests expressed their happiness with the venue and the mixer.   Thank you for making us look good in front of our clients and prospects!
author: MC M.

description:
The food is great. Especially for the price. Order the Spanish Chorizo Bruschetta, it's awesome. The Calamari is on the bland side though. 

The atmosphere is not bad until the band shows up, along with all the crowds. Then the place turns into a mad house just like any other bar. Though the advantage is that you have an escape in the courtyard away from the mob dancing in a tiny band room.
author: Mark G.

description:
The client I was taking out to dinner said to me, "This is like a classy El Torrito" (he was from SoCal).

Not a bad spot: the main eating area is out in the open air and ready for you to cut the ends off your Churchills. I dug into all of the mexican inspired dishes that came out (which were pretty good), including the nachos, tacos, and fish. Decent service with decent food, in an intimate setting (and I have to admit, I can enjoy an occasional cigar).
author: Andy A.

description:
I don't really get this place...

is it Mexican?
is it Spanish?
what is the point?

I hate cigarette/cigar smoke, therefore I could not fully enjoy the full effect of this place. The drinks were strong, chips & guac were good and the outdoor patio was really nice. I think minus the smoke, I would give this place at least 4 stars.
author: Elaine S.

description:
I was hesitant to go here just because it is so close to North Beach. 
I haven't had good experiences in that neighborhood. 

But I was pleasantly surprised. I didn't feel like I was in a meat-market, or a pickup bar. 
The inside section is a bit small, but their courtyard is beautiful.  the seats were old wicker though, kind of lumpy and felt as if it was going to give way. 

Personally I do not smoke tobacco, but I wasn't overwhelmed at all. Even with my best friend enjoying her $15 cigar right next to me. 

She said their selection of cigars was very diverse.
author: Towanda S.

description: The cigar bar is the perfect happy hour or late night with live music Thursday-Saturday. it is a complete oasis in the financial district. The drinks are great, sometimes just need to be a little sweeter, one of my faves is the passion fruit caipirnha. it is just the right atmosphere to relax after a busy work week with a drink and (occasionally) a cigar in the gorgeous courtyard with salsa music wafting out of the open doors and windows. it is the perfect summer evening. The cigar bar is one of my favorites in the city.
author: Margot K.

description:
Love the place, love the people. Casual elegant courtyard, like a Spanish villa. The drinks are great, the food is delicious and the menu has been thought through. They have viibrant  live music on weekends and a nice pool table in the back. In fact there are five rooms to chose from with open doors and windows looking into the courtyard and fountain. I gets pretty busy on the weekends.

The open courtyard is such a great retreat from downtown. 
They've even got heat lamps.
author: Fareed R.

description:
You need a place to converse with a date or just some friends it's a great place. Not a whole lotta music until after 11pm (live jazz band).   They have a huge open courtyard where you can chil and smokel. Otherwise, they have private dinning and a billiard room.  

Bartenders made the drinks very strong and the choice of cigars was decent nothing too crazy expensive.  

VEggie Friendly: Yes
author: ashley l.

description: The cigar bar is a great place to drink, dance, and enjoy latin music on the weekends.  If you're lucky you'll have a great time, but  It's not a destination club because you can't really count on realizing your plans on any given night.   I've been there when the band didn't show until close to midnite.  I've had to wait outside for too long to get in, and even turned away one Friday because they had an unannounced private party take over the joint..  Any time you head out for the Cigar Bar, make sure plan B is operable.  It's not too far to walk up to North Beach.  Stop at Mr. Bing's to refuel.
author: Greg C.

description: This was a young, hip, Cuban style restaurant with a great atmosphere, live Cuban music, and lots of patio seating. The drinks were delicious, the food was good, and the music was fun. The down side was that the service was okay (they were busy and understaffed it seemed) and the prices were a little high. Despite the few negatives I still feel like this is a great little spot that I would recommend and re-visit.
author: Holly P.

description: OMG the quesadilla is SO GOOD. Went back to CB over the weekend to party and had SUCH a blast. The bouncers are nice and the bartenders are fast. And the band is SO FUN!!!!!!!  the bathroom is clean too!!! love love love this place.
author: Nikki H.

description:
I'm all into places where I can drink outdoors. The 3rd time I ate here the food was definitely better.  Tasty, although nothing special.  Music on the weekends for those who are into dancing

It can get pretty packed which sucks.

We started a night here for a birthday dinner which I would recommend esp if you can get seated on the patio.
author: b s.

description:
i first went there to hear my friend's band play there Friday night and, oh, what a treat to find a cigar lounge that (1) doesn't smell like smoke!!! and (2) lets lowly cigarette smokers sneak in there inferiour little sticks.... 

If you are going there for quiete conversation while the bands are playing - forget it! enjoy the music and dance a little!

i have to say, I haven't tried the food. but i loved the drinks, the staff, the music, the ambience, the inside-outside thing they got going. Great place for scarf wearers, drink downers, drink uppers, salsa dancers, picker ups, and 56-ring lovers ))))) 

i'd bring my own cigars though )) they provide the lounge but not a full cigar bar
author: brook l.

description:
Had a good time there on a Friday night!

Good, strong drinks from friendly bartenders, great live salsa music good vibe and of course great smoking area!!!

Had great conversations with complete strangers!! The dance floor is a little small, but it works! Parking can be a little difficult and I didn't enjoy having to pay for parking, but hey it's SF so I'm not complaining to bad!!

Just a tad far for me and if you're driving Friday nights can get a little crazy over there, but it was worth it.
author: M R.

description:
Food and drinks: So delish. We got the plantains, chips+salsa, and polenta. There was a Hendrick's gin promotion going on so gin drinks were cheap and strong! 

Staff: Our server sucked so bad that I didn't even feel bad when my friend joked, "She's grumpy because her shirt's too tight, and her fat's bulging." She took FOREVER to bring me even a beer. Our last round of drinks and food, I ended up going to the bar and ordering with the bartender. He was friendly and we got everything in a more reasonable time.
author: Elaine Y.

description: First, there is a cover charge...  ugh.. hate those and think they are totally pointless considering that most people, I mean drunk people tend to buy alot of drinks.  There was great salsa music and the outdoor patio has a ton of tables and heat lamps which makes for a great place to sit.  The drinks are strong so I do say drink with caution... or don't but they are tasty too which is always nice.  I don't smoke cigars though and so I cannot give an accurate account for that part of the bar but I certainly hope what I have said is at least somewhat helpful.
author: Kylie L.

description: Great space, friendly staff, outdoor space, salsa dancing and great music. The event coordinator made my birthday planning easy and stress-free.  I met out a bunch of friends at Cigar Bar last night and had the best time! The space is laid out nicely that you can avoid the smoke and get your dance on.  I will be back.
author: Nilu r.

description: I've been to this place a few times for a smoke and some T&Ts. Their humidor is less than spectacular but I always bring my VSGs so I don't mind. They make good cocktails and have an excellent selection of Scotch and Bourbon should I tire of Tanqueray. It gets busy, especially when there is live music, but I'm always able to find or share a table on the patio. Their food is decent and the waitstaff is always friendly. If you're in SF and you want to relax and enjoy a cigar and some drinks, The Cigar Bar is a must.
author: TPD O.

description: I've gone to a couple nonprofit events here and am really impressed by the venue's accommodation of nonprofits. Great happy hour specials, too! And the sunroof is a nice touch.
author: Sarah B.

description: I first came to this place on a whim a few years ago, and it was pretty empty, but the vibe was good.  I recently returned a few months ago and it was still there.  I didn't know that it was a cigar bar.  pretty sweet.  live salsa music, decent pricing for the drinks, overall great atmosphere.  I will return, and this time I might actually buy a cigar!
author: Marciano P.

description: I came here on a Saturday Night to celebrate my friends 30th birthday. I drove right past it once, and while I was waiting in line I realized the crowd was pretty old. As I entered after paying an $8 or $12 dollar cover charge (different) I saw that this place was packed with locals. I kid you not the age range was literally like 21-50 to 60's. lol. It's all good because I can mingle anywhere with anybody and fit right in. I'm 29 and felt like I would see my dad around the corner or something drinking some hennessy privilege. And he's in his 60's!! I also realized that I think I might be overdressed. I saw a few guys in flip flops?? wtf, T-Shirts, and shorts. Ohhh k, I guess. I noticed an outdoor smoking area for cigars and indoor smoking is welcome also. Live Band was on break but eventually came back and had the place jumping. Live Band is always a good look. The dance floor was pretty small but I guess you could make due for alot of people weren't even dancing. Just conversation. It was kind of an hassle to get a drink, maybe because your elbow to elbow. The drinks were extremely good. After getting my drink and sitting down with my comrades I noticed that it was about 11:30 and this place was booming. But within the hour I noticed that 1/3 of the patrons left??? I don't know. Maybe this is one of those places that you go to to set up your night. Kind of like a pit stop before you get to the main event. One thing that kind of ticked me off a little is that people don't really try and move to the side when one has to use the restroom. You have to be very stern and give them the low voice "EXCUSE ME". lol. I had a good time with my friends and was a good experience. I would go back here just for the drinks or if I'm going somewhere else that night in the same area.
author: Alastair G.

description:
I'm generally happy with the cigar bar. This place is a great place to come with a group of friends, sit outside, have a drink, and, yes, smoke a cigar.

Generally a pretty cool atmosphere, the drinks are pretty good.

I knock it down for a couple of reasons: 1. the drinks seem overpriced to me for what you are getting 2. I feel like there should be a larger selection of cigars. To call yourself the cigar bar, I feel like you should have more than one standup humidor in the corner.

Oh well, my recommendation is to avoid this place on a friday night. Tough to get a table and relax. If you come on Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday, its really mellow, and oftentimes can be a really realxing place to hang out.
author: Barron E.

description:
Great patio, be aware that people smoke out there, Cigar Bar, duh
Good selection of cigars if that's your thing
Drinks were OK
Good place for groups
No yelling needed
It was a mix of people and if you don't like it lots of options close by
I'd go again
author: Po L.

description: Loved the outdoor, heated courtyard. If you can snag a table, it can actually be pretty relaxing. Husband loves smoking cigars and I liked the courtyard--two birds, one stone.
author: Dee L.

description: I paid for an overpriced glass of cranberry juice when I ordered a cocktail.   Good thing I waited until I got to 83 Proof to order my mojito!
author: Ami N.

description: I love love love, Cigar Bar!!!  They have live music and the energy in there is awesome!  You can't help but dance!  Their Mojito's are off the hook, definitely the drink of choice at this place.  The outside patio is very pleasant...you can step out and smoke a cigarette, or cigar, and not freeze your a** off!  The bathrooms are pretty small but that's not abnormal.  All and all, Cigar Bar is a safe bet for a good time!
author: Ashley J.

description:
It's a salsa club, Grill and cigar bar, in that order.  The music was great; the dancing is well...it's Caucasian Salsa, although everyone does seem have fun.  The food...I did not eat here, I did however, see a lot of dishes on the tables.    They have a smallish selection of cigar, but they are not over priced like you would expect.  I am a big cigar smoker and bring my own, but their selection was good.  In San Diego, where I'm from, the cigar bars have walk in Humidors, but they are more cigar store that offers a Bar.  This one is a Bar that offers cigars.

ITS A CIGAR BAR...it's in the name.  My one major complaint was the group of people at the table next to me complaining about the cigar smoke.  WHY???  Did you not read the name of the bar?  Are you blind?   You, table full of idiots, are the reason Saber-toothed Tigers should be re-introduced into the wild.   You want to have this bar shut down because it allows smoking?  There are hundreds, if not thousands of not smoking bars in the city and only two Cigar bars.  Of which, only one allows smoking inside.  We are on a patio you effin MORON, that is legal.  Its people like you that made me realize abortions should be legal and retroactive.  Go back to your boring, esthetically pleasing, smoke free bar and leave this be.  

It's one of the few places where I can have a Whiskey, Rum, coffee or Cognac with my cigar, watch people have fun and not get dirty looks (with the exception of the table full of Tweedles).
  
I took off one star for the cover.
author: Brian D.

description: I love this bar! I came here for my birthday last week and had such a great time! Ample seating, great music, and strong drinks!  What more can you ask for?!
author: Cherlyn M.

description:
Pros: live bands, tasty mojitos, chill outside area
Cons: you come home smelling like a chimney
author: Mark H.

description:
No parking so take a cab. When you get here, you can see it's always packed like sardines inside but there's never a wait outside. How pleasant! (You bouncers holding up the line at the clubs to make it looked packed... that's overrated.) Anyway, you get inside and the first room/bar is a pretty decent size but packed! I always managed to get to the front because tiny me can just duck underneath the crowd and come up right at the front of the bar with no one noticing. I LOVE being small! I HATE when these girls try to dry hump me pushing me against the bar to get a drink! Just hold up while I get mine and you can get yours. Geezuz. If you go to the bar, you should double fist it; buy 2 drinks for yourself because good luck getting back to the front of that bar!

Then you go outside and the patio is so lovely! They have nice heat lamps to keep it a nice, steady temp. and it's kind of enclosed so it's just a nice, Italy-like atmosphere with quite a diverse crowd. Everyone's pretty friendly there. It's more of a young-professional crowd so it's pretty lively. I have interesting conversations when I go here. First time, some guy called me a prude because I wouldn't hook up with his boy. I'm sorry, but prude in mu vocab is not a bad word so thank you and good luck with finding a whore, good bye. The second time, I placed my drink down on a guy's table and told him that I watched a tv special where they secretly filmed a guy putting ruffies into a girl's drink and to see if anyone who saw would do anything about it. So I told him don't even try because I have big girlfriends who can kick his ass if they saw him try anything. Somehow, that turned out to be a pleasant conversation with him and his buddies for the night. He ended up being quite the gentleman. So, you have a 50/50% chance of meeting a good guy or a bad guy here, but overall, still worth going to to smell the cigars mmmMMM

I don't smoke, but, boy, do the cigars smell so nice!
author: Lucky N.

description:
This came to be the last stop during a try-out-as-many-bars-as-you-can-expedition me and my friends had a Saturday evening.

After the usual ID-check and paying a $7 admission fee at the door we were allowed to enter this temple of Hispanic atmosphere and I just loved everything about it; the cigars, the live band, the mojitos and the multi-ethnic crowd, or as my friend so joyfully put it: "it's like a mosaic of nationalities!"

And oh, did I mention that the bartenders were really quick, service minded, professional and had a great attitude?

What really brought this place to 5-star-rating in my eyes was the outdoor-seating though. Few things are comparable to sitting outside a summer night, sipping on a mojito while being caressed by a warm breeze.

Definitely coming back here!
author: Pastor Z.

description: Went to Cigar Bar last night, Sat.  I feel compelled to write about my experience there!  First there was a short line, but they made us wait like 20 min because it was crowed.  Just as we got to the front a huge group cut in line (12 people) and somehow that was ok because they "had called in". and no they werent a group of hot chicks either. Finally get in, get a drink, dance one song and then the band says goodbye!?? then i asked them why and they said it was at the owners request and that they were not going to put any music on at all!  It's 12:30 and we pretty much had to leave after being there 20min.  The "owner"  told me that the neighbors complain and was sorry for the inconvenience.  Really?  Then give me my cover back or for next time!  Anyways, it was a strange experience and I probably will avoid it in the future.
author: Michelle F.

description: Not a big smoker but nothing wrong wit a good cigar on occasion. Nice vibe, good music (live salsa for a good portion of the night). Billiards in the back, patio on the side. Pretty well varied all around.
author: Jaymes H.

description: This place has a nice atmosphere. I kinda like how you can't really (or my b&t self can't) distinguish what "group" hangs out here. I prefer that rather than all Marina-ish or all hipster-ish. There's no attitude and everyone's looking pretty. Great latin jazz band for dancing. Nice outdoor patio for cigar smoking and a good looking menu, although i haven't tried the food yet. Decent drinks menu. It's also easily accesible by Montgomery BART.
author: Farah S.

description:
the latin band rocks the house!

i felt bad ordering my mojitos with such a busy crowd since i know they require a little prep time...ok, i didn't feel too bad.  they shouldn't put it on the menu if they can't make it.  and they were yummy!

why the minus star:
1. other than not having my fav bauza...
the cigar selection was average and some were quite dry.  nothing worse than puffing on a dried out cigar.  so bring your own.
2. 2 bathroom stalls for the ladies? with a line around the corner, the gals ended up invading the mens room.  sorry, guys...    

the outdoors area was great on a nice san francisco night.  even with all the smokers - cigars and cigarettes hanging out of people's mouths, the air was not bad for non-smokers since the space is quite big.

the crowd was an interesting mix on sat night:  some hip hop crew, some latinos, some college folks, old and young.  it was more casual than i expected.  

there are some closed areas for private parties but i rather join in the crowd for dancing latin fools.
author: Anh V.

description: Great space, enjoyed the outdoor patio with a cigar and cocktails. The patio filled up quickly for the after-work young professional crowd. We arrived at 4:00 and by 5 all the patio was nearly full, buzzing with laughter, drinks and yummy appetizers. The staff was friendly and promptly helped me choose a cigar from the humidor. I wouldn't pay a cover but for sure you have to hit up this spot for the happy hour deals.
author: Tod K.

description: Service was slow....and you never want slow especially when the Socilate Monster is celebrating her Independence Day!  But the margaritas were rockin once we finally got them, AND any place in the city that has an outdoor courtyard for social smokers is a definite A+ for me!
author: Wendy H.

description: So there's this little law in California (that I'm grateful for by the way because I don't smoke) that states you cannot smoke inside a public building, even bars.  Luckily, Cigar Bar has tons of seating outside where smoking is legal (because even though I don't smoke, sometimes you need a stogie to go with your sangria, which by the way is amazing.)  The sangria is great.  I recommend the pitcher for about $27 and drinking it all yourself.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: A beautiful courtyard, tiled interiors, live latin music, and an atmosphere that will make you think you're too caliente for your own good...Yes, anyplace that can delude me into thinking I can salsa gets my vote.
author: M A N I K.

description: It's a cute place with a great outdoor patio but our waitress didn't know what the hell we were ordering even though I said it like 5 times and finally just pointed at the word.  However, drinks are always strong and there's a huge outdoor patio to smoke on. Prices are okay and the bands are loud and good.  There's a pool table in the back too.  Oh and if you were there one of the many times I rocked my "I'm single bitchez!" line at the top of my drunk lungs...you witnessed history.
author: Jill D.

description:
PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT: CIGAR BAR IS NOW OPEN FOR LUNCH.
I was looking for a place to eat today, and the pretty girl on the sidewalk showed us a menu, said there was no wait, so it was a no-brainer.  We were escorted down to the courtyard to a table, and we were the ONLY people in the restaurant at 12:30 in the Financial District, which seemed a little sketchy. I asked the waitress what was up, cause the cafe across the street had a line out the door. She explained that they just started opening for lunch this week, and word had not yet gotten out. Consider the word out. This is a great place to eat lunch!

I had a chicken salad sandwich (delicious fresh baked focaccia-type bread, cranberries, and a really good side salad with lots of tomatoes. She had a Smoked "Trout" Salad: Very delicious, with watercress, thinly sliced fennel, radishes, and generous amounts of a pink fish that very closely resembled salmon in appearance, texture, smell, thickness, and taste. I asked the waitress why we got salmon, who checked with either the manager or the chef, and he told her it was "Pink Trout". I went back to work and asked some coworkers if they ever ate pink trout. one laughed at me, and another threatened to call HR. I Googled "pink trout" and got a few responses, but nothing conclusive. Now, I'm not saying they ran out of trout, and tried to cover up a salmon substitution when called on it. I'm just sayin'.
Mystery fish aside, a great place to eat lunch. Great food. Great service. Go now before the lunch crowd finds this place.
author: Johnny O.

description: Very nice place to relax on a night out or happy hour after work.  Nice courtyard to hang out in but be aware that everyone will be smoking outside...just an FYI.  Menu has some nice bites to get, the nachos I remember are really nice.  They have very nice music here, latin dance music and salsa... really fun to sit with a mojito and listen to the bongos ahha
author: Shawn A.

description: Reliable yuppie dude hangout after work.  Don't sit inside when there's the great patio and 100 heat lamps.  Live salsa-esque music last night, and killer fanned-out quesadillas.
author: Melanie C.

description: This place has a lot of character... like John Leguizamo in the Hennessey ads. Actually, Cigar Bar is just like that ad. Chock full of suave Latin men with Cigars in hand and ...well maybe not Hennessey, but you get the picture. Live (Cuban?) bands every Thursday-Saturday night. You have to prepare your self for the atmosphere though... it's very Havana, literally. Most of the folks I spoke with were from waaayyy out of town.
author: Rada I.

description: Not a big fan of smoking, but this place is still one of my favorite hand out spots in the city! My friends who do smoke, absolutely love this place for it's open courtyard area and location. It's a great place to go to with friends and enjoy your time and a great meal! Food good there too, didn't care much for the enchilada plates, but their steak is awesome. Fridays and Saturdays they have live Latin bands  in there, a great place to show off your salsa skills!
author: Serge U.

description: Two of the old owners have kept and modified the place, expanded the menu, and lightened things up. It's cozy and saucy at the same time.
author: Gretchen T.

description: At first glance, this place totally seems to be one those annoyingly over pretentious 'lounges.'  I was wrong :).  I went for my cousin's friend's birthday party.  So fun!  It was even raining.  The vodka sodas are strong (like I like them).  They have a fabulous outdoor patio (with heaters which is a plus) where a bit older crowd (30s) can smoke their cigars and/or cigs.  I loved the atmosphere.  Great for parties.  I'll definitely be having a birthday party here at some point during my time in San Francisco!!
author: Jenny W.

description: The food was okay, nothing special.  The drinks were yummy.  The live salsa music was great.  The dancers suck, including me. =) My clothes reeked of the inescapable tobacco smell by the end of the night. just not my type of scene I guess.
author: rosalyn m.

description: Love this place.  It has a very laid back and unpretentious environment to it and a nice little outdoor patio for the cigar smokers.  The drinks are tasty and normally has a great live salsa performance on Friday and Saturday nights.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
RUDEST bartenders I've experienced in quite some time.  A group of us got here early for a Saturday night so the place was pretty empty.  And yet when a few of us walked up to the bar the two bartenders standing there just stared at us.  When we requested what drinks we wanted all we got was a rude 'I'm going to need to see your IDs'.  Um, ok DICK.  Then that guy  asked the other bartender, 'Do you want to serve these kids'.  Excuse me?  We are all in our mid-twenties and last time I checked are nice, paying customers.  All night when I went up to get another drink they just acted like I was making them go out of their way, whether it was by sighing or rolling their eyes.  Fuck off.
The actual ambiance is alright, although we did end up being the youngest there, but seeing that a few in our group do really like cigars it worked.  Also, it was a nice night so sitting outdoors was relaxing.  It got super crowded at about 10 so we booked it out of there.  And even though I was drunk, I do remember the women's bathroom being pretty gross...you couldn't even go into one of the stalls because there was piss or something all over it.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Wow, since can you get paid to sit on your ass and talk on the phone to your friends, ignore paying customers and occasionally check ID's?  I was looking forward to enjoying the nice weather on Friday night with friends at Cigar Bar, but at the entrance we were signaled to hold on, as the bouncer held up his hand whilst on the phone.  Being courteous, we waited, we got out our ID's, and the bouncer continued paying attention to his friend on the phone.  While we waited, the bouncer made no attempt to communicate with us that this was an emergency and that he'd attend to us soon, nor did he communicate with his friend that he had to get off the phone.  So.... I got tired of waiting and decided to walk in with my friend, the second I did that, the bouncer finally tells his friend on the phone 'Look I think I'm going to have to go' and rudely yanks the arm of my friend, pulling him out of the entrance area.   The bouncer then announced that they were at capacity and only letting people in per the number of people leaving.  At that point we decided to leave and not spend our money or wait to let this bouncer dictate when he was going to do his job.  Had this 'capacity situation' been explained to us when we arrived, we would not have had a problem waiting, but there was no effort to explain this to us and the manner at which the bouncer treated us was rude and unnecessary.

Dear Cigar Bar-  Perhaps you have a decent place inside(I've only been once before and thought it was alright), but the way in which your bouncer treats potential customers and acts as if managing the entrance is a part-time job is completely embarrassing.   Observing a few other similar comments on Yelp leads me to believe your outside staffing could benefit from some new hire changes and tighter supervision from upper management.    Thanks.
author: Leslie U.

description: If you want to be served a warm tap beer and stand among a few hundred of the most dull, silver-spoon up the tush frat boys, then this is a five-star joint in your eyes. The bartenders seemed fine, but the beer was literally piss warm. The dudes that frequent this bar are the bottom-of-the-barrel tool suits. I heard at least three guys talking about "how hot the chicks are". The remaining conversations were about their iphones, chicks again, their inflated bank accounts and their penny loafers. I wouldn't return to this godawful place if beers were free for life. Ok, if that were the case, I probably would.
author: K F.

description: Stopped in for a drink after dinner and was amazed at this place where you can have your favorite drink and a cigar! It was a perfect topper to an already good day above ground. The staff was pleasant, the atmosphere relaxing on the patio and indoors. It must been early because there was no Salsa Music. But I think I will make it a regular stop when I have dinner in North Beach
author: Sheldon D.

description: My friend is currently out of country for over one month and asked me to call the Cigar Bar to give an extension for the Groupon as he really wanted to give it a try. He would rather use the Groupon if possible instead of getting refund from Groupon.  The lady picked up the phone said no and hang up on me right away.  I am sure the place is nice but this is very rude and unprofessional.
author: Vicky F.

description:
I used to love this place. My friends and I would enjoy drinks and a cigar almost weekly here. From corporate gatherings to getting the gang together on a weekend.

Last night however, I was in shock. There was a VERY rude bouncer working the door who is from Brazil. He told my group of 6 that we were not allowed to enter. He stated it was "Male/Female" couples night. No Males were allowed with out a female. As we looked in to the court yard, we could see dozens of males however, they were all of Latin decent. He went on to allow other groups in who approached and just laughed as we watched. Several other groups of men walked away in disgust. When we started questioning the bouncer, he was unable to handle our questions and brought out another South American gentleman to tell us we could come back another night. Still, they could not provide a reason as to why only a Man and a Women together could enter. 

We will NEVER give money to this place again. We live here and go there frequently and were treated like this??!!???

There is no room for this sort of discrimination in San Francisco. Although I am a straight male, it offends me that only Male/Female couples would be allowed in the bar on a particular night. I think that everyone who respects diversity in the city should pass this along to their friends.

No respect at this place and the door man is rude, unfriendly, un welcoming, etc. 

I will make sure this news spreads around the city!
author: Big D.

description: Great from 5-7, don't show up after 8. You'll need to get a table to enjoy this. NEVER EVER agree to pay a cover.
author: Tyler W.

description: Haven't eaten here, so i can't comment on that, but.....  Had a great time at an engagement party.  The space is pretty classy and the courtyard is killer...  I am not a smoker, but somehow a cigar just seemed like the thing to do.  Couple that with all the drinks consumed and things start to get blurry...  but looking back at the pictures and the smiles on everyone's faces, how could i not give 5 stars?
author: Robert R.

description:
A frequent watering hole for co-workers and their significant others, I was lured there by the expectations of seductive sirens inebriated by their brew of choice.  What I found shocked me.  A very relaxed atmosphere  with good friends and exciting conversation.  Though disappointed by the lack of attractive women I found The Cigar Bar comfortable and inviting.  
The drinks are average price for a downtown saloon, although the cost of happiness varies between your waitress and the bar inside.  I had the opportunity to taste the wide variety of savory delectables available and was honestly impressed.  A large platter was set down before my table, an offering of true proportion that would satisfy even the most delicate of pallets.  The chicken wings, superb.  The calamari, divine.  Those little fried things, awesome.
I would highly recommend an evening out to The Cigar Bar.  The only negative aspect of this place are the absurdly HOT heating lamps placed over the outdoor tables.  I mean these things cook!  Otherwise everything was great and I plan to go back there soon!
author: Casey C.

description: I liked it here. It has a great smoking area off to the side in the middle of an outdoor plaza. Nice ambiance inside and some cute bartenders. Oh and has anyone found $60 lying around the floor there. I may or may not have dropped it. A few drinks = $ on the floor. Shit.
author: Suzanna G.

description: I'm loving this place. I don't know where it's been, but a great recent discovery of mine. The Cigar Bar has a great European feel for me after moving here two years ago from Madrid. Saturday nights have proven a great, mature crowd, in their early 30s. You can play pool in the back, hang out in the patio (which has outdoor heaters) or make a move toward the dance floor and live latin band. The dance floor is a bit small, but everything else makes up for it.
author: Susan S.

description: One of my favorite places to hang in North Beach.  They make good drinks, you can smoke cigars in the outside area and the bartenders are cool.  They usually have good latin bands there on weekends which gives the place a cool atmosphere.  The outside area is great but the last time we were there, the heat lamps were turned up a little too high.  Maybe they will read this and adjust them?  Usually there's a small cover when there are bands.
author: Mitch A.

description: I was there for a private party and thought it worked well for that. The space is cozy and the food and service were both good. I liked the patio with heat lamps, and the outdoor pool table (although I did not play).
author: Amy E.

description: We just met here last night for dinner & drinks. I was amazed. Food tastes really good and staff was very friendly. We had a good time and I will definitely go there again.
author: Maria S.

description:
i was with someone who was a cigar aficionado, so i was dragged here.  it was so fun!  i ended up dancing my booty off to some great latin music while he smoked and chit-chatted about cigars.  this place is really elegant but unpretentious. 
macarena and macanudo all under one roof.
author: regina k.

description:
the cigar bar is a cute little place to grab a drink in jackson square.  the first time i went, i was heading to myth for a birthday dinner and we went there beforehand to meet up for a drink.  they have a nice area outside with tables that i really liked.  
this time i went for a happy hour on thursday with friends.  they did have drink specials, which i didnt try, but they also had appetizers that i really liked.  i havent eaten here, but i would definitely try it after sampling their salsa and quesadillas.  the pomarita that i had was really strong but in a good way!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Excellent happy hour.  Cute boys.  What else do you need?
author: Sloane R.

description: Cigar Bar is my favorite happy hour place in San Francisco. I'm a fan of their Island Rum Cocktails, the boys enjoy puffing on cigars, and everyone loves the patio. You forget that you're only a few blocks from the office. By the time the band begins to play, everyone's in the mood for dancing. The only downfall- no hand stamp. Though my girlfriend and I convinced the bouncer to look the other way when we snuck back in, I'm not sure our technique would work for those of the male persuasion.
author: Amanda B.

description: I love the live Music, the drinks are awesome, and the crowd is chill. Its a fun place to go to to dance with your friends, and the food is also realllly good!
author: Tati M.

description:
I've been here many times, more for happy hour, but most recently on a Saturday night.  

The Cigar Bar renewed my faith in partying on a Saturday night in San Francisco.  Normally, when my line that "I'm a journalist writing about the perfect weekend in San Francisco for a Pittsburgh newspaper" doesn't grant me immediate access to the head of the line, I feel it's time to move on to a less pretentious place.  However, my instinct was to convince my friend to stay in line, that good things were inside.  And my instincts were right.   My evening here totally reminded me of a unforgettable evening that I spent at nightclub in South Beach (except that I can't remember the name of the club)  Cool people lurking in every corner, a generous pour(s) of an indulgent Pinot, the wafting aroma of cigars, and it was one of the balmiest evenings that I've experienced in San Francisco.  With the occasional witness of men dropping their drawers and make-out sessions (not I) thrown in for good measure.  All bring back haunting flashbacks of weekends in Miami.  
 One of those fun nights in the city where the memories of great conversation, music, and wine take the edge off the Sunday morning hangover.
author: Amy Z.

description: I had an interesting nite here after our group was asked to leave the nearby Bubble Lounge.  The layout is great for warm summer nights.  I agree with the other reviews, it's a fairly chill establishment, but I don't come here on a regular basis.  I guess there's just too many other fun places in the Bay.
author: Nikki c.

description: Seriously my new favorite spot in the city.  I love the live spanish guitar during happy hour and live latin band on the weekends.  The drinks are really good and I always have a great time there no matter who I'm with.  The atmosphere is really lively.  The parking situation is really tough though.  From now on, anytime someone asks where we should go, Cigar Bar is my default response.
author: Amy T.

description: I'm here most weeknights for Happy Hour. It's a cool spot to hang out in- good music, cool employees and a soothing yet fun atmosphere (cuban, alfresco). The appetizer menu could be better but their lunch menu is tasty, especially the chicken salad sandwich (they put Jicama in it...yumm). Definitely a neighborhood gem.
author: Antonia W.

description: What a great gem tucked away near North Beach.  After a couple drinks you would think you were lost in Spain somewhere as the decor has a warm and charming Spanish look and feel to it.  They offer a wide selection of cigars (more on the expensive side), but if you are like me, and have had a few too many drinks you are MORE than happy to spend money on an expensive cigar.  The music is always great, and had a fun time cha-cha-cha'ing the night away with the GF - she was very patient while I danced more on her feet than on the dance floor itself.  Every time I have gone to CB the crowd has been friendly and quite diverse.  I never feel like the odd ball being over thirty.  One of my favorite places in San Francisco.
author: Kyle W.

description: It's a cool little spot to have drinks and/or dinner.  The courtyard is a nice place to hangout on a warm night if you don't mind all the smokers out there.  Then again you're in a place call THE CIGAR BAR what did you expect?
author: Brian H.

description: Great, Great, Great spot to find a corner and just relax. I heart. I come here maybe two or three times a year and always tell myself every time I'm on my way out that I really need to frequent this place more often.
author: Annie T.

description: Love this place. Great music, diverse crowd, nice venue.
author: Jenny K.

description: i'm sure it's a blast if you want to get plastered after work and smoke a pack of cigarettes while you do so, but "Cigar Bar" is poor name choice because I guarantee anyone looking for a Cigar Bar in San Francisco will be disappointed like my buddy and I were. Cigar menu on website was inaccurate, cocktail servers as opposed to table service were arguing over who got our tab because one "helped" us pick out cigars (didn't know what she was talking about) and an entitled bartender made it obvious that he was inconvenienced by having to bring us a dessert we ordered. Then when we engaged him about ordering something else he dismissed us with "i'll tell your waitress" which he didn't. oh i forgot to mention that after wandering the place for 15 minutes without being engaged by staff we took it upon ourselves to go find some menus. I'll be giving Occidental all of my business.
author: Kevin L.

description: This place is really fun. I love that it's a bit hidden but once inside it's spacious with a large outdoor area and tons of seating and standing room (except on the dance floor). It reminds me of something you'd find in New York. I'm pretty sure they only have a cover when they have bands playing, but it's actually worth it once inside because they make up for it with strong drinks and plenty of room to hang out all night.
author: Sara W.

description: sophisticated and sexy...........live band.  outdoor smoking area............parking is a bia though, gotta scavenge for it........
author: BENADICK F.

description: Great place... seems kinda poshy but actually very relaxed, though polished atmosphere.  Great latin jazz playing inside and though I haven't experienced it, the bartender had a program out for when they had live bands scheduled to play.  The patio area is great, plenty of heaters and tables, exit access to the street, and a pool table, only missing music on the patio.  There's also a pool table inside.  As far as food is concerned, I only tried the appetizers but they were great.  The cocktail drinks were fine, but nothing especially great.  I'll probably go back just to doublecheck!  =)
author: Imelda M.

description: 4 dollars for hefeweisen pints is my type of place. Live music some nights, lots of people and plenty of cigars to buy. This is the ideal place to head right after work to relax.  Clearly if you do not like the smell of cigars in the air, you should look elsewhere.  My other advise is to hold your beer tightly if you walk through the dance area during salsa night.  Inevitably, someone will bang into you, so be prepared and guard that beer.  Cigar Bar has good mojitos as well but they are served in those long narrow glasses.
author: Jason M.

description: This place is fun. Nice space (kind of feels like you're showing up at a house party), spanish motiff, great layout, and get this-- you can actually go to a club, drink alcohol, and [gasp] have a smoke without feeling like a leper!! Unbelievable. The patio at this place is a really nice feature-- great place to relax and take a break from the small and crowded salsa floor. The crowd here was pretty cool and mellow. Didn't get much of the "meat market" vibe that other people were mentioning. Relatively compared to other clubs in the city, The Cigar Bar is more like a "lunch meat platter". Probably because there were sprinklings of mid aged folks here. I was also pleasantly surprised to find that it wasn't heavy on the typical financial district/ marina, we are all mindless clones, type of crowd. Really refreshing. Oh, I have to say that bartender made *the best* Negroni I have ever had.
author: Gerald U.

description:
So I have mixed feelings about cigar bar.  I loved going there for happy hour, just a stroll away from my droning job.  Great drinks and packed with energy.  But I went there the other night and I was left a little disappointed.  First off, being a chick I'm not a big fan of cover charge.  Its a great way to keep the ratio even for guys but I mean, charge too many girls cover and they head to the place next door that doesn't.  Especially since I'm technically paying for that aroma of cigar stink to stick to my hair. 

 Anywhoo, I did enjoy the live music on Saturday night.  It seemed to be the only thing keeping the place jumpin.  I really got the vibe on the patio that the crowd was a loungin.  Almost like that vibe after a family dinner.  Everyone's just loungin around talkin after a nice plate.  Which is great and all just not my type of vibe when I'm going out.  

All in all, I'll keep comin here for happy hour, but i'll be spendin my cover money somewhere else on the weekends...
author: Carina A.

description: Came here to get some drinks, and I liked the layout of the place.  The indoor/outdoor area is a nice touch, plus you can smoke cigars!  The drinks were pretty decent and the bartenders were quick and attentive for the crowd at the bar. There was a cover on the Saturday night we were there, but I didn't see a band playing when I came in and thought it was sort of lame to charge a cover.  I wouldn't be opposed to going back to this place, but I probably wouldn't seek it out.
author: Kristine C.

description: If it's sunny this is a great spot to come for mojitos. Nab a table outside and enjoy the weather!
author: Sarah R.

description: Good drinks and food. A great open place to smoke and be merry with your friends. Although the evening ended in financial hell, it was the spot to pick for our friend's farewell Happy Hour.
author: Jamie L.

description: Definitely a cool place to hangout. There's nothing like sitting in an outside courtyard on a chilly night in January, beer in one hand, cigarette in the other, surrounded by good people and warm heaters.
author: Justin B.

description: Good drinks, excellent food, relaxing ambiance, samba music in the background, you can smoke (if you want to buy cigars they have then there), and for North Beach a surprisingly low douchbag content.
author: Beth M.

description: I had the most horrible experience in this bar,,the manager  is extremely rude with the people especially with women,,I got really scare there and I do not think i could came back there ever,,plus people under age got there and nobody control it.I do not recommend this place.
author: claudia b.

description: I have a serious hangover, no thanks to this place.  It took about 30+ minutes of having an empty drink, for us to get another.  Typical crowd, bad service, and the food wasn't that good either.  Go anywhere else, but don't waste your time here.  However to be fair, it was a Friday night in the financial.
author: Justin N.

description: Ok, so I didn't come here for the cigars; you have a better chance of succeeding to tickle yourself (unless you're "Tickle me Elmo") than persuading me to smoke ;-) but I did come here for salsa! The atmosphere is pretty nice, and even though the dance floor is not that big, I still had a good time because the music was great. Overall, the place is decent if you want to come for a smoke, a few drinks, and to just kick back with friends. However, I don't think I'll come back, unless I learn to tolerate cigarette smoke better.
author: Narina A.

description: We left before the live music started, but we otherwise enjoyed lounging in the patio area with happy hour sangrias in hand.  Our server was extremely nice when I asked for bandages, remembering to bring a couple for me after she set the drinks on the table.  Cigar smoke wafted over from another table, encasing us both in a cloud of tobacco, as we sipped and caught up on each others lives.  There were some groups of men smoking and drinking, but there were definitely more large groups of mixed sex co-workers and friends enjoying a casual drink on a nice Friday afternoon.
author: Janet L.

description: I love this place especially if its a beautiful day in SF.  IT is by far one of the most chill bars with an array of options for the drinker and the smoker.  The drinks during happy hour are well priced and the appetizers they serve are quite delicious.  A must go to place for happy hour.
author: Charles C.

description: Cover charges are lame, but I'll assume that 100% of the charge goes to pay the band providing the live music (which I did enjoy) and let the cover charge issue pass.  Live salsa music was great.  We got there before things got crowded, so we grabbed a table in a corner outside (good for people watching) and ordered drinks with ease from the waitress.  The St. Germain cocktail is worth trying if you're into champagne cocktails.  Cigar smoke wasn't too overwhelming outside.  But at some point, the laid back patrons left and it turned into a meat market - fun to watch, but that's about it.  So we left.  As far as cigar bars go, I prefer Occidental, but that's more of a laid back, old timey, intimate kind of place - less of a hot-chicks/dudes-trying-to-find-someone-else's-pants-to-get-into kind of place.  Though this place would be better for larger groups.
author: Kristen H.

description: Really nice location, incredible patio, the best mojitos in North Beach and one of the only options in this neighborhood to dance to latin beats with live bands. However the dance-floor is not big enough and it might be too yuppie-friendly for some.
author: Juan d.

description: Having always liked this place for reasons that everyone on here seems to be writing about is why I agreed to go down there this past Saturday where there would be a birthday party.  The reason to go is for the live music, but this past Saturday..the band..I don't know who they were, but they were not latin people.  They were white and not very good musicians and they also left pretty early.  The party does not stop at 12am!
author: Erik M.

description: I threw my husband's birthday here.  Daniela the event coordinator was super helpful in the planning process.  She was there the night of the event as well and made sure everything went smoothly.  The chef prepared great appetizers and an AMAZING red velvet cake.  I would definitely recommend the Cigar Bar as a fun, festive event venue.
author: Kathryn E.

description: Their mojitos are perfection. Not too sweet, just strong enough - just how I like 'em. Great place to come after work... unique atmosphere, fun salsa music.
author: Christine K.

description: Went last night with a girlfriend. Even though I don't smoke I really liked it. Reminded me a bit of Blake's in Berkeley but with grown ups! Kinda underground and thank God open air for the smoke to rise. I could be a biased because one of my all time favorite bands, Los Mocosos was playing. Small dance floor, ok by me. Not too much room to screw up your dance moves! Cool venue with antiques, reminding me of my Grandma's old hutch. Restroom...clean! Great mix of people on a Saturday night. There was even a group of guys for a bachelor party and a group of girls for a bachelorette party.  Parking garages nearby. Definitely will come back, especially if a great band is playing!
author: foxy b.

description: Great mojitos... perfect with a cigar... Nice bartenders... And fantastic real deal cuban music.
author: Erin Leigh M.

description: It's 12:30, not completely packed and the place decides not to let anymore people in...what the heck!...Felix the door guy is definitely not the man.
author: Jen C.

description: Nice open patio, good art work. Poor service, rude doorman, weak pours for drinks. Salsa music is very high quality, with the dance floor and band in same small room with no stage to separate them, music is the best part of this bar.
author: Hamayun N.

description: I like this place because they have beer (I like) and cigars (I like). There isn't a large variety, but it's a fun social setting. When you walk down the stairs, you are inside the bar. You can purchase your cigar and then a drink and head out to the courtyard. The area is open air for the cigar smoking. After you have completed your cigar, you can continue on to the far end of the bar where there is likely a live band playing. This is a very happening place for those who like to blend cigars and alcohol. I recommend it!
author: Andrew Y.

description: I like the large outdoor patio and the uncluttered indoor area.  I didn't like paying cover but their drinks were reasonably priced and fairly stiff.  Non-alcoholic drinks are FREE!  The salsa band was ok and they have a (small) dance floor.  The place never really picked up eventhough we were there on a Friday night.
author: Shyam P.

description:
surprisingly nice...
got dragged here by a friend who was chasing some girl around the city. she ended up leaving but we stayed to admire the place. the crowd is non-pretentious, everyone seemed like they were having a good time either on the dance floor or outside in the villa-ish patio. nice ambiance all around.

drinks are good. anywhere that serves hangar one vodka is fine by me.
author: Scarlet S.

description: Cigars. Libations. Outdoor patio. Latin bands. The night I was at Cigar Bar, four different groups of friends said they were also at Cigar Bar. Could this be true? Where were they..? Was it that crowded...? I guess thats what happens after tequila shots.
author: Kris O.

description: It was okay, and I just say okay...  If you smoke, this is the place for you, yet the cougars are out in full effect I'll have you know.  This is a place that you would go with a group of pals, not so much a solo location.  Skip going on a date here, not worth it, yet they do have these water cooler things set up all over the bar which is nice.
author: Nicole F.

description: Came for a happy hour-birthday party.  I love this place for happy hour because it's huge and spacious and they have a big outdoor patio.
author: L C.

description:
sometimes you just feel like sitting outside at a table with a beer and a pack of cigarettes.  i can do that here.

i can also salsa if i wanted to but that doesn't seem to happen often.
author: Lindsay T.

description: Okay, so I took Charisse F. here on one of our date nights... A nice dinner, some drinks, and a cigar with an after dinner brandy. Oops. Its a bar that serves food, and caters to the after work crowd. Which is totally cool, but damn, I felt stupid. We had fun anyways, and continue to go back for drinks and a cigar!
author: Eric P.

description: There was no cover tonight, dunno if that was from the fact that it was a Thursday night or because I was there for a law school mixer.  Since it was an organized event, it was a bit crowded and with 5 law schools, you could hear the crowd outside in the back area from a block away, literally. I had a white wine which was quite good, but then again, I like my wines a little more sweet so it was just right for me, but maybe not for someone else. If I come back, I'd definitely stick with staying inside since I don't like cigarette/cigar smoke to start with.  The place itself was nice I thought.
author: ML N.

description: For a Friday salsa, this place is tops. The mojito is well mixed with fresh cut mint. A nice place to unwind for salsa dancers with not much dancing but socializing. I enjoy the Cuban bands that play everytime, and my non-salsa friends love them.
author: Sandra M.

description: Good food, flat soda, poor service, OK cigar selection, poor humidor, good beer selection and Latin music.  Cannot smoke cigars inside where TV is. Went on Mon night to watch football, have a drink and a nice cigar.  Did not get to do any.  Can only smoke in outdoor patio. I won't be back.
author: Frank D.

description: I really wish I could have given this place a 3.5 stars.  Not sure where the grill in Cigar Bar and Grill comes from, I have never seen anyone eating here.  The place is decent when you get in, but the place is out of the way, has a cover, and getting drinks is nearly impossible.  But, you get to smoke cigars.  There are a couple of rooms around the courtyard and inside of the bar if you want to reserve them.  So, this place seems like a good place for a get together.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Fun, fun, fun! Been here for a few birthday parties. Hate Smoke, but our guy friends love Smoking Cigars. Open outside/Inside area for smokers where the non-smokers can still enjoy. The bands, the two times I've been there have been Urban Latin/salsa. LOVED it. A little pricey and I think the waitress added on more drinks then we actually had on the bill, but really enjoyed the place.
author: D K.

description: I hate smoke.  I really hate cigar smoke.  That said, it doesn't really bother me that much here.  They do a really good job of keeping the place well ventilated and there is a nice open courtyard to hang out in.  Good for a big get together.  The drinks are pretty good.  Casual atmosphere.  They also have salsa dancing which is cool.  It's not like a club though, so if you want to dance, bring a date.
author: apple r.

description: The cigar bar is awesome when you crash parties - haha. Went here on Thursday for a legal function, but saw that some real estate function had free food and free drinks. I mingled with some people but chickened out to sign in. But, luckily I came with brave friends who did and I ate part of their meat platter. Then crashed the party i was supposed to crash and ate quesadillas and salsa and chips. Cigar bar is the perfect place to go when it's nice out, so that you can sit at their lounge. And, they have drink specials on their chalkboard.
author: Natalie S.

description: When i asked, where are we going on New Years Eve and all i got was "the Cigar Bar", the first thing that crossed my mind was "smoke filled rooms-older people"  but oh well, they said it was only $20 bucks cover and had a live salsa band (besides they were going to give us a ride in a limo so i said what the hell lol) I was pleasantly surprised. It was a great place, with a great vibe, cool crowd, nice patio with different lounge areas and a great live band with great tasting mojitos. I will definetely come back, the atmosphere, non pretentious, with plenty of room to laid back and have a few drinks.
author: Martin V.

description: If you are a smoker (and you know who you are) this is a great spot to commune with your own kind. A decent selection of cigars, several pool tables and a very friendly crowd make this one of the hidden gems of Jackson square.
author: Stellah D.

description: Nice space, good indoor-outdoor mix. Very international feel. E-mail Manager Mat if you are throwing a group party at this place and he'll set you up with a deal. Good, strong drinks. Would have been five stars had the bartenders not been so rude last night.
author: jodes l.

description: I like the outdoor seating and they served my jack and diets nice and stiff.  Since i stumbled out of there a couple of hours later, I think they did me right.  I don't smoke cigars but the bruschetta was tasty.
author: Seong P.

description: I went here a few times for work happy hours.  I do like the outdoor patio area and its a lot of fun, but sometimes it does get too crowded.  I remember that I liked the wine selection, the mojitos and the selection of appetizers.  I wish they'd have a larger seating area, but overall, this is a good happy hour spot.
author: Aaron M.

description: What a great spot! The atmosphere is warm, although the ceilings are a bit low. Strong drinks, too.
author: Tamara M.

description: the place is fantastic. You dont have to drink or dance to have a good time. The people there are all friendly and the band that plays there is fantastic. I love watching the crowd mix it up and dance they are crazy good. If you want to find a good place to cap off your night go here. Parking is sketchy but then its a right of passage into north beach if you can find one. The cigar choices are small...but I only like one kind and couldn't find it ;)
author: Naureen H.

description: I had my 22nd birthday party here last year and it was a great time. Walk down the stairs and into a salsa dancing scene that is hard to beat in SF. The drink prices are reasonable, and the ability to smoke cigars on the outdoor patio sets this place above everything else. They easily accommodated my party of 25 and everyone had a great time. Great music, better atmosphere, A+!
author: Darius T.

description: This place is cool.  Reasonably priced and cool staff.  This is one of the best places to change it up and smoke a great cigar!
author: George M.

description: This place has a great atmosphere.  Really like the outdoor patio (with pool table) and live salsa bands.
author: Wesley W.

description: When I first moved to the city almost five years ago I went on a tour of all of the smoking-allowed bars in the city. This was one of the best, along with Black Horse London Pub on Union (no longer allows smoking). Once settled I started looking for this place and was unable to find it, until just recently when I discovered that my new apartment was just up to street from it. I love this bar on quiet weeknights, it's a great spot to escape from the mess that happens on the streets of North Beach every night. The patio is pleasant and comfortable and the crowd is great. Anybody that has a problem with the smoke should be glad that they no longer allow smoking indoors, as they had when I first visited.
author: Katherine C.

description: This place is okay...... I met some friends here and we had a good time but I don't know if I would consider this a place I'd like to go back to. It can be a bit crowded and they don't really have music or anything. The crowd seems really yuppy and FiDi/Marina-esque.  I kind of prefer to be around people who aren't so full of themselves.
author: Cathy T.

description:
we had reservations for a large party. when we got there, they told us we couldnt make reservations for drinks and appetizers, just dinner. so we stole some chairs and a table from a big table marked 'reserved'. we got caught, but acted casual, and the rest of the evening went smoothly. 

the nachos are expensive, but DELICIOUS. the atmosphere is fun, and the men are pretty. i will be back.
author: tulipa L.

description: Nice bar.  I like that you can buy a cigar here and order a drink and then take it outside to the courtyard and talk amongst your friends, or with others...it's that kind of place.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
i wish i could break up and rate this place in distinct parts:

- 5 stars for the awesome courtyard patio. on a cooler night, there are powerful heaters, on a warm night it would be freakin' awesome.
- 4 stars for the live music
- 3 stars for the ditzy wait staff who like to forget what you ordered and totally rush you, and for the mediocre food (it's edible bar food but not as good as i would have imagined)
- 2 stars for the idiot bartender who forgets what type of drink they're making in the middle of making it

and is a $3 cover really necessary? i'm guessing the average amount spent per person is a good deal greater than that.
author: Jon N.

description: Great happy hour scene.  The place is surprisingly big with a great patio. the design of the bar/restaurant reminds me kind of the way some of the "pincho"/tapas bars are like in northern Spain..except there's no hanging slabs of pork.  The bartenders were nice..gave me and my friend free drinks when some dork dropped & broke his pint glass next to us. We were drinking Black Label and were nearly finished with it.then the bartender just got us another round..free.  Plus the music was good too..if you like salsa/merengue/latin jazz.
author: Don C.

description: My friend hosted a party for his fiancee here recently.  The food was good, the live music was great, and your smoking friends can sit outside and enjoy a cigar on their laid-back patio.
author: Max C.

description: I was pleasantly surprised to find the Cigar Bar very spacious with a nice decor. The large patio is obviously the best selling point for this bar, but the food looked to be decent too, although I didn't eat. They even have a pool table in the back room and nice leather couches in the adjacent room. Interesting crowd to say the least, but if you come with your own group, you can try to ignore the others...
author: Nicolas H.

description: After a night of eating good Italian food at pretty much any legitimate restaurant in north beach, it's always nice to end the night at the cigar bar.  If you're into cigars, they have a great outdoor area where Cigar lovers can congregate and enjoy their cigars.  Furthermore, when they have music, it's great!  The last time I was there, there was a great cuban group playing.  Other than all that, the bartenders haven't failed me.
author: Jonathan V.

description: Well... minus the smell of cigars...and the too small dance floor.  If you are lucky enough to grab a prime spot.  this pace has wonderful music. a fun and efficient bar. and it is filled with people that love to dance...and not in that kind of marina grindin' sort of way...  Basically, this bar has good taste and you'll enjoy even better company...and even if you aren't a smoker...you might find yourself lighting up a stogies just for good Ole times sake!
author: Whitney K.

description: Everything was muy caliente!! Great food and fabulous live salsa music! Dance floor was small but can't complain!
author: Littleone P.

description: two places in one.  The patio area is for the cigar types and the inside was home to a fun latin band a lot o' dancing on a Friday night.
author: Matt T.

description:
this is a really fun place to go with a pack of salsa-dancing, cigar (ette)smokin' friends! i love the live band, the atmosphere, the courtyard, and the location. i brought a bunch of my friends who were in town and we danced the night away and sat in the center coutyard laughing and smoking like chimnies!
(-) 1 * b/c it takes sooooooo damn long to get a drink!
author: Sam P.

description: Decent selection of cigars (but prices a bit high) and I love being able to sit outside with a cocktail and smoke my cigar.  Chaos on weekend nights but this place in a great after-work spot for drinks and a smoke.  I've never eaten anything here although I've heard it's not  bad.  The after-work crowd is going to be white men in suits and ties for the most part but they're harmless.  Remember- Avoid this place on the weekend nights.  I like walking over here after work for a drink/cigar when the days are long and sit outside.
author: Spidermonkey J.

description: I first went to this place when it first opened and thought it was a great, chill place to listen to live music and smoke a cigar - especially since smoking is pretty much banned anywhere in SF. There's an inside bar section and an open patio with a bunch of tables and heat lamps. Bartenders aren't terribly friendly and the crowd can sometimes be mixed. If you're with a group of friends, stick with them. I've come back a few times and always had a great time. 4 stars on the establishment itself but they get downgraded 1 star for the cover. For a bar that is mostly a happy hour destination, they shouldn't charge a cover, especially before 10pm. I don't suggest being suckered into paying the cover (even though I've done it a few times). It's just not worth it. Go down the street to the Bubble Lounge and you can smoke on their patio for free!
author: Josephine H.

description: When a friend announced that she was having her birthday at the Cigar Bar I was very leery of her venue choice. But we had a great time. Our waitress was amazing, she may have been one of the best servers I have encountered in my travels.  The atmosphere is great, even though I have to say the food is just average. I had the salmon, which was okay, I bet the pulled pork is the way to go, I shouldn't have tried to be healthy.
author: Seamus M.

description: Happy Hour! Now that were entering summer, the occasional warm sunny afternoon creeps through San Francisco and screams Cigar Bar. Its an absolute must on a weekday after a long day pitched in a battle for a fort night developing the kings thirst for the frosty brew. Some folks leave the office and go to the bar, some leave the office and go home, to each their own, but Cigar Bar is how you live the dream.
author: Michael G.

description: Came here last night with some friends. Cute place, nice bartenders, strong drinks. There was a live salsa band too. Very chill atmosphere and they have a nice selection of cigars for folks that enjoy those things.
author: Linda N.

description: Do not go here for the food.  It is so not worth it.  Its basic bar food that is skimpy on the portions and comes with a high ticket price.  This is however, the place to go on a hot summer night...to listen to the live music, sip a martini and smoke the night away with good friends.  There is a charge about this place that makes on feel alive.  It is rather small inside and can get full very quickly so its best to try to beat the crowds and secure your spot early...
author: Yasmine D.

description:
this is not a cigar bar!!!! if you are going to smoke a cigar think again. they don't care about you. they charge $7.00 cover and even though there is no place to sit and smoke a cigar on the frigid outdoor patio and you are only there three minutes they will not refund your cover charge. both management and doorman could not have been more rude.
if you are looking for a dance club this might be it if you are looking for a cirar bar this is not it. it should be against the law to falsely advertise.
author: Keith R.

description: Once upon a time, about 7 or 8 years ago I was leaving a restaurant in North Beach accompanied by a lovely lady.  I was a tourist back then, before having moved to the bay so I didn't really know the city (San Francisco) all that well besides random vacations growing up.
