With our bellies full and a smile on our face we started walking around looking for something to do.  Then I heard it, a distant conga drum making its way down the alley, then a trumpet, then some more percussion...and finally a sweet smell of tobacco.  I felt like I was somewhere in Miami and then followed my nose to this great establishment.  Classy, Comfortable, Friendly and all out FUN!  I've been such a loyal fan of this place that I've hosted two of my birthday parties here and come on a constant basis.  Cigar Bar has been one of my favorites all throughout San Francisco ever since then and recommend it to anybody who's looking to smoke a cigar, have a great cocktail (good mojitos and decent rum selection, try their Venezuelan rum selection) or dance salsa if you know how to.  Think Miami feel in a cold breeze.
author: Carlos S.

description: This is a fun place to check out right in Jackson square off the strip clubs. They usually have some latin music going. There are always a varirty of age groups present and it's a fun place to go dancing or play pool. There is a large outdoor patio for smokers and a place to relax to get some fresh air, especially in the summertime.
author: Amy H.

description: I love this place. I've been going since 2001. I don't think I can play liars dice anywhere else. I got to thank my boss from Wells Fargo Bank for teaching me the ropes of liars dice. It's been a good 5 year boot camp. Now I can play in the real world. Plus this place has upped my alcohol tolerance. The live music and food is outstanding.
author: Ni G.

description: On principle I don't usually like these type of places (because they seem to attract a sleazy sort of male species) but since it was a Samba party I had a blast! The caipirinhas were great too! I like the outdoor open courtyard, when you need some fresh air from the sweaty dance floor it's nice and refreshing (except there were many men smoking the eponymous cigars which was kinda stinky). I can't say anything about the food since we didn't eat but the tacos some guy at the bar was eating looked tasty. I hope they have another samba party soon! It's a bit intimidating to get out on the dance floor since there was a big Brazilian contingent there (and these girls know how to shake it! It must be in their DNA or something) but it's not a competitive atmosphere at all, everyone was just having fun.
author: lani P.

description: Me gusto mucho! See Mom, all those trips to Mexico paid off!
author: Laurie A.

description: This place is good for groups.  Good food and good music.  Fully stocked bar.  It gets pretty busy later on in the night (after 11) so it makes it a little difficult to get a drink.  There are cigars available to purchase and smoke outdoors.  I'm definitely a fan of this place.  The only bad thing I have to say about this place is that parking is really difficult (street parking only).  There's a parking lot across the street which isn't too bad, kinda pricey though.
author: Erika B.

description: Whether you want to kick back with some friends or host a party this is a great place.  Interior is rustic, warm and relaxing. They have a private lounge, two pool tables and an outdoor patio for those who want to enjoy the fine tastes and smells of a cohiba.  The weekends are bumpin' with live music (usually Latin Jazz.  The Josh Jones Quartet plays frequently) and the drinks are always flowin'.  The food is good and it's not just bar food.  They have some enticing rustic dishes.  I've only had the appetizers and they were good.  Neil, the head chef and a partner, comes to Cigar Bar by way of MC2 and Elizabeth Daniel. You'll usually find Neil and his business partner Matt in the kitchen or behind the bar.
author: Keith S.

description:
um.  they charge a $7.00 cover past 9:15pm.  

i arrived at 9:30pm to join a group of 20 friends inside for a going away party.  

i was told i wasnt on the "guest list".  

deeming it a serious low point to my already very long day, i left.
author: Kristin K.

description:
love, love, love the cigar bar!
must haves are the ceviche and bruschetta! finger-licking good!

on a crowded night, its hard to get any help and the bar is usualyl way too crowded to try and put in a food order. however, the bartender that is usually on the far right....is super nice.

pomegrante margaritas are the bomb and all drinks are super charged!

great place to hang out with guys and girls...not mention there is a live band, usually salsa.
author: cynthia g.

description: For a Wednesday evening this place was tops. The mojito was well stirred with fresh cut mint, and the CEVICHE came on perfect crisps with an organic salad and delightful light citrus sauce. The company was unassuming, as was any cigar smoke (?). A nice place for business dates or social gathering (outside patio). (response to more reviews:  The service is not following the corporate handbook; the servers live their lives, and a customer is not their top priority. I believe, as long as they're treated like people, they will probably get everything out on time, and with high quality, and maybe a smile.)
author: Molly L.

description: I love this place for happy hour. When it's warm outside, their outdoor patio is awesome for hanging out with friends. Place is pretty crowded at 5:30-6:00pm on a Friday during the summer with financial district folks, but starts to thin out around 7pm. My friends always request this place the most out of Financial District happy hour spots.
author: Jeff L.

description:
My coworker and I went to the Cigar Bar Grill after work on October 9, 2009 to have some drinks.  On the way to the place, we picked up some cigars from a store near our work in downtown.  We got there around 5pm and the waitress told us about discount happy hours drinks and appetizers.  We picked a table (table 75) outside at the court yard to smoke.   At 7pm one other friend showed up.  About 8pm the waitress came running in a panic mode toward our table.  She asked if we saw the people at the table in front of us (table 73).  All three of us said no.  She said they took off without paying and it was a big tab.  At this time we had total of 10 drinks and 4 appetizers and we bought one cigar from bar for our friend.  Later on we recognized some friends at the wedding rehearsal  the night before.  We bought them drinks (10 drinks total).   At this point our tab should include 20 drinks, 1 cigar and 4 appetizers.   At 10pm two more friends joined us.  This time they were charging cover charges, $7 each so it should have been $14.  We told them to put the $14 charge on the tab.  So now there are five people at our table.  We ordered 5 shots of taquila plus 1 for the waitress.    We left at around 11:30 and they gave us a bill for $862.  They didn't give us a receipt.  Our tab should have been around $350.  So I called the following Monday and asked for the receipt.   The lady (Daniela) was nice enough to mail me the receipt.  I received it in the mail on Wednesday same week.  I called the store on Wed, no one answered the phone so I left a message.   I didn't hear back so I called them again on Thursday.  This time a guy name Neil picked up the phone.   He stated that he's a manager there.   I told him about the dispute and wanted to go over the bill item by item.   He said to call him back in 5 minutes.  So I called him back and he said his waitresses told him that we were paying for table 73 and 75.  I said no, we were sitting at one table all night.  Table 73 took off without paying.  We are not responsible for that.   He said he would call me back the next day before 5pm.   I didn't hear from Neil the next day so my friend and I went over to the place after work around 5pm with the itemized bill hoping to see Neil.   First the bartender told us Neil was in the back room.  We said to go get him.  He came back and told us Neil went to the bank and will be back in 5, 10 minutes.  We said we would wait.   After 20 mins, bartender came to us and said that Neil won't be back for another 3 hours.  He said Neil would call the moment he gets back.   He didn't call that night.   We didn't get a chance to explain and to dispute.  We wanted to show him what we ordered and what was over charged.  Neil didn't give us that chance.  He was hiding from us.   We were over charged over $400.  The waitress (Kelly)  gave herself  over $140 tips.  They charged us full prices instead of Happy Hours prices.  Most items were ordered during Happy Hours.   It was a dirty trick that the waitress pulled on us.  And the management is no better off.  A bunch of crooks.  Be careful with your order next time when you go there.   Don't give them the credit card in advance.  
On the bill they charged us $123 for cigars, $50 cover charge, 4 appetizers,  48 drinks and over $140 tips.   Don't trust this place.    And of course we stopped payment on the credit card charge.  I would give it a zero star.
author: Hank C.

description: The Cigar Bar is a really cool place to chill and relax with friends. My honey and I took our friends here for the first time and they really enjoyed the atmosphere. The bartender was helpful with our drinks,and really knew his stuff when it came to the cigars. The music is always good , it's good to see a pretty mix crowd. We sat outside to enjoy our cigar and everyone is really friendly. We would have couples on each side of us introducing themselves and ask what kind of cigar we are smoking. Nice friendly conversations. We always enjoy ourselves every time we go.
author: Janette D.

description: So happy I went to this bar Saturday night.  They had a Salsa band there, left before it got really good I am sure.  Will have to check to see if they have live Jazz.  Nothing like sitting, sippin a single malt, smokin a fine stogie and listening to good Jazz.  Some bartenders were better with the alcohol to soda mixture than others.  All in all, it's a great place to go on a nice night.
author: Shawn S.

description: I love this place. i have been coming here for years (ya I'm only 21, i have a nearly twin older sister) any who my all time favorite place. I love that its cozy, and intimate. when I first came to this bar it wasn't too busy and lets just say they have the most friendly staff. Especially Neil, the owner I believe, he still to this day remembers me. Oh and the food here is great and okay priced. love love love the pool table, that's how i get my drinks. live bands are a nice treat too.
author: Christina D.

description: We've been here a couple of times over the last few years. This place would get 4 stars if the layout was better. I always feel like I can't get there soon enough to get a table and when I'm standing I'm always in someone's way. I think I like the later scene better then the HH scene.  The live music is good but I've always too drunk to really critique
author: All About Town ..

description: We went here with a group of people and had a private room. I had never been there. The food was actually really good. The Hot Chicken wings was good. calamari was also good. There Fish Taco was OK. I had the grilled Shrimp Risotto which was pretty good. The best is at Nordstrom cafe Downtown. I would go back there one day. The waiters were nice.
author: Ge I.

description: The Cigar Bar & Grill is a rather unpretentious looking place around a patio. with live music a few times a week. It serves decent food, nice cocktails and cigars to a well-heeled crowd. Not bad.
author: Rene V.

description: Good Times!! I am assuming I had a blast last night.
author: Solbiato S.

description:
I love this place.  Great mojitos, tasty guacamole and excellent live band on Friday and Saturday nights!  It's a great venue for a large group, as there are various rooms with seating and outdoor patio seating with a pretty fountain in the center.

It's a great time for all!!!
author: Marivic T.

description: We booked the pool room for a private party this weekend, and it was an all-around positive experience. A few recommendations: (1) opt for the courtyard room(s) if possible. they're gorgeous and semi-private; the pool room is small and very close to the salsa band, inviting people into your space, where they are prone to awkwardly personal conversations and/or groping. (2) don't order the full party-size cheese plate. It came with a cheese so stinky that we, a room full of stinky-cheese-loving food-loving eaters, covered it in napkins and finally transported it to a garbage can far from the small pool room space.
author: Celeste L.

description:
since i don't smoke cigars...i can't really appreciate this place...
the drinks are ok, it's really a place where guys from work would enjoy....as you can tell by other reviews how these women are raving about young professional men.
author: sarah m.

description: We recently had my girlfriends birthday party on a Friday night there. It was crowded with a cool crowd. we reserved the back room but found that when we weren't in there there was no one keeping other people out. The band was great and the dance floor had a lot of energy.
author: j k.

description:
Amazing Food ! Who'd a guessed it ? The cuban pork sandwich is to die for ! 

BTW, forget the Mojitos and Caparinas ! There wine, whiskey and cognac selection is pretty impressive.
author: elizabeth m.

description: This is only the second place in the City where you can smoke - granted, you can only smoke in the courtyard, or the little room adjacent to the courtyard. Is this place even a secret anymore? The drinks are good, the food is unknown - I've had a few appetizers but that's it. Stogie selection is okay, but you can bring your own. For an establishment with cigar in it's name, this place draws a lot of talent. Get there early and avoid the cover. Music is great too - usually some variation of jazz.
author: Henry F.

description:
I hosted my friends bachelor party in the Pool Room last weekend and we all had a great time.  The atmosphere was great and our hostess Sarah was very attentive.  It was kind of a bummer she left at 11, as we were on our own for bar service.  We managed just fine though.  

The food and drink was very good.  We only ordered appetizers but they were pretty big platters.  The beers on tap were a little limited, but again, we managed just fine as they a fully stocked bar and very capable bar staff.

The patio area was great.  We had a table reserved for the party.  The music from the live band inside and the din of people provided for a nice place to enjoy a pretty good selection of cigars.

One thing I must comment on was that they didn't have a very good way of alerting the general public that our room was reserved for a private party.  We had people wandering in all night asking to play pool or just to get away from the crowd.  Towards the end of the night, two random people crashed on our couch and started having a go at each other.  We finally gave up and headed out to the patio.

In all, we really did enjoy the Cigar Bar and Grill and would certainly come back.
author: Darrin B.

description: Hands down, this is my favorite bar in SF!  Why?  It's always fun, no matter what.  They have great live music (Latin jazz etc) for dancing or just to enjoy as background music.  Mojitos that will kick your *&^% and plenty of other great drinks too.   Always a crowd that is fired up and very international too.  Lots of different spaces to hang out, which is rare in SF unless it's a huge nightclub - there is a courtyard with fountains, the room for the band/dancing, the bar, a pool table in back.  Good food.  Cool art on the walls.   Enough said!
author: Adrienne B.

description: Great place for a party.  We just a party here with about 50 people on a Friday night.  You can reserve one of the private-ish rooms (for a minimum tab or 50 bucks and hour) that opens onto their cute courtyard with a fountain.  Great for a large group when you want your own space to put down your stuff, but still want to mingle with the rest of the crowd.  Live Cuban music - very nice.  Nice bartenders, and I especially liked the water they have out for people on the way to the bathroom - hydration is important people!  Overall, I would definitely have another party here!
author: Bridget G.

description: it is a pretty cute place, it reminds me a bit of a place i have often been to in paris. I would give them 5 stars, if they would not charge a cover fee. I went there for a drink and had to pay to enter the club for the 20 minutes i stayed there.
author: Cianna X.

description: My favorite bar in San Francisco, hands down.  Lots of indoor and outdoor space, cool people, nice cigars and try the Elderflower drink.  Keep up the good work, Cigar Bar!
author: Chantelle E.

description: Had dinner as part of a bachelorette party here. They offered a family style meal including bread, salad, and entree for $20. It was definitely worth that much, if not more. Drinks were decent, not necessarily worth the price though. The other downside is that we were placed in the dining room (or entrance to the restaurant), every time someone opened the curtains to come into the restaurant cold air came rushing in. We had planned on staying for the band, but were freezing so ended up heading for a warmer bar.
author: heather v.

description: We had our company party at this little spot and turned out to be really FUN, of course the people made the difference but the bar itself was roomy with a heated outside patio to smoke your cigars and just chill. Definitely a chill spot with a good group of friends.
author: Padma K.

description: Establishments shut down after 5 pm in the Financial District, thus The Cigar Bar & Grill is an especially wonderful find in this part of town.  Old-world classy with a handsome, heated outside patio embellished with fountains, you can enjoy a cigar with your choice of poison.  They have everything from cognac to premium rums to a variety of Ports.  Their wine list is deliciously long as well.  Definitely try their caipirihna (Brazilian cocktail comprised of Brazilian white rum made from sugarcane, lime juice, and sugar).  The sangria is refreshing during those San Francisco Indian summers.  And, of course, what is a cigar bar without a well-stocked humidor?  I do not know much about cigars so I cannot vouch for it, but they have what looks to be a decent selection.  They serve food, but I do not remember what anything tastes like (a good Happy Hour does that).  There is a nice, sturdy pool table for hustlers.  Last but not least, there is live music on Thursdays with a focus on Latin--everything from salsa, samba and jazz..  It is a great venue, but a bit out of the way unless you work in the area.
author: Dee C.

description: love coming out the this place and smoking a cigar while sippin on a beer or cocktail. the outdoor area is so much fun especially on a thurs fri sat night. when theyve got the latin music going that place is really fun. I give it a 4 star review because being named the cigar bar you would think they would have a much larger cigar selection to choose from. I have to bring my own cigars from home but other than that its a wonderful spot to hang out in when you want to escape your normal bar or club.
author: nick h.

description: i recently went here for an alumni happy hour and was happy to find a place that i would def come back to... its very chill, low key - they have an outdoor patio area and a pool table in the back... sadly i got there late and we left shortly after reaching, but i do look fwd to going again at some point.. if my review changes i'll let u know!
author: Angeli J.

description: Nice hangout. I like the music inside, the patio experience, and the full bar. They use the space well, with a lounge area and fountains. Great place to take a date, especially one that smokes and/or dances. Never seen a line at the door, but parking's a bitch on weekend nights. Reasonable cover when there's a band.
author: Matt G.

description: thursday night ...appetizer especiale:....yuppie male..um   wid   .bad breath....cigarz stinkaroo arnold
author: miriam b.

description: My boyfriend had his birthday party there and we had a great time. The party on Saturday which was great because the Friday before we went to check out the cigar selection and it was completely packed with the after-work crowd, which would have been a little tricky with all our guests (we had about 30 people show up). On Saturday though it was a completely different situation. We rented out the parlor room for the evening but since it was such a nice night (a rare thing in October!) most of the guests ended up in the patio area. The party was also Casablanca themed which worked perfectly with the feel of the courtyard outside and the room we rented which was connected to the courtyard. The appetizers we ordered were great the wait-staff and bartender were super friendly. I would definitely recommend this venue for a party! Also the minimum is very reasonable compared to some of the other bars we looked into renting out. After work definitely has it's benefits as well.
author: Megan P.

description: came here on a Thurs after dinner and was so slap happy about the super fly and very groovy live latin band playing. unfortuantely, i was a little under the weather so did not get my groove on - but will surely go back when my booty is ready to shake!
author: Kate F.

description: this place is pretty fun on a saturday night.  they have a band playing salsa music, and there's a small dance floor.  very intimate and cute place...
author: Helen T.

description: Great Drinks, Lots of Yuppies, and good appetizers but the lack of a walk in humidor at a "cigar bar" and so-so service makes me say 3 stars...barely.
author: Art M.

description: very mediocre spot in the fidi.  food is nothing memorable.  it made me realize something-  i don't like cigars.  i can see the draw here though if you do....
author: Keri K.

description: I really like this place.  It's got a nice bar and a chill courtyard to have a relaxing smoke.  Live music on certain nights (Thur-Sat?) completes the place.  It would be a regular haunt if I lived closer.
author: J F.

description: When you work in the Financial District it isn't always easy to find a place that has good service, nice ambiance and affordable drinks for happy hour but..Cigar Bar meets all those qualifications. I'm not what anyone would ever consider a smoker or cigar aficionado but when I went to Cigar Bar last night I couldn't have been happier. My friend and I split an app and each had two drinks which were all great. The chips and guac and calamari are both delish. The bartender was great and everything was quick enough that I could enjoy it and still make it home from my commute at a decent hour. Check out the chalk board specials board for fun happy hour drinks, you can't lose out because they have a lot to choose from. The ambiance is like being at restaurant in Madrid and I'm a lover of anything that resembles Spain. Three star rating is just for the fact that despite how cool it is it's still a cigar bar and even if you're inside the smoke will find you somehow.
author: J D.

description: Went here Friday. Music was mediocre and it looked like most of the  people on the dance floor were "planted". Interesting layout and nice patio though.
author: Atish S.

description: absolutely a fab place to hang out and love love love the atmosphere! great drinks, fun times and good people!
author: Stephanie J.

description: Great venue.  There's an outdoor patio to chill at and often live salsa music.  Smoking is okay outside (and sometimes inside, depending on the crowd and time of night)  The space is rather large and it's rare that it fills up, which can be good or bad depending on what you're looking for.  If you'd like to try a new shot, ask Albert (tall skinny bartender from Taiwan) for a kamikaze Greek style.  Excellent.
author: Nate B.

description: Went here for the first time to celebrate a friend's birthday last night. It was an ok place, not really a bar but not really a restaurant either. Impressed with the seating space, they boast about the leather couches but if you are in a big group, the couches are not setup in a fashion that you can have a great conversation among more than 4 people. The drinks, nice in presentation but average. Plus a lot of fried food, good tasting but still how many calories can I take after having watched "Super Size Me" ! What I really liked about the place was the service, a really friendly and available waitress even though it got crowded at peak time of about 7 for a Tuesday night. All this qualified it for 4 stars but the management needs to learn one thing, they are located in San Francisco and its always cold here ! Please put some decent heating, I was so cold all the time there, its not difficult to install heaters and not expensive either if you own a bar ! Plus a bar that has an open space in the middle, you ought to have heating. Verdict, 3 stars !
author: Varun G.

description: If you are interested in looking at well dressed, pretty people, go here. If you are interested in dancing to great salsa music, look elsewhere, because the dance floor here is too small and gets way too crowded. And when the band takes a break, they don't play recorded salsa music, they just switch to background music -- which is kind of lame.
author: A. T.

description: I think this place is heaven. The drinks are spectacular, the service is phenomenal , the atmosphere is welcoming. I love the back patio and their food is tasty as well. They are also great with big groups.  I really recommend this place- so fun.
author: sarah s.

description: Had my husbands 30th b-day at CB&G and they were great!  The staff were all friendly & helpful (too bad it was Consuela's last night she was awesome!!)  We had a table on the patio and were able to get the side room w/ the tv and couch, very kick back.  The live band was great to dance to, the mojitos & sangria delicious.  Nothing but good times!
author: Leah A.

description: After reading the previous reviews, I expected to hv a nice experience on a Saturday nite. Friendliness stopped at the door, where I paid the $7 cover to hear a very good Cuban Salsa Band. Bartenders were unfriendly and service was extremely slow.
author: Bella B.

description: Full of a bunch of Marina/Downtown yuppies who hung out at Kells in their 20s but have now graduated to what they consider more sophisticated (and expensive) venues.  If you like watching men discuss stock options with large phalluses hanging from their mouths, this is your place.  Steer clear from the approximately 5'10" Asian bartender.  He's a prick and pours bad drinks.
author: Jim F.

description: well stocked bar, live band and dancing.  good atmosphere and the night i was there the cigar smoke wasn't too thick
author: Jo G.
